Provide your Senior Programming skills to data initiatives
There’s never been a better time to join ANZ; we’re flipping traditional banking on its head
Join one of NZ’s largest technology shops; offering huge scope for career opportunity
About the role
We have an exciting opportunity for a Senior Developer to join our Data and Analytics team.
You will work in an agile and collaborative team, working with other engineers and analysts to deliver industry leading technical platform and deployment solutions which are utilised by other Data scrum teams. You will bring modern development techniques and a continuous improvement mind-set to the team and be passionate about sharing these.
You will have the opportunity to share your knowledge grow those around you whilst also applying your skills to deliver continuous improvements to our platform and process. Your day to day will be spent iteratively delivering technical platform solutions as part of a scrum team. You will be passionate about and experienced in agile development practices such as CI/CD pipelines and Test Driven Development, and will help drive continuous improvement in our scrum teams.
You will be a fast learner with a solid technical background and enjoy learning new technologies and platforms.
You will be part of an awesome, collaborative team. You will be well-supported with opportunities for your personal development and growth. Put that into a great team that is growing and changing, and you might just have your ideal role!


Role Location: Wellington
Role Type: Permanent

About you
To be successful in this role, you will bring the following:
You will be a seasoned Senior Java Developer with well-developed technology domain knowledge required
Data warehousing experience preferred, however not essential.
Experience with CI/CD pipeline automation (Jenkins)
Experience or strong interest in DevOps / SRE teams
An understanding of Openshift
A technical knowledge and understanding of Unix commands
Strong Test Automation experience
Experience with Jenkins and Open
Positive can do attitude and an excellent communicator both written, verbal and visual
Problem solver, critical thinker, agile thinker with practical agile experience (Scrum beneficial)
Experience in assisting breaking down larger features in to small increments of work that can be delivered quicker
Growth Mind-set
Some of our other benefits include:
Various leave options, including family Leave, parental Leave (26 weeks fully paid), lifestyle Leave
Staff Banking and Insurance benefits
Dedicated online learning & development portal to develop your skills and career
Southern Cross Health Insurance
Applications close: Wednesday 26th February

About ANZ
Our purpose is to shape a world where people and communities thrive. That’s why we strive to create a balanced, sustainable economy in which everyone can take part and build a better life. By helping people make the most of what they have, we transform ideas, hard work and ambition into reality.
ANZ recognises the value of an inclusive and diverse work environment. We take pride in the diversity of our people and encourage applications from diverse candidates. Graduate Mechanical Engineer
Global business – Pioneering electronic technologies – Stimulating & challenging projects
Learn – Grow – Develop - Work alongside some of the best in the agri-tech sector
BE - Mechanical or Mechatronic & Solidworks CAD modelling experience essential
Set yourself up with career-enhancing engineering foundations; be part of project teams delivering world-class products; apply your technical talent.

About Datamars
Datamars’ purpose is to make a measurable difference by harnessing the power of data to measurably improve productivity and quality of life. We are global leaders in delivering integrated solutions in livestock management, animal health delivery, pet identification and reunification and textile identification. Our people, our legacy strength in technology, our closeness to customers and our quality products helps drive our success as we work towards an exciting, sustainable future.
Expect to be mentored and guided. There will be teamwork, challenges, forward-thinking, personal and career growth, complex technical projects and the opportunity to work alongside a highly experienced R & D team who will support your development and progression. With the right attitude and aptitude, this is an opportunity to carve out your future career path.
With an array of tasks and responsibilities you’ll contribute to mechanical development of new products; carrying out research on product, manufacturing and test technologies and reporting on feasibility and cost to implement these; provide engineering support to production in sustaining manufacturing and updating MRP system data; creating and updating product and component specification documents to ensure supply chain security; designing manufacturing jigs, fixtures and tools which enable efficient production; designing, planning and executing tests to verify compliance, reliability and performance of product and components.
We’re open to exploring highly motivated engineering grads with a genuine interest (both work and play!) in all things mechanical and technology-related.

About you
You may already be working with a year or two experience, or looking to kick off your first career opportunity and can demonstrate your strong work ethic, passion and initiative with your Uni projects and/or internships whilst completing your degree. You’ll be...
results-oriented,
have strong analytical skills,
be a clear communicator and influencer,
have a good understanding and
working knowledge of Solidworks CAD modelling and
ideally, have some practical exposure to working in a workshop environment.
Along with a competitive base salary, car parking and Kiwisaver contributions, you can expect a culture of respect, diversity, support in learning and personal growth combined with exposure to global markets, product design, engineering and manufacturing innovation and compelling career prospects.
Please apply online and we’ll be in touch to explore your potential.
For further insight in to our business check out our website www.datamars.com and follow us on LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/company/datamars-sa

Waipa Civil is a Cambridge based drainage and utilities installation company working throughout the greater Waikato Region for the past 7 years.We currently have an enthusiastic team of (60+) drainlayers, directional drillers, water service persons, digger operators,mechanics and engineers and skilled labourers.
We have a forward work load of 2 years + and are looking for experienced digger operators and drainlayers.
We are a progressive company and are looking for people who are motivated and want to be apart of our team culture. We own and operate all of our own plant and equipment including;
2 x 27 tonne Excavators2 x 14 tonne Excavators2 x 6 tonne excavators7 x 1.5-3t excavators7 directional drills ranging in size from 20,000lbs pull back to 100,000lbsstate of the art Polyethelene pipe Butt welding and Electrofusion welding gear with data loggers and GPS recording capabilities.onsite mechanical and engineering workshop carrying out pipe fabrication and plant repairs along with constructing specialist equipment ie pipe trailers.paperless based site management utilising Tablets and a cloud based data storage system.
You will be required to work in as part of a team and we are always looking for guys to put through training and up-skilling in their relevant fields.Required Skills
Full drivers licenseWaterpipe Installation/maintenance experienceConstruction background
Desirable Skills
Certifying DrainlayerClass 2 or 4 licenseW, T, R
Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Job Description:
DXC Technology (NYSE: DXC) is the world's leading independent, end-to-end IT services company, helping clients harness the power of innovation to thrive on change. Created by the merger of CSC and the Enterprise Services business of Hewlett Packard Enterprise, DXC Technology serves nearly 6,000 private and public sector clients across 70 countries. The company's technology independence, global talent and extensive partner alliance combine to deliver powerful next-generation IT services and solutions. DXC Technology is recognized among the best corporate citizens globally. For more information, visit http://www.dxc.technology/.
The Azure Developer/data engineer is a highly performant engineer responsible for delivering Cloud based Analytical Solutions at our clients. This role will work with customers and leading internal engineering teams in delivering data solutions on cloud. Using Azure public cloud and on premise / hybrid technologies, our Data Engineer professionals implement state of the art, scalable, high performance Data solutions.
You must be a New Zealand citizen and New Zealand Defence security clearance should be held or be prepared to apply.

Role & Responsibilities
Provide expertise and hands on delivery of data capture, curation and consumption pipelines on AZURE and other databases.
Ability to build cloud data solutions and provide domain perspective on storage, big data platform services, serverless architectures, RDBMS, DW/DM and NoSQL databases.
Follow design patterns and architectures as defined by DXC and Microsoft architects and Build full technology stack of services required including PaaS (Platform as-a-service), IaaS (Infrastructure as-a-service), SaaS (software as-a-service), operations, management and automation.
Apply DXC methodology, DXC reusable assets, and previous work experience to delivery consistently high-quality work.
Stay educated on new and emerging technologies/patterns/methodologies and market offerings that may be of interest to our clients.
Adapt to existing methods and procedures to create possible alternative solutions to moderately complex problems.
Understand the strategic direction set by senior management as it relates to team goals.
Primary upward interaction is with direct supervisor. May interact with peers and/or management levels at a client and/or within DXC. Establish methods and procedures
on new assignments with guidance.
Wellington based; however, travel may be required
Qualifications
Basic Qualifications
At least 3 years of consulting or client service delivery experience on Azure
At least 3 years of experience in developing data ingestion, data processing and analytical pipelines for relational databases, NoSQL and data warehouse solutions
Minimum of 3 years of hands-on experience in Azure and Big Data technologies such as Powershell, C#, Java, Node.js, Python, SQL, ADLS/Blob, Spark/SparkSQL, Hive/MR, Pig, Oozie and streaming technologies such as Kafka, EventHub, NiFI etc.
Hands-on experience implementing data migration and data processing using Azure services: Container, Storage, Azure Functions, Serverless Architecture, ARM Templates, Azure SQL DB/DW, Data Factory, Azure Stream Analytics, Azure Analysis Service, Databricks Azure Data Catalog,etc.
Cloud migration methodologies and processes including tools like Azure Data Factory, Event Hub, etc.
3+ years of hands on experience in programming languages such as Java, c#, node.js, python, pyspark, spark, SQL, Unix shell/Perl scripting etc.
Minimum of 3 years of RDBMS experience
Experience working with Developer tools such as Visual Studio, GitLabs, Jenkins, etc.
Bachelors or higher degree in Computer Science or a related discipline.
Candidate ideally will Have Completed The Following Certifications
MCSA Cloud Platform (Azure) Training & Certification
MCSE Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Training & Certification
Nice-to-Have Skills/Qualifications
DevOps on an Azure platform
Experience developing and deploying ETL solutions on Azure
IoT, event-driven, microservices, containers/Kubernetes in the cloud
Familiarity with the technology stack available in the industry for metadata management: Data Governance, Data Quality, MDM, Lineage, Data Catalog etc.
Familiarity with the Technology stack available in the industry for data management, data ingestion, capture, processing and curation: Kafka, StreamSets, Attunity, GoldenGate, Map Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Hbase, Cassandra, Spark, Flume, Hive, Impala, etc.
Multi-cloud experience a plus - Azure, AWS, Google
Professional Skill Requirements
Proven ability to work in a team-oriented environment
Proven ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment
Desire to work in an information systems environment
Excellent communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skills
Excellent organizational, multi-tasking, and time-management skills

What is this opportunity about?
As a Junior Data Engineer you will be primarily focused with converting, manipulating and sanitising large data from a range of data sources (MySQL, Microsoft SQL Server, PostgreSQL etc). You will have access to training and daily use of the latest and greatest cloud technology offered by AWS.
This role and mission will be no mean feat so you will need plenty of gas in the tank and a great toolbox of ideas and tricks to get the outcomes the platform will need in the future to be successful.
Some of the challenges you will face:
Migrating several years worth of data from veterinary practice management systems into ezyVet
Interacting with many different database engines beyond the common ones that you are used to
Transforming significant amounts of data to match specifications
The tempo is quick and multi tasking is a must!
Desired skills and experience (the boring bits):
Proven person of action & delivery focused
Excellent collaborator and communicator
Experience with databases - i.e. MySQL, MSSQL, PostgreSQL
Strong attention to detail with relentless follow up
Excited by the idea of GBs of data flowing through at light speed
Extra: an understanding of cloud platforms
Perks of the job:
Laptop provided that is yours to use freely
Monday café breakfasts for early-birds
Free healthy lunch Monday to Thursday
A barista quality coffee machine
Get to work in an exciting ever changing environment that's winning on a global scale
An opportunity to drive and progress your career like nowhere else, we are here to support you and you are your only obstacle
About ezyVet
With a little kiwi ingenuity and a lot of passion, ezyVet came into existence. A cloud-based, feature rich software solution for Veterinary Practices all around the world. ezyVet is quietly disrupting the global veterinary industry. With customers in over 20 countries, 120+ staff across offices in London, Dallas and Auckland, there’s no better time than now to join the ezyVet journey.

Working at TSB Bank
Our people are proud to belong to a 100% independent NZ owned Bank and proud to see
the results of their efforts invested back into New Zealand. Our people can see the impact
of their work benefitting New Zealanders as they work towards the banks purpose: Helping
New Zealanders get ahead by making banking really easy. Every time. Everywhere.

Our strong corporate values: One Team, People First, Integrity, Innovation, Keep it Simple
set our standards and set us apart. We demonstrate our People First value through the
distribution of our profit for the benefit of others and by providing our employees with a
place to belong, grow, and be recognized.

We work together as a One Team community to ensure a sustainable future and we
encourage every employee to have a voice and be an active participant in our success.
We aim to create remarkable experiences for our people just as our people create
remarkable experiences for our customers.


Role Dimensions

Reports to: Head of Integration & Data
Department: Technology Services
Job Family: Technical Specialist
Location: New Plymouth
Direct Reports: N/A
Total Employees: 20+
Purpose of role

The purpose of this role is to support, enhance and develop the Bank’s Business Intelligence
platform and ensure high levels of data quality and integrity are maintained across the Bank’s
systems. Working within the Integration & Data team, you will be responsible for supporting
data flows between the BI platform and internal operational systems as well as external third-
party systems. You will also be responsible for supporting the systems required for the business
to do Analytics & Reporting. The role is multidisciplinary with elements of software
development, system design and tech ops.

Specifically, you will:
Build, maintain and evolve the business intelligence platform, and regularly re-assess the
best-of-breed for the requirements of TSB Bank.
Document and maintain a road-map for the supported data flows and technology.
Ensure monitoring and support procedures are in-place for:
o Incoming and outgoing feeds
o Transformation processes
o Data retention
o Data access permissions
Collaborate with Operations and use a shared tool-set (Service Desk) to respond to
incidents and manage resolutions.
Exchange ideas with Operations to understand requirements for monitoring/support.
Regularly feedback learnings and ensure that operations are aware of the road-map.
Follow the Change Management processes to ensure that changes are transparent and
adhere to company standards

Generic Responsibilities
Keep up to date with and comply with all Bank policy and procedures.
At all times demonstrate the Bank’s core values:
o Integrity
o Innovation
o People First
o Keep it Simple
o One team
Make use of the Bank’s communication channels, particularly the intranet, to ensure
that your workplace knowledge is up to date and that you are aware of changes as they
occur.
Embrace change and act as a change agent –accepting, embedding and reinforcing
change in the workplace.
Comply with all health and safety polices, directions and instructions and ensure that in
the performance of duties not to undermine own health and safety or the health and
safety of any other person. Be continually mindful of the Bank’s Health and Safety Policy:
o No business objective will take priority over health and safety.
o o All incidents are preventable.
o Whilst management have ultimate accountability, we all have responsibility for
health, safety and wellness.
o All employees have the responsibility to stop any job they believe is unsafe or
cannot be continued in a safe manner.

Person Specification

Qualifications
A bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience

Experience
Experience with OLTP database technologies (My SQL, SQL Server) as well as Data
Warehousing solutions (Azure DWH, Redshift)
Factory 5+ years’ experience with software development, especially scripting languages
with Python in particular
2+ years’ experience with virtualization and container technologies (VMware, Docker or
Rancher)
Solid understanding of system design and architectural patterns
Experience in defining data models, problem management and support procedures
Experience in environments with high transaction and batch processing loads
Experience in running operational systems and troubleshooting issues under pressure
Experience with ETL or other data flow management tools (Apache Airflow, SSIS, Azure
Data)
Experience with managing fleets of Linux servers, preferably with configuration
management tools like Ansible
Platform and language agnostic approach in delivering solutions for our customers
Experience in cloud infrastructure management (AWS, Azure) would be beneficial

Required attributes:
These are your personal qualities which, combined with your skills and experience, will
make you a stand-out performer in this role.

Collaborative - Good at collaborating with business specialists, designers and
developers to envision and iterate concepts. You must also appreciate ambiguity and
value creative conflict in support of strong design and outcomes.
Innovative - Good at initiating or taking creative ideas of others to market, and
displays good judgment about which creative ideas and suggestions will work.
Self-learning - Quickly grasps the essence and the underlying structure of anything,
analyses both successes and failures and suggests improvement. Seeks out learning
opportunities and keeps self-current on technology practices.
Solves Problems - Uses rigorous logic & methods to solve difficult problems with
effective solutions.
Action Orientated - Enjoys working hard – action orientated and full of energy for
the things you see as challenging. Ability to work on multiple projects at once,
prioritising tasks and deliverables and managing expectations accordingly.
Deals with Ambiguity - Is able to effectively cope with change and can shift gears
comfortably. Is able to decide and act without having the total picture, and doesn’t
get upset when things are up in the air. It is important that you are able to
comfortably handle risk and uncertainty.
Business Acumen - Knows the competition and is aware of how strategies and tactics
work in the marketplace. Knowledgeable in current and potential future policies,
practices, trends, technology, and information, affecting businesses and
organizations and can mitigate risks with creative solutions.
Strong Communication - Is able to clearly and succinctly communicate in a variety of
settings and styles. Can get the messages across to influence the desired outcome.

From time to time there may be additional activity not contained within this position description
that the appointee is to complete in the interests of the appointment and their own personal
development.

This position description provides a broad overview of responsibilities. The position description
is a living document and the Bank reserves the right to amend from time to time as required.

Geotechnical at Beca
Developing and implementing solutions to complex problems, our team is helping to shape the world we live in across the Asia Pacific region – from highways to airports; from buildings and reservoirs to bridges to tunnels. We offer the opportunity to build a career path within a fascinating industry, in a business line that offers variety, challenge and tremendous growth potential.

We embrace the fact that people are our greatest asset. It’s our people that set us apart, and who our clients keep coming back to. Passionate about what we do and the culture we have developed, we believe that key to our success is the teamwork and collaboration fostered, right across the Beca Group. It’s this culture that allows us to deliver excellence in technical delivery, client service and innovation in all that we do.

The Opportunity
To be part of our exciting growth, we are looking for a Geotechnical Engineer in our Wellington team. As part of a national Geotechnical team, you will have the opportunity to work on small to large projects in the region and across New Zealand.
You can expect every day to look different but overall you can expect to be:
Managing and delivering projects with support from our technical specialists
Liaising with clients and project management
Plan and execute field assignments such as soil sampling, borehole/test pit logging and drilling guidance
Prepare technical proposals and reports with senior review
Carry out projects under the general direction of senior professionals
Undertake geotechnical/geological investigations and reporting
Assisting with or carrying out various data analysis and interpretation
About You
You will have a Bachelor's degree (Master’s degree would be advantageous) in civil or geotechnical engineering, ideally from a consultancy background, have strong written and verbal communication skills, an enthusiasm for fieldwork and a willingness to constantly learn and develop.
What we offer
A career with Beca will provide you with:
Professional development opportunities
A supportive and caring work environment where you can bring your whole self to work
Support with relocation and immigration to suitable applicants
Flexible working arrangements to balance your personal / family commitments.
Opportunities to learn from our industry experts and technical gurus across the Asia-Pacific
Highly supportive environment of sharing and collaboration
Excellent benefits provided to all staff – including discounted health insurance, discounts on gym memberships, and a huge number of social club events
Beca prides itself on supporting a diverse and inclusive culture – open to inputs from creative people of all genders, ethnicity, identity, thought and experiences.
Ready to make the move?
If you want to make everyday better, apply online today! If you have any questions, call Autumn English – Talent Acquisition Business Partner on +64 9 336 5954.
About Beca
Our clients do incredible things every day. They are transforming communities and changing lives, and we are right there alongside them.
Beca is one of the largest employee-owned professional services consultancies in the Asia-Pacific region. Our team of 3000-plus is diverse enough to bring a wide range of perspectives and expertise to every client and challenge, creating resourceful, smart solutions from our collective experience and insights.
While our experience has been 99 years in the making, it’s the fresh talent we’re nurturing, the innovative thinking we’re developing and the connections that we’re forging that get us most excited for the future. www.beca.com.

With a little kiwi ingenuity and a lot of passion, ezyVet came into existence. With customers in over 20 countries, 120+ staff across offices in London, Dallas and Auckland, there’s no better time than now to join the ezyVet journey.

We're looking for a Service Engineer to join our Technical Services Delivery team supporting our Telco and IT Customers.
This is a busy and exciting role! You'll need a good background in networking with a smattering of desktop experience. Most of all you will need to come armed with a desire to learn and grow in the industry. The work is dynamic, with one day servicing WIFI systems at an All Blacks game, supporting our Defence Forces, installing new Networks in Schools and many more hands-on jobs with Sparks Customers.

First response to Customer Issues including being part of the after-hours on call roster
Develop skills and knowledge on specific industry Technologies - All of Government, Data centres, Hospitals, Schools, and Infrastructure Companies
Identify issues, provide facts, education and insights to frontline, external service companies
Have you got what it takes to rise to a challenge and forge a career in Telecommunication?
Be a truly customer inspired and focussed person with the right attitude to always put our customers first.
Previous customer service and some ICT experience preferably with a background in Field Delivery and End User Computing. Resilience and perseverance are your middle names - You thrive in fast paced environments where things change daily.

Evidence of being a lifelong learner and an aptitude toward digital technologies and some pretty savvy ICT skills. CCNA Qualification desired but not essential. The ability to multi task between multiple systems while having a conversation with your customer.
This is a fast paced environment where things change regularly so you need to be adaptable and enjoy a challenge!
Be a team player … a collaborator!

Job_title: Windows System Engineer - Level 2 or Level 3
Summary:
Are you passionate about Windows, data and IT in general?
Keen to develop enthusiasm in a new and exciting environment?
Do you feel like you could be advancing your skills?
If the answer to these questions is yes, you need to seriously consider working for us at our Wellington office!
This opportunity will give you the chance to expand into other technology areas while being part of an organisation that is committed to the security and well-being of New Zealand.
Our Technology Directorate delivers technology for the Government Communications Security Bureau (GCSB), New Zealand Security Intelligence Service (NZSIS) and the wider security and intelligence sector. Our purpose is to ensure that mission requirements are met today and in the future – realising positive outcomes for New Zealand.

What you'll bring to the position:
A passion for Windows, including system admin skills
Platform knowledge
Scripting and programming
Virtualisation technology experience
Complex multi-server processing system knowledge
Storage and web technology experience
Joining a technology centric team, who collectively do amazing things with information technology, you should also be enthusiastic solving complex problems on your own. Some formal training such as a tertiary qualification would be helpful, but we're interested in relevant work experience or even a long term obsession!
We refer to a person with this expertise as a Cryptologic Engineer. Don't let the word ‘Cryptologic' spook you (see what we did there!). It's not code breaking but you can expect to do some unique things with your computing / networking / problem solving skills.

What you get from us:
Unique and extremely interesting work that you won't get to do anywhere else
Career and development opportunities
Supportive team environment
Competitive salary appropriate to qualifications and experience
Free health care and on-site gym
Active social club
Level 2 salary from $79,797 to $119,695
(Midpoint of the salary range is $99,746 reflecting full competence in the role)
Level 3 salary from $93,497 to $140,245
(Midpoint of the salary range is $116,871 reflecting full competence in the role)
A position description can be found on our website.
How to apply
Applications must include a completed application form, a current CV and cover letter. These should be sent to careers@nzic.govt.nz quoting reference number C2/20/36 and placing your full name in the subject line of the email. Only completed applications will be progressed.
Please direct any enquiries regarding this role to careers@nzic.govt.nz
To be eligible for employment within the NZIC you must have been a NZ citizen for at least 10 years. Alternatively you must hold NZ Permanent Residence or hold a current NZ Residency Class Visa and have been a citizen of UK, USA, Canada or Australia for at least 10 years.
You must be able to obtain and maintain a high level security clearance. Ordinarily to obtain this level of clearance candidates must have a 15 year checkable background in countries where meaningful and reliable checks can be undertaken. Where requisite checks are unable to be made, the candidate application may not be able to be progressed.
Applications close 4 March 2020.
The NZIC treats all applications for employment in the strictest confidence and we ask that you maintain a similar level of confidentiality. You are expected to exercise discretion during the recruitment process and throughout your career.

Job_title: Forward Deployed Software Engineer, New Grad
Summary:
A World-Changing Company

At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.

The Role

Forward Deployed Software Engineers (FDSEs) build creative technical solutions to our customers' hardest problems. Organizations often come to us with nebulous questions, like “Why has our assembly line slowed down?” or “How can we find money launderers financing terrorism?” FDSEs lead the process of finding answers.

As an FDSE, you'll be part of a small team of fellow FDSEs and Deployment Strategists supporting a single customer in the government or commercial space. Like at a startup, you'll make decisions about how to take on the challenges your customer poses, from the nature of the data to the user population to the legacy system environment. You'll have a large company behind you — namely, software built and maintained by hundreds of Software Engineers who build scalable, reliable platforms for you to customize and extend.

You'll start by unpacking a problem and learning about the customer's data, then move to high-level system design and prototyping. Then you're ready to deploy Palantir software, develop custom applications, and integrate the data. Along the way, you'll collaborate with technical and non-technical individuals - from Palantir and from our customers - to define and achieve goals. You'll iterate with customer users and stakeholders on a rapid cadence. You'll also work with Palantir's Product Development team on the roadmaps for our core products.

With Palantir products as your baseline, you will leverage any technology you need to drive impact. It doesn't matter what languages you know when you join us, but it does matter that you can pick new languages up quickly. We often face entirely novel problems, so solving them may require expanding your skillset. For example, we currently use:

A variety of languages, including Java and Go for back end and Typescript for front end
Open-source technologies like Cassandra, Spark, ElasticSearch, React, and Redux
Industry-standard build tooling, including Gradle, Webpack, and Github

And if what you need doesn't exist yet? Go build it.

A career as an FDSE is an opportunity to gain rare insight into the world's most important institutions and industries, and to grow more quickly than you imagined you could. As you rotate among teams, you'll dive deep into domains such as intelligence, energy, health, finance, and law enforcement. You'll learn from experts in these fields about their problems and the tradeoffs they must consider in order to solve them. Questions that seem simple from the outside will quickly become complex as you consider the nuances and consequences of every possible answer.
What We Value
Strong engineering background, preferred in fields such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Software Engineering, Physics.
Familiarity with data structures, storage systems, cloud infrastructure, front-end frameworks, and other technical tools.
Proficiency with programming languages such as Java, C++, Python, JavaScript, or similar languages.
Ability to collaborate and empathize with a variety of individuals. You can iterate with users and non-technical stakeholders and understand how your technical decisions impact them.
Demonstrated ability to learn and work independently and make decisions with minimal supervision.
Willingness and interest to travel as needed.
Requirements
Security clearance or the ability to obtain a clearance.
If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations@palantir.com.

Asset Engineer - Tauranga
We have several fantastic opportunities for Asset Engineers to join our high performing and social Tauranga team. Due to our long-term partnerships with the NZ Transport Agency and local authority clients we have a strong pipeline of work across the region and are looking for analytical minds to join us!
The opportunity
As an Asset Engineer, you’ll be part of our road asset management team. The team delivers asset management planning, analysis, forward works programming, pavement design, asset data collection surveys, asset database management and asset valuations for roading and other transportation assets.
We’re a collaborative and dedicated team spread across different career levels so there is great mentoring support and opportunities to take ownership of your personal growth and development.
Your responsibilities will be to support the senior asset managers and engineers in providing professional advice to our clients to effectively and efficiently manage their roading networks.
Day to day activities in this role will range from:
Analysing asset data to inform good decisions
Supporting the development of forward works programmes
Failure mode analysis and treatment selection
Preparing reports on asset performance, condition and effectiveness of investment
Net Present Value analysis
Supporting the delivery of asset data collection activities and surveys
Designing pavement rehabilitation and thin asphaltic concrete treatments
Working with the team to improve processes
Supporting with asset revaluation
Database management; inputting and checking to ensure high quality data
Developing positive relationships with our clients and working with them to find solutions to their problems
About you
The ideal candidate will hold a bachelor’s degree, or equivalent, in a relevant engineer field and have a technical awareness of asset management systems and processes. An understanding of roading assets, particularly road surfacing and pavement construction and performance would be an advantage. Good interpersonal skills are necessary for both interacting with our clients and working within the team.
Your experience and attributes will include:
Effective and clear communication skills, both written and verbal, to a variety of audiences of varying technical nature
A ‘doer’ who love seeing projects from ideation through to delivery
A team player who enjoys working in a consulting environment with a diverse range of stakeholders to collaboratively identify the best solution for the client
Able to consider multiple options, identify risks and problem solve throughout the project lifecycle
You are known for being an open-minded and innovative thinker
A natural multi-tasker who enjoys balancing a broad range of responsibilities
A fast learner who wants to learn new systems and processes
Proficient in Microsoft office packages
A good approach to health and safety and how to work safely
Some travel and field work is required as part of this role, as such a full and clean driver’s license is essential.
What we offer
Beca prides itself on supporting a diverse and inclusive culture – open to inputs from creative people of all genders, ethnicity, identity, thought and experiences.
A supportive and caring work environment where you can bring your whole self to work
Diverse opportunities for career and professional development
Flexible working arrangements to balance your personal / family commitments
Highly supportive environment of sharing and collaboration
Excellent benefits including discounted health insurance, gym memberships, an outstanding parental leave policy, and a huge range of social events
Apply now
If you have an analytical mind and enjoy finding innovative approaches to solving problems, challenging the status quo, developing solutions to help our clients and working as part of a team with a great track record then we would be keen to hear from you.
For further information about the role, contact Autumn English, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, on +64 9 336 5954, or apply online today!
To find out more about Beca, our purpose, people and projects, visit www.beca.com

So, when we take on a project, we see the opportunity to make a lasting connection with the people and places where we live and work.

Foodies is on an awesome journey to become a truly customer insights-driven and efficient Co-op, and one that is digitally enabled. Write business code that drives our Online customer experience as well as the optimal execution of our most critical Enterprise business processes

Job Summary
We are recruiting a Senior Geotechnical Engineer to join our well established and growing Auckland Office. This role offers you an exciting opportunity to contribute to the success of our 40 strong national Ground Engineering team, to work with and support colleagues from a variety of engineering and environmental disciplines and to assist in the growth of our Ground Engineering and Tunnelling team.
We are looking for an ambitious team player who is looking for an opportunity to assist in the development of innovative, cost-effective and buildable solutions in an environment that is collaborative, stimulating and fast-paced. Your extensive geotechnical consultancy experience, in particular, strong capability in geotechnical studies, investigation, and design for highway earthworks, bridge foundations, retaining structures and strengthened earthworks will add to our teams existing strengths.
Nationally our Ground Engineering team provides one-stop access to services ranging from project management, feasibility studies, detailed design, contract administration and construction supervision for geotechnical works.
You will provide technical support to both internal and external clients to a high level of technical quality, to programme and budget
Utilize your expertise to apply advanced scientific principles, theories, practices and existing technologies develop technical solutions to complex problems
Interpret and record data, conducts analyses, compare findings to relevant studies and local, provincial and national regulations to ensure compliance
Undertake design and reporting of a wide variety of geotechnical works including geological and geomorphological mapping, slope stability, foundations, retaining structures, earthworks and ground improvement
Conduct research and investigation as required.
Plan and organize project studies
Assist in resolving conflicting technical information and unsuitability of standard procedures
Perform complex assignments requiring the development of unique solutions to problems.
May oversee the work of less experienced scientists.
Minimum Requirements
Experienced Geotechnical Engineer with a proven track record in studies, investigations and geotechnical design, in particular for new build transportation infrastructure.
Possess strong problem solving and interpersonal skills.
Strong written and verbal communication skills; the ability to write clear and concise technical reports is essential.
In-depth knowledge and experience of relevant design standards.
Ensures that Health and Safety issues are addressed throughout the life of a project.
In-depth hands-on experience of routinely used geotechnical software including gINT, Slope/W, SLIDE and Plaxis; GIS or Geospatial skills desirable.
In-depth knowledge of a wide variety of ground conditions and of soil and rock design parameter selection; local knowledge and experience is advantageous.
Valid driving licence is essential.
Willing to travel to other offices and sites within NZ is essential, and a willing to consider overseas assignments preferred.
Preferred Qualifications
Geotechnical Engineering are preferred, although Engineering Geologists with appropriate design skills will be considered.
What We Offer
When you join AECOM, you become part of a company that is
pioneering the future . Our teams around the world are involved in some of the most cutting-edge and innovative projects and programs of our time, addressing the big challenges of today and shaping the built environment for generations to come. We ensure a workplace that encourages growth, flexibility and creativity, as well as a company culture that champions
inclusion, diversity and overall
employee well-being through programs supported by company leadership. Our
core values define who we are, how we act and what we aspire to, which comes down to not only
delivering a better world , but working to “make amazing happen” in each neighborhood, community and city we touch. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.

About us
We’re a team of 22,000 New Zealanders in a growing network of 300+ stores (PAK’nSAVE, New World, Four Square, Gilmours & Fresh Collective). We serve over 1.3 million customers every week in the most awesome little country in the world!

What you’ll be doing...
Verizon Connect is guiding a connected world on the go by automating, optimizing and revolutionizing the way people, vehicles and things move through the world. Our full suite of industry-defining solutions and services put innovation, automation and connected data to work for customers and help them be safer, more efficient and more productive. With more than 3,500 dedicated employees in 15 countries, we deliver leading mobile technology platforms and solutions.
As a SaaS leader, we know our talent is the most important component to our success. We hire top talent and empower them to do their best work. As a division of Verizon, we combine the fun and excitement of a startup environment with the resources, operational excellence, and brand recognition of an established tech giant.
You will lead a dynamic and successful team in our Christchurch office, continuously adapting and improving our methodologies and technologies to be the best at what we do: provide innovative tracking software to trucking companies all around the world. This team is responsible for maintaining and enhancing two native mobile apps (iOS and Android) as well as a legacy hybrid mobile app, and works closely with the API team and other teams within a wider group focused on regulatory compliance solutions. You will be working primarily with Java, Swift, Kotlin and Typescript.
Writing high-quality code - we expect a Squad Lead to lead by example in every area, none more so than in the hands-on development of our products.
Leading a cross-functional team using code on multiple platforms.
Managing deployments and testing.
Ensuring that the team is actively contributing to and reacting to automation tests.
Ensuring that code written to a high standard and ensuring a robust code review process is in place.
Educating the team on best practices, workflows, and other processes.
Optimising your squad’s specific needs and strengths.
What we’re looking for...
You’ll need to have:
Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience.
Four or more years of relevant work experience.
Experience in agile/lean methodologies and processes (ideally Kanban) leading process improvements and engineering disciplines.
Experience mentoring junior developers.
Experience in measuring and improving performance of production systems.
Knowledge of Object Oriented/SOLID Design principles and practices.
Experience with common patterns in distributed systems (REST, SOA, and DDD).
Knowledge of GIT or related source control technology.
Even better if you have:
A degree in Computer Science or a related field.
Mobile application development experience.
Knowledge of AWS based architectures and services.
Oral and written communication skills, including the ability to effectively present to engineering and product groups.
Ability to lead systems analysis with application design individually and with an architecture team to deliver detailed application specifications.
Ability to lead and guide a team.
Keyword: VZConnect
When you join Verizon...
You’ll have the power to go beyond – doing the work that’s transforming how people, businesses and things connect with each other. Not only do we provide the fastest and most reliable network for our customers, but we were first to 5G - a quantum leap in connectivity. Our connected solutions are making communities stronger and enabling energy efficiency. Here, you’ll have the ability to make an impact and create positive change. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, join our team of the best and brightest. We offer great pay, amazing benefits and opportunity to learn and grow in every role. Together we’ll go far.

A World-Changing Company

At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role

Forward Deployed Software Engineers (FDSEs) understand our customers’ greatest pain points and design end-to-end solutions to address them. FDSEs solicit constant feedback on their work from both customers and colleagues, improving our products over time with rapid iteration cycles.

FDSEs deploy ground breaking technical solutions to solve our customers’ hardest problems. Projects often start with a nebulous question like “Why are we losing customers?” or “How can we more effectively identify instances of money laundering?” FDSEs lead the way in developing a solution, from high-level system design and prototyping to application development and data integration. As an FDSE, you leverage everything around you: Palantir products, open source technologies, and anything you and your team can build to drive real impact.

You work with customers around the globe, where you gain rare insight into the world’s most important industries and institutions. We help our customers detect insider trading, improve disaster relief, fight healthcare fraud, and more. Each mission presents different challenges, from the regulatory environment to the nature of the data to the user population. You will work to accommodate all aspects of an environment to drive real technical outcomes for our customers.
Technologies We Use
Core Palantir products provide the foundations for our deployments.
Custom applications built on top of core Palantir platforms.
Postgres, Cassandra, Hadoop, and Spark for distributed data storage and parallel computing.
Java and Groovy for our back-end applications and data integration tools.
Typescript, React, Leaflet, and d3 for our web technologies.
Python for data processing and analysis.
Palantir cloud infrastructure based on AWS EC2 and S3.
Our Principles
Impact: We take on meaningful and challenging projects that change the world for the better.
Dedication: We see projects through from beginning to end in spite of obstacles we may encounter.
Collaboration: We work internally with people from a variety of backgrounds — such as other FDSEs, product teams, and Deployment Strategists. We also work externally with our customers, often on site, to understand and solve their problems.
Trust: We trust each other to effectively manage time and priorities—we don't micromanage. We want to give people the space to think for themselves.
Growth: We push ourselves and our peers to improve themselves and the world around them.
Learning: We often face entirely novel problems, where we need to pick up a lot of new information and learn how to use it to make progress.
What We Value
Strong engineering background, preferred in fields such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Software Engineering, Physics.
Familiarity with data structures, storage systems, cloud infrastructure, front-end frameworks, and other technical tools.
Understanding of how technical decisions impact the user of what you’re building.
Proficiency with programming languages such as Java, C++, Python, JavaScript, or similar languages.
Ability to work effectively in teams of technical and non-technical individuals.
Skill and comfort working in a rapidly changing environment with dynamic objectives and iteration with users.
Demonstrated ability to continuously learn, work independently, and make decisions with minimal supervision.
Willingness and interest to travel as needed.
Requirements
Security clearance or the ability to obtain a clearance.
If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations@palantir.com.

A key skill of yours will be your strong interpersonal skills that you’ve honed interacting with clients and diverse teams.
Your experience and attributes will include:
Able to consider multiple options, identify risks and problem solve throughout the project lifecycle
An understanding of pavement design and materials testing
Experience with data analysis and reporting
STMS Level 2/3 NP is an advantage
Understanding of condition surveys associated with asset management programming and planning
Proficient in Microsoft office packages
Working knowledge of the suite of RAMM software including RAMM, RAMM Network Manager, RAMM Manager and RAMM Contractor would be an advantage
Effective and clear communication skills, both written and verbal, to a variety of audiences of varying technical nature
A ‘doer’ who loves seeing projects from ideation through to delivery
A team player who enjoys working in a consulting environment with a diverse range of stakeholders to collaboratively identify the best solution for the client
A fast learner who wants to learn new systems and processes
A good approach to health and safety and how to work safely
Some travel and fieldwork is required as part of this role, as such a full and clean driver’s license is essential.
What we offer
Beca prides itself on supporting a diverse and inclusive culture – open to inputs from creative people of all genders, ethnicity, identity, thought and experiences.
A supportive and caring work environment where you can bring your whole self to work
Diverse opportunities for career and professional development
Flexible working arrangements to balance your personal / family commitments
Highly supportive environment of sharing and collaboration
Excellent benefits including discounted health insurance, gym memberships, an outstanding parental leave policy, and a huge range of social events
Apply now
If you have an analytical mind and enjoy finding innovative approaches to solving problems, challenging the status quo, developing solutions to help our clients and working as part of a team with a great track record then we would be keen to hear from you.
For further information about the role, contact Autumn English, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, on +64 9 336 5954, or apply online today!
To find out more about Beca, our purpose, people and projects, visit www.beca.com.

Job_title: Windows System Engineer - Level 2 or Level 3
Summary:
Are you passionate about Windows, data and IT in general?
Keen to develop enthusiasm in a new and exciting environment?
Do you feel like you could be advancing your skills?
If the answer to these questions is yes, you need to seriously consider working for us at our Wellington office!
This opportunity will give you the chance to expand into other technology areas while being part of an organisation that is committed to the security and well-being of New Zealand.
Our Technology Directorate delivers technology for the Government Communications Security Bureau (GCSB), New Zealand Security Intelligence Service (NZSIS) and the wider security and intelligence sector. Our purpose is to ensure that mission requirements are met today and in the future – realising positive outcomes for New Zealand.

What you'll bring to the position:
A passion for Windows, including system admin skills
Platform knowledge
Scripting and programming
Virtualisation technology experience
Complex multi-server processing system knowledge
Storage and web technology experience
Joining a technology centric team, who collectively do amazing things with information technology, you should also be enthusiastic solving complex problems on your own. Some formal training such as a tertiary qualification would be helpful, but we're interested in relevant work experience or even a long term obsession!
We refer to a person with this expertise as a Cryptologic Engineer. Don't let the word ‘Cryptologic' spook you (see what we did there!). It's not code breaking but you can expect to do some unique things with your computing / networking / problem solving skills.

What you get from us:
Unique and extremely interesting work that you won't get to do anywhere else
Career and development opportunities
Supportive team environment
Competitive salary appropriate to qualifications and experience
Free health care and on-site gym
Active social club
Level 2 salary from $79,797 to $119,695
(Midpoint of the salary range is $99,746 reflecting full competence in the role)
Level 3 salary from $93,497 to $140,245
(Midpoint of the salary range is $116,871 reflecting full competence in the role)
A position description can be found on our website.
How to apply
Applications must include a completed application form, a current CV and cover letter. These should be sent to careers@nzic.govt.nz quoting reference number C2/20/36 and placing your full name in the subject line of the email. Only completed applications will be progressed.
Please direct any enquiries regarding this role to careers@nzic.govt.nz
To be eligible for employment within the NZIC you must have been a NZ citizen for at least 10 years. Alternatively you must hold NZ Permanent Residence or hold a current NZ Residency Class Visa and have been a citizen of UK, USA, Canada or Australia for at least 10 years.
You must be able to obtain and maintain a high level security clearance. Ordinarily to obtain this level of clearance candidates must have a 15 year checkable background in countries where meaningful and reliable checks can be undertaken. Where requisite checks are unable to be made, the candidate application may not be able to be progressed.
Applications close 4 March 2020.
The NZIC treats all applications for employment in the strictest confidence and we ask that you maintain a similar level of confidentiality. You are expected to exercise discretion during the recruitment process and throughout your career.

We're looking for a Service Engineer to join our Technical Services Delivery team supporting our Telco and IT Customers.
This is a busy and exciting role! You'll need a good background in networking with a smattering of desktop experience. Most of all you will need to come armed with a desire to learn and grow in the industry. The work is dynamic, with one day servicing WIFI systems at an All Blacks game, supporting our Defence Forces, installing new Networks in Schools and many more hands-on jobs with Sparks Customers.
The functions of the role include, but not limited to:

Work efficiently and with accuracy to update all systems with the latest information from external service companies
First response to Customer Issues including being part of the after-hours on call roster
Develop skills and knowledge on specific industry Technologies - All of Government, Data centres, Hospitals, Schools, and Infrastructure Companies
Identify issues, provide facts, education and insights to frontline, external service companies
Have you got what it takes to rise to a challenge and forge a career in Telecommunication?
Be a truly customer inspired and focussed person with the right attitude to always put our customers first.
Previous customer service and some ICT experience preferably with a background in Field Delivery and End User Computing. Resilience and perseverance are your middle names - You thrive in fast paced environments where things change daily.

Evidence of being a lifelong learner and an aptitude toward digital technologies and some pretty savvy ICT skills. CCNA Qualification desired but not essential. The ability to multi task between multiple systems while having a conversation with your customer.
This is a fast paced environment where things change regularly so you need to be adaptable and enjoy a challenge!
Be a team player … a collaborator!

At Trustpower we are proud to say that our roots stretch back almost 100 years and we've remained 100% New Zealand owned and operated. We are one of the largest companies on the NZX and our reputation for innovation is showcased by our new Head Office, which is designed around the concept of Activity Based Working; a creative way of working which promotes flexibility, and enables collaboration between individuals and teams.
The Role
We are looking for an experienced Asset Engineer with leadership, collaboration and relationship building skills to join our Engineering and Development team. The Asset Engineer will take a lead in developing the strategic direction for managing our broad and diverse portfolio of generation assets.
Duties
Development, and continuing improvement of the asset management framework
Lead and coordinate development of asset management plans and asset expenditure 10-year forward planning
Grow and lead asset management reporting, data analysis and insights
Communicate, collaborate and coordinate multiple asset management improvement work-streams
Skills & Experience
Your ability to connect with people will enable you to develop and maintain good professional relationships with internal and external stakeholders. You will have asset engineering experience in power generation or heavy industry along with:
Relevant engineering qualification
Proficient in asset management methodologies and processes
Understanding of mechanical equipment, electrical systems and civil structures for generation plant
Knowledge of maintenance management and reliability engineering principles and techniques
Strong analytical skills and ability to interpret data to inform decisions and mitigate risks
High level of collaboration and influencing skills
Advanced interpersonal, written and verbal communication
What's on Offer?
At Trustpower we pride ourselves on being an employer who can offer development and support with a strong, innovative culture. Working closely across the Generation team you will receive great exposure to different areas across the business, and grow your skill set along the way. We offer a competitive salary package and exciting assets to work on.
So if this sounds like the opportunity for you, then we invite you to review the position description and apply today!
If you would like more information, please contact Tim Syme on 027 839 5927. Please note applications close 6th March 2020.

Description
Raygun is looking for a performance minded .NET engineer to help in delivering their next-generation Application Performance Monitoring (APM) product to .NET developers everywhere.
Has a willingness to learn .NET CLR and CoreCLR, how profiling systems work, as well as having a strong understanding of writing high performance code (aiming for minimal profiling overhead).
Raygun’s cloud-based platform and tools enable software development organisations and teams to deliver exceptional value to businesses, and exceptional experiences to customers. Raygun helps developers stay in front of application development and performance issues before they impact on end users.
As a Performance engineer your key focus will be:
The day-to-day development of the Raygun’s APM product
Working mostly in the C# code-base and improving the C++ profiler
Assisting with technical support of the .NET APM
Writing clean and performant code that can be unit tested
Working collaboratively with the team to get features deployed
Mentor junior developers and teaching good coding practices
Our team is data driven and very collaborative. We are a very supportive team and you’ll be given opportunities to learn and excel, but also be prepared to be challenged by a team who care deeply about the Raygun products.
Requirements
Has an understanding or willingness to learn .NET CLR and CoreCLR
Keen interest in how .NET profilers work and have used a profiler previously
Strong knowledge of C#
Write maintainable, scalable, testable code, and will dive in to make existing code even better
Have good communication skills and are self-motivated
Has demonstrated problem solving skills
Keep up with new technologies, trying many of them out by building apps and coding, just for fun
Work independently or in a small team to deliver features on time and to specification
Benefits
You'll work closely with a team of genuinely nice people, who will support you
You’ll get to up-skill and learn new things from other team members, and share your knowledge
Ability to influence growth and clearly see your impact
Become part of a growing company where you can shape the future of our work processes
Preference for working in the office, but flexibility about working remotely as needed
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Work Eligibility:
The candidate can work permanently with no restriction on hours (Required)

We are looking for a Graduate to Intermediate-level Engineer to join our Engineering Geology/Geotechnical Engineering team at our Highbrook office.
This position will provide the successful applicant with the opportunity to gain widespread experience through the field of engineering geology/geotechnical engineering.
Tasks involved would typically include:
Undertaking of site inspections and geotechnical investigations, which may include hand auger boreholes, test pits or machine boreholes, appraisal of data and preparation of geotechnical reports
Contaminated site investigations (e.g. desktop studies, site walkovers, soil sampling, etc)
Environmental monitoring services (e.g. water quality sampling and analysis)
Use of technical software
Client liaison and administration relating to individual projects.
Qualifications and experience required:
Professional degree in Engineering Geology, Civil Engineering or Geology
Between 1 and 3 years’ NZ experience in a similar role
Experience with analytical programmes (WALLAP, Slope/W)
Current NZ driving licence
A good level of fitness.
To apply for this position, email your CV and Cover letter to website@ftl.co.nz.

Graduate Mechanical Engineer
Global business – Pioneering electronic technologies – Stimulating & challenging projects
Learn – Grow – Develop - Work alongside some of the best in the agri-tech sector
BE - Mechanical or Mechatronic & Solidworks CAD modelling experience essential
Set yourself up with career-enhancing engineering foundations; be part of project teams delivering world-class products; apply your technical talent.

About Datamars
Datamars’ purpose is to make a measurable difference by harnessing the power of data to measurably improve productivity and quality of life. We are global leaders in delivering integrated solutions in livestock management, animal health delivery, pet identification and reunification and textile identification. Our people, our legacy strength in technology, our closeness to customers and our quality products helps drive our success as we work towards an exciting, sustainable future.
Expect to be mentored and guided. There will be teamwork, challenges, forward-thinking, personal and career growth, complex technical projects and the opportunity to work alongside a highly experienced R & D team who will support your development and progression. With the right attitude and aptitude, this is an opportunity to carve out your future career path.
With an array of tasks and responsibilities you’ll contribute to mechanical development of new products; carrying out research on product, manufacturing and test technologies and reporting on feasibility and cost to implement these; provide engineering support to production in sustaining manufacturing and updating MRP system data; creating and updating product and component specification documents to ensure supply chain security; designing manufacturing jigs, fixtures and tools which enable efficient production; designing, planning and executing tests to verify compliance, reliability and performance of product and components.
We’re open to exploring highly motivated engineering grads with a genuine interest (both work and play!) in all things mechanical and technology-related.

About you
You may already be working with a year or two experience, or looking to kick off your first career opportunity and can demonstrate your strong work ethic, passion and initiative with your Uni projects and/or internships whilst completing your degree. You’ll be...
results-oriented,
have strong analytical skills,
be a clear communicator and influencer,
have a good understanding and
working knowledge of Solidworks CAD modelling and
ideally, have some practical exposure to working in a workshop environment.
Along with a competitive base salary, car parking and Kiwisaver contributions, you can expect a culture of respect, diversity, support in learning and personal growth combined with exposure to global markets, product design, engineering and manufacturing innovation and compelling career prospects.
Please apply online and we’ll be in touch to explore your potential.
For further insight in to our business check out our website www.datamars.com and follow us on LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/company/datamars-sa

Job_title: Associate Solutions Engineer (Full Time) - Wellington, New Zealand
Summary:
Position:Associate Sales Engineer (Full Time) Year 1 Location: Singapore
Program Start Date: July 27 2020
Why you'll love Cisco: Are you ready to change the World? Do you want to be passionate about your employer and the brand you represent? Everything is converging on the Internet, making networked connections more meaningful than ever before in our lives. Our employees' groundbreaking ideas impact everything imaginable - from entertainment, retail, healthcare, and education, to public and private sectors, smart cities, and everyday devices in our homes. Here, that means you will take creative ideas from the drawing board to dynamic solutions that have real world impact. You'll collaborate with Cisco leaders, partner with expert mentors, and develop incredible relationships with colleagues who share your interest in connecting the unconnected. You'll be part a team that cares about its customers, enjoys having fun, and you'll take part in changing the lives of those in our local communities. Come prepared to be encouraged and inspired.
Who You'll Work With: You’ll be part of our Cisco Sales Associates Program (CSAP), an award-winning and industry recognized early-in-career development program for top university graduates from around the world. You’ll train alongside incredibly talented individuals, like yourself, from different countries and diverse backgrounds. Early on, you’ll make long-lasting friendships and belong to a rich human network that will support you throughout your career. As a successful Associate Sales Engineer (ASE), you’ll expand your software and networking knowledge to collaborate with Cisco sales professionals and provide technical solutions that drive business outcomes for our customers and partners. You’ll learn from top experts and coaches in a unique setting using our own leading-edge technology. You’ll have your own mentor, a CSAP alumnus who’s been in your shoes and will guide you in your first year. With a strong Cisco team committed to your success, you’ll gain hands-on education and experience, while receiving an attractive salary and pursuing your career dreams. The program, will begin on July 27th, 2020. While challenging, it will push you to become the best version of yourself. You’ll be encouraged to pursue industry-standard certifications and be assessed and coached through customer simulations and on-the-job activities. We’ll offer you a safe and fun environment to practice what you’ve learnt, all the while providing you with feedback to develop your potential.
What You’ll Do: Cisco Sales Associates Program offers a global environment that provides a phased approach to training and on-the-job-experience. In the first phase of your experience, you will develop your technical, sales and communication skills and have the opportunity to rotate through a variety of areas. You will learn how to position Cisco’s architectures, solutions and products to our customers. Once you complete Phase 1, Phase 2 will advance you to an engineering role as part of the Cisco Global Virtual Engineering (GVE) Team. GVE is a multilevel technical presales organization, that provides software and systems engineering services to customers, partners, and internal Cisco sales employees. As an engineer, you’ll engage with our customers and partners as a trusted technology advisor. You’ll work with Account Managers and together you’ll position the benefits of our Cisco solutions to your customer, using our market-leading collaboration tools. From there, your career can develop and grow into a variety of sales opportunities at Cisco.
Who You Are: • Technology enthusiast, who enjoys talking about innovation and always keeps up with the latest technology news. • A strong communicator with the confidence to engage and talk to a wide range of people. • View team collaboration as instrumental to achieving success. • Enjoy looking at practical real-life challenges and thinking creatively to solve them. • Approach situations with an open and curious mind, taking on challenges with an eye for opportunity.

What You Need to Be Eligible:
You are a recent graduate or on your final year of studies toward a bachelor's (BE/BS/BA/etc.) or master's degree in; Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, Electrical and/or Electronics Engineering, Telecommunications Engineering, Cyber Security, Cryptography, Artificial Intelligence and/or Machine Learning, Information Technology, Mathematics, Physics, Informatics, Data Science or similar.
Must have graduated by May 2018 or later
Fluent in English and the official language(s)
Knowledge and experience in software languages. C, C++, C#, Java or Python are desired.
Must be an Australian or New Zealand Citizen or New Zealand Permanent Resident
Willing to relocate for 12 months of training to Singapore. Visa assistance and relocation package to training hubs will be provided as required. Why Cisco #WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference. Here’s how we do it. We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we’re “old” (30 years strong!) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. And a security company. A blockchain company. An AI/Machine Learning company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do – you can’t put us in a box! But “Digital Transformation” is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.) Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, we give our egos a break and we give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, we take bold steps, and we take difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a commitment to equality for all, there is no moving forward. So, you have colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us!

Who are we looking for?

The job

We’re Fulton Hogan
You’ve probably seen us around. On the roads, building sites, and in cities, towns and locations all over New Zealand, Australia and the South Pacific. Sounds like you?
