Pyka is looking for a Software Engineer to join our small, experienced team working on large autonomous airplanes. You will spend most of your time working in the Canterbury, New Zealand area with our flight test teams flying large- and sub-scale aircraft.

A typical day in this role will involve flying our full-scale or subscale aircraft (either at a test site or at a customer's farm). Your role will involve deploying new software to the aircraft and designing tests to ensure that it performs as expected. In addition, you will help direct the focus of new feature development and contribute to new features. You will be required to quickly and safely implement new features and bug fixes in the field in order to maximize team productivity.

About Pyka

At Pyka we develop autonomous electric aircraft to provide people with an affordable and compelling alternative to ground transit. We make hyper-short takeoff and landing autonomous electric aircraft. Today, we're using our aircraft to protect crops with fully automated aerial sprays in order to obtain the flight hours, technical readiness, and scale required for human transportation.

Our aircraft make aerial crop protection safer and less harmful to surrounding communities. They're also highly economical to operate and easy to deploy.

We are the only company in the world approved for commercial work with full-scale, autonomous aircraft. What you work on at Pyka makes people's lives better today.

Pyka's core technologies include proprietary flight control software, avionics, high power density motors, motor controllers, batteries, and custom carbon-fiber composite airframes. Our full-stack team is from Cora/Kittyhawk, Joby Aviation, Waymo, and Google[x].

We foster a welcoming community within our company that promotes experimentation, asking questions, making simple solutions to complex problems, expressing different views and opinions. We are a transparent company both internally and externally and do not believe in operating in "stealth mode." Lastly, we don't work 60 hour weeks, and don't expect you to either. In this role you will earn a competitive salary and benefits, including medical and dental coverage.

Responsibilities

Work with the existing software team (currently 2 people) to design and implement new features and test infrastructure
Work closely with flight testing teams to test new software on large aircraft
Debug aircraft software in the field
Develop flight data analysis software
Preferred Qualifications

3+ years of professional software development experience
Experience with C++ (ideally C++11 or newer)
Passion for aviation
Familiarity with robotic systems
Working knowledge of trigonometry and linear algebra
Strong physical intuition
Experience tinkering with things in the real world
Highly detail oriented and comfortable in unfamiliar situations
Company Perks

Competitive compensation
Paid holidays and flexible PTO
Opportunity to work on large autonomous aircraft and see them fly

We are recruiting a Senior Geotechnical Engineer to join our well established and growing Auckland Office. This role offers you an exciting opportunity to contribute to the success of our 40 strong national Ground Engineering team, to work with and support colleagues from a variety of engineering and environmental disciplines and to assist in the growth of our Ground Engineering and Tunnelling team.

We are looking for an ambitious team player who is looking for an opportunity to assist in the development of innovative, cost-effective and buildable solutions in an environment that is collaborative, stimulating and fast-paced. Your extensive geotechnical consultancy experience, in particular, strong capability in geotechnical studies, investigation, and design for highway earthworks, bridge foundations, retaining structures and strengthened earthworks will add to our teams existing strengths.

Nationally our Ground Engineering team provides one-stop access to services ranging from project management, feasibility studies, detailed design, contract administration and construction supervision for geotechnical works.

+ You will provide technical support to both internal and external clients to a high level of technical quality, to programme and budget

+ Utilize your expertise to apply advanced scientific principles, theories, practices and existing technologies develop technical solutions to complex problems

+ Interpret and record data, conducts analyses, compare findings to relevant studies and local, provincial and national regulations to ensure compliance

+ Undertake design and reporting of a wide variety of geotechnical works including geological and geomorphological mapping, slope stability, foundations, retaining structures, earthworks and ground improvement

+ Conduct research and investigation as required.

+ Plan and organize project studies

+ Assist in resolving conflicting technical information and unsuitability of standard procedures

+ Perform complex assignments requiring the development of unique solutions to problems.

+ May oversee the work of less experienced scientists.

Minimum Requirements

+ Experienced Geotechnical Engineer with a proven track record in studies, investigations and geotechnical design, in particular for new build transportation infrastructure.

+ Possess strong problem solving and interpersonal skills.

+ Strong written and verbal communication skills; the ability to write clear and concise technical reports is essential.

+ In-depth knowledge and experience of relevant design standards.

+ Ensures that Health and Safety issues are addressed throughout the life of a project.

+ In-depth hands-on experience of routinely used geotechnical software including gINT, Slope/W, SLIDE and Plaxis; GIS or Geospatial skills desirable.

+ In-depth knowledge of a wide variety of ground conditions and of soil and rock design parameter selection; local knowledge and experience is advantageous.

+ Valid driving licence is essential.

+ Willing to travel to other offices and sites within NZ is essential, and a willing to consider overseas assignments preferred.

Preferred Qualifications

Geotechnical Engineering are preferred, although Engineering Geologists with appropriate design skills will be considered.

What We Offer

pioneering the future . About Rocket Lab
Rocket Lab is the global leader in dedicated small satellite launch. Launching from right here in New Zealand, we design and build innovative technology to give small satellites a premium ride to orbit.

Small satellites play a crucial role in our day-to-day lives – they connect us, keep us safe, help us understand our planet and manage our impact on it, and they enable us to innovate and explore. There are endless possibilities for what we can achieve with better access to space, and that access is now a reality thanks to Rocket Lab.

Our relentlessly innovative team is behind Electron, the world’s only truly commercial small satellite launch vehicle in operation today. With multiple orbital launches under our belt and a record of 100% mission success, we’re opening access to space to improve life on Earth. We’ve built a world class team with a reputation for doing the impossible. Collaboration is at our core - every idea is heard and everyone makes a difference. Every day, we pursue ideas that challenge, excite and demand more of us, and we make them real. Be a part of it.

About the role
The purpose of this role is to translate the Engineering design into a zero-defect production process to achieve demand. Champion continuous improvement using lean techniques.

Essential Skills
Bachelor's degree in mechanical, electrical, aerospace, or manufacturing engineering
4+ years of experience in a manufacturing environment
Ability to create and deliver accurate presentations for design and manufacturing readiness reviews
Experience transitioning products from design to manufacturing as part of a cross-functional team in a fast-paced iterative design environment
Experience modeling with 3D CAD software eg: Solidworks, Inventor, NX/Unigraphics, Catia
Working proﬁciency with DFMEA, PFMEA methodologies and Fault Tree Analysis.
SPC knowledge and experience applying statistical methods to track process capability.
Basic competency with SQL databases and SQL programming
Demonstrated experience designing tooling in a manufacturing environment
Hands-on with a passion for continuous improvement and building the best hardware
Capable of solving complex problems with little to no supervision in a timely manner.
Pareto analysis, root cause and corrective action experience.
Experience with capacity modeling, process mapping, Lean and continuous improvement principles
Excellent communication skills both written and verbal
Geometric dimensioning and tolerancing (GD&T) experience

As well as a being a career-defining role, working at Rocket Lab means being part of meaningful projects with world-leading experts.

Collaboration is at our core - every idea is heard, and everyone makes a difference.

We get things done. Our team is nimble, decisions are made quickly, and we are action oriented. While other companies talk about it, we do it. This means projects get the green light faster and ideas are put into practice rapidly.

Everyone works on the big stuff. This isn’t a huge aerospace company where you get lost in bureaucracy and end up a tiny cog in a giant machine. At Rocket Lab, your work directly impacts the success of each mission. Everyone’s voice is heard, and everyone can contribute major projects. This is your chance to play a pivotal role in developing space systems that change the way we access space.

Important Information
For security reasons background checks will be undertaken prior to any employment offers being made to an applicant. These checks will include nationality checks as it is a requirement of this position that you be eligible to access equipment and data regulated by the United States' International Traffic in Arms Regulations. Under these Regulations, you may be ineligible for this role if you do not hold citizenship of Australia, Japan, New Zealand, Switzerland, the European Union or a country that is part of NATO, or if you hold ineligible dual citizenship or nationality. For more information on these Regulations, click here http://www.pmddtc.state.gov/regulations_laws/itar.html.

Asset Technician - Tauranga
Asset Technicians who want to work in a social and supportive workplace in Tauranga, keep reading…
The opportunity
Due to our long-term partnerships with the NZ Transport Agency and local authority clients we have a strong pipeline of work across the region and we are looking for Asset Technicians to join our high performing and social Tauranga team.
As an Asset Technician you’ll be part of our road asset management team. The team delivers asset management planning, analysis, forward works programming, pavement design, asset data collection surveys, asset database management and asset valuations for roading and other transportation assets.
We’re a collaborative and dedicated team spread across different career levels so there is great mentoring support and opportunities to take ownership of your personal growth and development.
Your responsibilities will be to support the senior asset managers and engineers providing professional advice to our clients to effectively and efficiently manage their roading networks.
Day to day activities in this role will range from:
Database management; inputting and checking high quality data
Analysing asset data to inform good decisions
Prepare reports on asset performance, condition and effectiveness of investment
Support the delivery of asset data collection activities and surveys
Support senior team members to improve processes
Support with asset revaluation
About you
You will hold a diploma, or equivalent, in a relevant engineer field and have an awareness of asset management systems and processes. Your work experience will show that you have an understanding of roading assets, particularly road surfacing and pavement construction and performance.
Your experience and attributes will include:
Effective and clear communication skills, both written and verbal, to a variety of audiences of varying technical nature
Confidence interacting and working directly with clients
A team player who enjoys working in a consulting environment with a diverse range of stakeholders to collaboratively identify the best solution for the client
A ‘doer’ who love seeing projects from ideation through to delivery
A fast learner who wants to learn new systems and processes
Proficient in Microsoft office packages
A good approach to health and safety and how to work safely
Some travel and field work is required as part of this role, as such a full and clean driver’s license is essential.
What we offer
Beca prides itself on supporting a diverse and inclusive culture – open to inputs from creative people of all genders, ethnicity, identity, thought and experiences.
A supportive and caring work environment where you can bring your whole self to work
Diverse opportunities for career and professional development
Flexible working arrangements to balance your personal / family commitments
Highly supportive environment of sharing and collaboration
Excellent benefits including discounted health insurance, gym memberships, an outstanding parental leave policy, and a huge range of social events
Apply now
If you have an analytical mind and enjoy finding innovative approaches to solving problems, challenging the status quo, developing solutions to help our clients and working as part of a team with a great track record then we would be keen to hear from you.
For further information about the role, contact Autumn English, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, on +64 9 336 5954, or apply online today!

Vestas is the energy industry’s global partner on sustainable energy solutions. We design, manufacture, install, and service wind turbines across the globe, and with more than 105 GW of wind turbines in 80 countries, we have installed more wind power than anyone else.

Releasing software in-time that meets highest quality standards, is easy to deploy, low on memory, starts fast, scales well and almost never breaks you’ll;
Design, implement and improve our highly-scalable, Java 8 and Java 11 based micro-services in an AWS, Kubernetes cloud centric environment
Write business code that drives our Online customer experience as well as the optimal execution of our most critical Enterprise business processes
Engage with other developers to level up on our engineering and DevOps practice up to selecting the best tools in class
About you
A senior operator, you’ll be passionate about tech, opinionated about software and a fantastic team player who thrives in agile, collaborative environments.
With several successful years in Java (8 or later, ideally in Spring Boot, Maven or REST environments), you’ll know how to deal with Hibernate, Ebean and Spring Data. A technical role – here’s what else you’ll need:
Have Up-to-date knowledge in PostgreSQL with a good amount of exposure to other SQL DBs as well as some NoSQL
Have expert level experience in messaging and integration patterns, ActiveMQ, JMS
To know how to master AWS cloud technologies like S3, SNS, SQS, Lambda and tools like Kubernetes, Docker, Helm, Ansible
To be versed with Git, Bamboo, Maven, Bitbucket, Confluence
Development on a Mac with IntelliJ or alternative IDEs and using the k8s CLI is a no-brainer to you
Driving significant parts of our business, you’ll build awesome user experiences in our digital channels across the digital customer journey.
About us
We’re a team of 22,000 New Zealanders in a growing network of 300+ stores (PAK’nSAVE, New World, Four Square, Gilmours & Fresh Collective). We serve over 1.3 million customers every week in the most awesome little country in the world!

Graduate Mechanical Engineer
Global business – Pioneering electronic technologies – Stimulating & challenging projects
Learn – Grow – Develop - Work alongside some of the best in the agri-tech sector
BE - Mechanical or Mechatronic & Solidworks CAD modelling experience essential
Set yourself up with career-enhancing engineering foundations; be part of project teams delivering world-class products; apply your technical talent.

About Datamars
Datamars’ purpose is to make a measurable difference by harnessing the power of data to measurably improve productivity and quality of life. We are global leaders in delivering integrated solutions in livestock management, animal health delivery, pet identification and reunification and textile identification. Our people, our legacy strength in technology, our closeness to customers and our quality products helps drive our success as we work towards an exciting, sustainable future.
Expect to be mentored and guided. There will be teamwork, challenges, forward-thinking, personal and career growth, complex technical projects and the opportunity to work alongside a highly experienced R & D team who will support your development and progression. With the right attitude and aptitude, this is an opportunity to carve out your future career path.
With an array of tasks and responsibilities you’ll contribute to mechanical development of new products; carrying out research on product, manufacturing and test technologies and reporting on feasibility and cost to implement these; provide engineering support to production in sustaining manufacturing and updating MRP system data; creating and updating product and component specification documents to ensure supply chain security; designing manufacturing jigs, fixtures and tools which enable efficient production; designing, planning and executing tests to verify compliance, reliability and performance of product and components.
We’re open to exploring highly motivated engineering grads with a genuine interest (both work and play!) in all things mechanical and technology-related.

About you
You may already be working with a year or two experience, or looking to kick off your first career opportunity and can demonstrate your strong work ethic, passion and initiative with your Uni projects and/or internships whilst completing your degree. You’ll be...
results-oriented,
have strong analytical skills,
be a clear communicator and influencer,
have a good understanding and
working knowledge of Solidworks CAD modelling and
ideally, have some practical exposure to working in a workshop environment.
Along with a competitive base salary, car parking and Kiwisaver contributions, you can expect a culture of respect, diversity, support in learning and personal growth combined with exposure to global markets, product design, engineering and manufacturing innovation and compelling career prospects.

Be recognised as a lead provider of expert traffic engineering advice
Manage safety funding, investment and programmes
Tauranga/Hamilton based
About us | Ko wai mātou
At Waka Kotahi The NZ Transport Agency, it all starts with our people. The organisation's performance and success depends on the people who choose to make this a great place to work and make a difference for New Zealand. The Transport Agency has a strong future focus, understanding that new technologies and changing customer expectations mean the transport system we know today will not be the one we deliver in ten years' time.
As the Senior Safety Engineer, you will be part of the Transport Services business group. The Transport Services group aim to provide, improve and maintain the land transport system to effectively enable transport services. Our focus is to design and deliver an integrated transport system for all New Zealanders.

The opportunity | Te Whiwhinga mahi
You will be reporting into the Team Lead – Safety Engineers, you will bring your road safety or traffic engineering background to provide technical advice and support to the Transport Services group. This is to ensure that traffic and safety policies, procedures and standards are robustly developed, analysed and implemented. You will use your strong communication and relationship management skills to work with key stakeholders externally to identify and prioritise safety measures and programmes.
You will have the opportunity to use your understanding of key data sources to assess outputs and make recommendations, as well as develop and monitor safety programmes of work. There is a travel element to the role, and the ability to work across the Bay of Plenty, Waikato and Gisborne regions.
We would also consider someone at a more junior level for this role, so whether you have three years expereince or are at the top of your game and looking for a new challenge, we want to hear from you.

About you | Ko koe tēnei

To be successful in this role, you will bring:
A background and experience in road safety engineering and/or traffic engineering
Experience with programme management
An awareness and understanding of the Safe System approach
Knowledge and understanding of the applicability and effectiveness of potential safety improvements
Understanding of key data sources (CAS, RAMM, High speed data, KiwiRAP)
Strong relationship building and stakeholder management skills
The ability to communicate the safety vision, including the safe system
The ability to influence and persuade others and bring them on the journey
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong analytical skills
The ability to generate a range of solutions and logically evaluate these
This role can be based in either Hamilton or Tauranga.

Applications close:
24th February 2020

At the Agency we recognise the importance of diversity and inclusion and are committed to providing a working environment that embraces these values. Please let us know if you need any support or have any access requirements that will help you through the recruitment process.

Asset Technician - Tauranga
Asset Technicians who want to work in a social and supportive workplace in Tauranga, keep reading…
The opportunity
Due to our long-term partnerships with the NZ Transport Agency and local authority clients we have a strong pipeline of work across the region and we are looking for Asset Technicians to join our high performing and social Tauranga team.
As an Asset Technician you’ll be part of our road asset management team. The team delivers asset management planning, analysis, forward works programming, pavement design, asset data collection surveys, asset database management and asset valuations for roading and other transportation assets.
We’re a collaborative and dedicated team spread across different career levels so there is great mentoring support and opportunities to take ownership of your personal growth and development.
Your responsibilities will be to support the senior asset managers and engineers providing professional advice to our clients to effectively and efficiently manage their roading networks.
Day to day activities in this role will range from:
Database management; inputting and checking high quality data
Analysing asset data to inform good decisions
Prepare reports on asset performance, condition and effectiveness of investment
Support the delivery of asset data collection activities and surveys
Support senior team members to improve processes
Support with asset revaluation
About you
You will hold a diploma, or equivalent, in a relevant engineer field and have an awareness of asset management systems and processes. Your work experience will show that you have an understanding of roading assets, particularly road surfacing and pavement construction and performance.
Your experience and attributes will include:
Effective and clear communication skills, both written and verbal, to a variety of audiences of varying technical nature
Confidence interacting and working directly with clients
A team player who enjoys working in a consulting environment with a diverse range of stakeholders to collaboratively identify the best solution for the client
A ‘doer’ who love seeing projects from ideation through to delivery
A fast learner who wants to learn new systems and processes
Proficient in Microsoft office packages
A good approach to health and safety and how to work safely
Some travel and field work is required as part of this role, as such a full and clean driver’s license is essential.
What we offer
Beca prides itself on supporting a diverse and inclusive culture – open to inputs from creative people of all genders, ethnicity, identity, thought and experiences.
A supportive and caring work environment where you can bring your whole self to work
Diverse opportunities for career and professional development
Flexible working arrangements to balance your personal / family commitments
Highly supportive environment of sharing and collaboration
Excellent benefits including discounted health insurance, gym memberships, an outstanding parental leave policy, and a huge range of social events
Apply now
If you have an analytical mind and enjoy finding innovative approaches to solving problems, challenging the status quo, developing solutions to help our clients and working as part of a team with a great track record then we would be keen to hear from you.
For further information about the role, contact Autumn English, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, on +64 9 336 5954, or apply online today!
To find out more about Beca, our purpose, people and projects, visit www.beca.com.

Description
Raygun’s cloud-based platform and tools enable software development organisations and teams to deliver exceptional value to businesses, and exceptional experiences to customers. Raygun helps developers stay in front of application development and performance issues before they impact on end users.
You will be involved in the day-to-day operation of the Raygun product suite, working directly with the CTO to support new initiatives, maintain and improve existing infrastructure and provide operational support for an established high volume system hosted in AWS which supports development teams around the world.
Our team is data driven, collaborative and very supportive. You’ll be given opportunities to learn and excel, but also be prepared to be challenged by people who care very deeply about the Raygun products and the value we are unlocking for our users.
As a Senior DevOps Engineer your key focus will be:
Responsible for the Raygun Amazon Web Services account management day-to-day
Working with the team to assist in capacity planning for infrastructure, including managing instance reservations and other tasks for ensuring tight control on our cost-to-serve
Working with the team to provide operational support and quality focused improvements for internal and production systems
Working with the CTO to plan, implement and review security of our internal and cloud infrastructure
Working with the CTO to plan, implement and review automation of operations tasks
Requirements
Strong commercial experience in cloud infrastructure (with a preference for AWS)
Solid background and commercial experience in operating and managing both Windows and Linux hosts (Raygun uses both)
Experience in managing and operating in high uptime environments
Good communication skills and is self-motivated
A strong security mindset and has relevant experience in securing cloud infrastructure
Proficiency in scripting languages and a back end programming language
Existing experience in a Site Reliability type role
Attributes
Can pick up new tasks, technologies and systems quickly
Can troubleshoot problems beyond the documentation
Keep up with new technologies and infrastructure trends
Can work independently or in a small team to deliver on time and to spec
You excel in a collaborative and agile environment where we deploy continuously, measure everything and take responsibility to diagnose and fix what breaks
You enjoy a variety of work, mixing planning and operations of cloud infrastructure with helping automate parts of our delivery pipeline
Benefits
You’ll work closely with a team of genuinely nice people, who will support you
You’ll get to up-skill and learn new things from other team members, and share your knowledge.
Ability to influence growth and clearly see your impact
Become part of a growing company where you can shape the future of our work processes
Preference for working in the office, but flexibility about working from home as needed
Strong say over the way we define operational management going forward, helping build the standards that Raygun will use in future
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Experience:
DevOps: 2 years (Required)

A rare opportunity has come up for an Operations Engineer to join our IT Services team at our Auckland office! If you are passionate about all things IT, Customer Service and genuinely like making an impact within an organisation then this could be the role for you!
The position is primarily responsible for delivering Microsoft Desktop Management, while working with the wider team to support and maintain core infrastructure systems. You will also have the opportunity to be involved in services and projects delivering leading edge technologies to internal and external customers.
In addition to this, you must be a team player who is willing to help out others within the business including within the IT function (such as engineering teams, service desk).
Key tasks can include:
Systems Management:
– Ensure that desktop procurement, deployment, performance and reliability is
maintained within agreed service levels.
– Foster and implement process improvement methodologies to continually enhance
desktop support performance. Identify ways of improving desktop delivery and
operational efficiency and effectiveness.
– Test new technologies as required.
– Liaise with vendors as requested/needed for service matters.
– Maintain accurate log entries of faults with resolution and contact details.
– Perform Installation and maintenance of assigned environments, including
hardware and software upgrades. Software upgrades to be performed in line with
user and project requirements, and subject to licensing agreements.
– Lead troubleshoot and problem management in end user environments.
– Stay current with relevant technology
– Assist with server infrastructure provisioning including configuration and
deployment.
– Monitor and support infrastructure components (software and hardware) for which
responsibility has been assigned
– Author system documentation such as environment diagrams,
installation/configuration documents and release notes
– Manage version, firmware and patch updates for end user environments
– Assist in managing and delivering services to Data Centre environments.
Service Management:
– Provide online, phone, and face-to-face technical support to users regarding
Desktop issues.
– Provide the business with a professional service by ensuring requests are
regularly updated and realistic resolution times are provided.
– Back up and support the Service Desk as required
– Provide an effective interface between users and service providers supplying
all necessary diagnostic information according to procedures.
– Develop appropriate relationships with customers (internal and external) to
ensure that they have confidence in Foster Moore’s IT Operations ability to
deliver, and to ensure that matters of escalation are dealt with quickly and
effectively.
– Ensure technical queries not progressing are escalated to Systems Engineers
according to established procedures.
You must have:
– 3 – 5 years’ experience in IT Support
– Relevant tertiary qualification.
– Microsoft suite capability (Windows OS, O365, Active Directory, Exchange)
– Demonstrable capability in Microsoft Office applications.
– Desktop, Printer, and peripheral procurement, deployment, installation and
configuration
– Excellent diagnostic and problem-solving ability.
– Must be highly motivated and able to work independently with minimal
supervision.
– Customer focused – ideally with previous experience in a customer support role.
– Be a solid contributor in a team environment.
– Excellent organisational, verbal and written communications skills.
– First level network support (patching and connectivity troubleshooting)
– Writing technical and training documents capability
– Ability to liaise between vendors and business users
– Adaptable and flexible
Advantageous if you have the following:
– Windows Server (certification ideal)
– Apple support experience
– Networking skills – firewalls, routers and switches (primarily Fortinet – but
CCNA bonus)
– VMware or other hypervisor experience
– AWS or Azure exposure
If you think you’re the right fit for this role, please send your Resume and Cover Letter to careers@fostermoore.com
Please note, you must already have obtained the legal right to live and work in New Zealand in order to be considered for this role. The successful candidate must be able to clear Security Clearance therefore being an NZ Permanent Resident or Citizen is beneficial, or having resided in the country for at least 5 years’ is required as per the clearance requirements.

Job no: 507976
Work type: Permanent - Full-time
Location: Canterbury
Categories: Civil Contracting, Engineering (all disciplines)
The Job
We are recruiting for a Water Safety Asset Engineer to provide leadership in Water Sector. You will be reviewing and providing advice to water contract managers and bid/project managers to ensure full compliance with Drinking Water Standards NZ and Resource Consent conditions on FH O&M contracts and projects, as well as assisting in training staff in the principles of “Safe Water” and ensuring water procedures are embedded and followed in all FH water contracts.
You’ll be responsible for a wide range of activities, including;
Working with the FH Corporate IT team and Contract Managers to develop and define future additional capabilities required from the FH Water business for its business intelligence reporting tools.
Assist Contract Managers with performance analysis of contract assets.
Analysis of asset and condition data.
Development of asset management renewal programs.
Assist in the development and deployment of asset management systems and techniques.
Determine best whole of life decisions for water asset replacements and assist clients with development of renewal plans based on condition and remaining life.

The Candidate
The key attribute for this role is the ability to communicate and take the teams on the journey of delivering safe water. This will require the ability to work with and communicate with all levels, from Executives down to front line staff, and be willing to get stuck in out in the field with our work crews!
You will have at least 5 years’ experience managing drinking water and wastewater treatment compliance, and experience with a larger Council’s maintenance standards, policies and planning processes. Other skills and attributes we are looking for are;
Appropriate tertiary qualification – BE/BSc or NZCE, Diploma in Drinking Water or equivalent.
Strong understanding of the Resource Management Act and DWSNZ regulatory requirements.
Experience in field condition assessment of water assets with operational teams and/or consultants.
Previous experience dealing with internal staff and external stakeholders.
Management and use of statistical techniques to analyse large data sets.
Experience using computer based systems and ArcGIS geospatial platforms for data management and visualisation.
Ability to lead internal workshops on HAZOP and Safety in Design processes.
Understanding of the whole of life net present value analysis and calculations required for NPV.
Talented in coaching and developing skills in others.
Key to this role will be your commitment to achieve exceptional outcomes in delivery, while displaying a positive attitude.

Support remote work
Contract - Initially six months, rate negotiable
Raygun is looking for a low-level PHP engineer to help in delivering their next-generation Application Performance Monitoring (APM) product to PHP developers everywhere. What do we mean by low-level?
You’ll have a deep understanding of how PHP executes code, how profiling systems work, as well as have a strong understanding of writing high performance code (aiming for minimal profiling overhead).
Raygun’s APM is already in use with .NET, .NET Core & Ruby. The main agent that takes care of processing data and sending it to our servers is already built and is cross-platform. You’d be focused more at the profiling level, how integration needs to work with PHP, as well as helping ensure solid support for common libraries and frameworks. Beyond the core delivery, you would build test harnesses, benchmarks for measuring the overhead, developing a setup or installation process for customers, documentation and assisting in integrating the PHP profiler into our build systems.
You’ll be working closely with Raygun staff to integrate the PHP profiler with our APM product as whilst we do support multiple languages, we know there will be customisations needed to ensure everything works well together and provides a smooth customer experience.
Requirements
Have an deep understanding of PHP and C
Understanding of how profilers work and have used a profiler previously
Write maintainable, scalable, testable code
Have good communication skills and are self-motivated
Work independently or in a small team to deliver features on time and to specification
Benefits
Raygun supports remote working for this type of role:
We work with GitHub as our source control
We use Slack and Zoom to communicate
While most staff are in our New Zealand office, we do have engineers in Australia
Messaging protocols for our Agent are fully documented

Job Summary
We are recruiting a Senior Geotechnical Engineer to join our well established and growing Auckland Office. This role offers you an exciting opportunity to contribute to the success of our 40 strong national Ground Engineering team, to work with and support colleagues from a variety of engineering and environmental disciplines and to assist in the growth of our Ground Engineering and Tunnelling team.
We are looking for an ambitious team player who is looking for an opportunity to assist in the development of innovative, cost-effective and buildable solutions in an environment that is collaborative, stimulating and fast-paced. Your extensive geotechnical consultancy experience, in particular, strong capability in geotechnical studies, investigation, and design for highway earthworks, bridge foundations, retaining structures and strengthened earthworks will add to our teams existing strengths.
Nationally our Ground Engineering team provides one-stop access to services ranging from project management, feasibility studies, detailed design, contract administration and construction supervision for geotechnical works.
You will provide technical support to both internal and external clients to a high level of technical quality, to programme and budget
Utilize your expertise to apply advanced scientific principles, theories, practices and existing technologies develop technical solutions to complex problems
Interpret and record data, conducts analyses, compare findings to relevant studies and local, provincial and national regulations to ensure compliance
Undertake design and reporting of a wide variety of geotechnical works including geological and geomorphological mapping, slope stability, foundations, retaining structures, earthworks and ground improvement
Conduct research and investigation as required.
Plan and organize project studies
Assist in resolving conflicting technical information and unsuitability of standard procedures
Perform complex assignments requiring the development of unique solutions to problems.
May oversee the work of less experienced scientists.
Minimum Requirements
Experienced Geotechnical Engineer with a proven track record in studies, investigations and geotechnical design, in particular for new build transportation infrastructure.
Possess strong problem solving and interpersonal skills.
Strong written and verbal communication skills; the ability to write clear and concise technical reports is essential.
In-depth knowledge and experience of relevant design standards.
Ensures that Health and Safety issues are addressed throughout the life of a project.
In-depth hands-on experience of routinely used geotechnical software including gINT, Slope/W, SLIDE and Plaxis; GIS or Geospatial skills desirable.
In-depth knowledge of a wide variety of ground conditions and of soil and rock design parameter selection; local knowledge and experience is advantageous.
Valid driving licence is essential.
Willing to travel to other offices and sites within NZ is essential, and a willing to consider overseas assignments preferred.
Preferred Qualifications
Geotechnical Engineering are preferred, although Engineering Geologists with appropriate design skills will be considered.
What We Offer
When you join AECOM, you become part of a company that is
pioneering the future . Our teams around the world are involved in some of the most cutting-edge and innovative projects and programs of our time, addressing the big challenges of today and shaping the built environment for generations to come. We ensure a workplace that encourages growth, flexibility and creativity, as well as a company culture that champions
inclusion, diversity and overall
employee well-being through programs supported by company leadership. Our
core values define who we are, how we act and what we aspire to, which comes down to not only
delivering a better world , but working to “make amazing happen” in each neighborhood, community and city we touch. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.

What you’ll be doing...
Verizon Connect is guiding a connected world on the go by automating, optimizing and revolutionizing the way people, vehicles and things move through the world. Our full suite of industry-defining solutions and services put innovation, automation and connected data to work for customers and help them be safer, more efficient and more productive. With more than 3,500 dedicated employees in 15 countries, we deliver leading mobile technology platforms and solutions.

As a division of Verizon, we combine the fun and excitement of a startup environment with the resources, operational excellence, and brand recognition of an established tech giant.
You will lead a dynamic and successful team in our Christchurch office, continuously adapting and improving our methodologies and technologies to be the best at what we do: provide innovative tracking software to trucking companies all around the world. This team is responsible for maintaining and enhancing two native mobile apps (iOS and Android) as well as a legacy hybrid mobile app, and works closely with the API team and other teams within a wider group focused on regulatory compliance solutions. You will be working primarily with Java, Swift, Kotlin and Typescript.

Optimising your squad’s specific needs and strengths.

Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience.

Experience mentoring junior developers.

Ability to lead and guide a team.

New Zealand - Auckland, Auckland
Job Summary
We are recruiting a Senior Geotechnical Engineer to join our well established and growing Auckland Office. This role offers you an exciting opportunity to contribute to the success of our 40 strong national Ground Engineering team, to work with and support colleagues from a variety of engineering and environmental disciplines and to assist in the growth of our Ground Engineering and Tunnelling team.
We are looking for an ambitious team player who is looking for an opportunity to assist in the development of innovative, cost-effective and buildable solutions in an environment that is collaborative, stimulating and fast-paced. Your extensive geotechnical consultancy experience, in particular, strong capability in geotechnical studies, investigation, and design for highway earthworks, bridge foundations, retaining structures and strengthened earthworks will add to our teams existing strengths.
Nationally our Ground Engineering team provides one-stop access to services ranging from project management, feasibility studies, detailed design, contract administration and construction supervision for geotechnical works.
You will provide technical support to both internal and external clients to a high level of technical quality, to programme and budget
Utilize your expertise to apply advanced scientific principles, theories, practices and existing technologies develop technical solutions to complex problems
Interpret and record data, conducts analyses, compare findings to relevant studies and local, provincial and national regulations to ensure compliance
Undertake design and reporting of a wide variety of geotechnical works including geological and geomorphological mapping, slope stability, foundations, retaining structures, earthworks and ground improvement
Conduct research and investigation as required.
Plan and organize project studies
Assist in resolving conflicting technical information and unsuitability of standard procedures
Perform complex assignments requiring the development of unique solutions to problems.
May oversee the work of less experienced scientists.
Minimum Requirements
Experienced Geotechnical Engineer with a proven track record in studies, investigations and geotechnical design, in particular for new build transportation infrastructure.
Possess strong problem solving and interpersonal skills.
Strong written and verbal communication skills; the ability to write clear and concise technical reports is essential.
In-depth knowledge and experience of relevant design standards.
Ensures that Health and Safety issues are addressed throughout the life of a project.
In-depth hands-on experience of routinely used geotechnical software including gINT, Slope/W, SLIDE and Plaxis; GIS or Geospatial skills desirable.
In-depth knowledge of a wide variety of ground conditions and of soil and rock design parameter selection; local knowledge and experience is advantageous.
Valid driving licence is essential.
Willing to travel to other offices and sites within NZ is essential, and a willing to consider overseas assignments preferred.
Preferred Qualifications
Geotechnical Engineering are preferred, although Engineering Geologists with appropriate design skills will be considered.
What We Offer
When you join AECOM, you become part of a company that is
pioneering the future . Our teams around the world are involved in some of the most cutting-edge and innovative projects and programs of our time, addressing the big challenges of today and shaping the built environment for generations to come. We ensure a workplace that encourages growth, flexibility and creativity, as well as a company culture that champions
inclusion, diversity and overall
employee well-being through programs supported by company leadership. Our
core values define who we are, how we act and what we aspire to, which comes down to not only
delivering a better world , but working to “make amazing happen” in each neighborhood, community and city we touch. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.

There’s never been a better time to join ANZ; we’re flipping traditional banking on its head
Join one of NZ’s largest technology shops; offering huge scope for career opportunity
About the role
We have an exciting opportunity for a Senior Developer to join our Data and Analytics team.
You will work in an agile and collaborative team, working with other engineers and analysts to deliver industry leading technical platform and deployment solutions which are utilised by other Data scrum teams. You will bring modern development techniques and a continuous improvement mind-set to the team and be passionate about sharing these.
You will have the opportunity to share your knowledge grow those around you whilst also applying your skills to deliver continuous improvements to our platform and process. Your day to day will be spent iteratively delivering technical platform solutions as part of a scrum team. You will be passionate about and experienced in agile development practices such as CI/CD pipelines and Test Driven Development, and will help drive continuous improvement in our scrum teams.
You will be a fast learner with a solid technical background and enjoy learning new technologies and platforms.
You will be part of an awesome, collaborative team. You will be well-supported with opportunities for your personal development and growth. Put that into a great team that is growing and changing, and you might just have your ideal role!

WHO WE ARE:

Talend is a leader in cloud data integration and data integrity.
We are a global company with offices in Redwood City, Paris, London, Bonn, Beijing, Tokyo, Singapore, Sydney, and Bangalore. Our customers are pioneers/innovative leaders in their market when it comes to data and cloud projects. We are proud to count Domino’s, the world’s largest pizza company, Euronext, the #1 stock exchange in Europe, and HP Inc., a leading IT company, as Talend customers.
We enable companies to transform their business by delivering trusted data at the speed of business. Talend offers a suite of apps for data integration and integrity that brings data, people and technology together by generating end-to-end data pipelines.
Customers can collect data; transform it to power analytics; govern it from end-to-end; and share it across internal and external stakeholders. They can work across systems and across environments: in the cloud and on-premises.

Senior Solution Engineer (Sales Engineer)
.
We are hiring Solution Engineer (Pre-Sales Engineers) to continue to build a proactive, customer-facing organization that ensures customers are getting value from Talend’s products and solutions.

Our portfolio of products has expanded from purely Data Integration to include Data Quality (DQ), Master Data Management (MDM), Enterprise Service Bus (ESB), Big Data and Cloud. The main responsibilities are to secure the “technical win” in growing our customer’s community and contribute to the enablement of our prospects during their selection process.

Key job functions include:

Identifying business issues and relating them to Talend capabilities
Articulating Talend’s value proposition and differentiation at all levels within Enterprise Accounts
Engaging in and responding to RFI/RFP procurement processes
Qualifying opportunities
Building and delivering comprehensive customized demonstrations
Working within the sales team to own technical relationships with prospects from developer to CIO

Key technical skills:
Significant and current experience of two or more of the following disciplines:
Data Integration: experienced in building Enterprise Data Warehouses and integrating multiple applications/systems in a heterogeneous environment.
Big Data: good understanding of the Hadoop ecosystem (HDFS, Hive, MapReduce, Spark, etc.). Practical experience in Spark (Scala or Java) is a plus.
Cloud: good understanding of Cloud landscape (AWS, Azure, Google etc) and Cloud applications concepts (multi tenancy, elasticity, scalability, etc).
Governance: exposure to Data Quality, Master Data Management or Metadata Management projects and solutions.
Exposure to one or several programming languages (Java, Python, Scala, etc.), SQL, Relational databases is highly appreciated.
Key non-technical skills
Passionate about technology
Excellent interpersonal and presentation skills
Capacity to diagnose and solve a problem in a limited time frame
Team player
Demonstrate the ability to manage a high number of concurrent, active prospects
A minimum of 3 to 5 years of experience in data and analytics industry is required

Asset Engineer - Auckland
Transport and Infrastructure at Beca
Our Transport and Infrastructure work is at the heart of our business. Developing and implementing solutions to complex problems, our team is helping to shape the world we live in across the Asia Pacific region – from highways to airports; from to bridges to tunnels. We offer the opportunity to build a career path within a fascinating industry, in a business line that offers variety, challenge and tremendous growth potential.
We embrace the fact that people are our greatest asset. It’s our people that set us apart, and who our clients keep coming back to. Passionate about what we do and the culture we have developed, we believe that key to our success is the teamwork and collaboration fostered, not only within Transport and Infrastructure, but right across the Beca Group. It’s this culture that allows us to deliver excellence in technical delivery, client service and innovation in all that we do.
The opportunity
As an Asset Engineer, you’ll be part of our road asset management team who delivers asset management planning, analysis, forward works programming, pavement design, asset data collection surveys, asset database management and asset valuations for roading and other transportation assets.
We’re a collaborative and dedicated team spread across different career levels so there is great mentoring support and opportunities to take ownership of your personal growth and development.
Your responsibilities will be to both support the senior asset managers and engineers, and leading packages of work providing professional advice to our clients to effectively and efficiently manage their roading networks.
Day to day activities in this role will range from:
Analysing asset data to inform good decisions
Supporting the development of forward works programmes
Failure mode analysis and treatment selection
Preparing reports on asset performance, condition and effectiveness of investment
Net Present Value analysis
Supporting the delivery of asset data collection activities and surveys
Designing pavement rehabilitation and thin asphaltic concrete treatments
Working with the team to improve processes
Supporting with asset revaluation
Database management; inputting and checking to ensure high quality data
Developing positive relationships with our clients and working with them to find solutions to their problems
About you
You will hold a bachelor’s degree, or equivalent, in a relevant engineer field and have a minimum of three years of technical experience in asset management systems and processes. You will have experience working on roading assets, particularly road surfacing and pavement construction and performance. A key skill of yours will be your strong interpersonal skills that you’ve honed interacting with clients and diverse teams.
Your experience and attributes will include:
Able to consider multiple options, identify risks and problem solve throughout the project lifecycle
An understanding of pavement design and materials testing
Experience with data analysis and reporting
Economic evaluation of treatment options through NPV analysis
STMS Level 2/3 NP is an advantage
Understanding of condition surveys associated with asset management programming and planning
Working knowledge of the suite of RAMM software including RAMM, RAMM Network Manager, RAMM Manager and RAMM Contractor would be an advantage
Effective and clear communication skills, both written and verbal, to a variety of audiences of varying technical nature
A ‘doer’ who love seeing projects from ideation through to delivery
A team player who enjoys working in a consulting environment with a diverse range of stakeholders to collaboratively identify the best solution for the client
A fast learner who wants to learn new systems and processes
A good approach to health and safety and how to work safely
Some travel is required as part of this role, as such a full and clean driver’s license is essential.
What we offer
Beca prides itself on supporting a diverse and inclusive culture – open to inputs from creative people of all genders, ethnicity, identity, thought and experiences.
A supportive and caring work environment where you can bring your whole self to work
Diverse opportunities for career and professional development
Flexible working arrangements to balance your personal / family commitments
Highly supportive environment of sharing and collaboration
Excellent benefits including discounted health insurance, gym memberships, an outstanding parental leave policy, and a huge range of social events
Ready to make the move?
If you have an analytical mind and enjoy finding innovative approaches to solving problems, challenging the status quo, developing solutions to help our clients and working as part of a team with a great track record then we would be keen to hear from you.
If you want to make everyday better, apply online today on the link below. If you have any questions, call Autumn English – Talent Acquisition Business Partner on + 64 9 336 5954.
To find out more about Beca, our purpose, people and projects, visit www.beca.com.

Be recognised as a lead provider of expert traffic engineering advice
Manage safety funding, investment and programmes
Tauranga/Hamilton based
About us | Ko wai mātou
At Waka Kotahi The NZ Transport Agency, it all starts with our people. The organisation's performance and success depends on the people who choose to make this a great place to work and make a difference for New Zealand. The Transport Agency has a strong future focus, understanding that new technologies and changing customer expectations mean the transport system we know today will not be the one we deliver in ten years' time.
As the Senior Safety Engineer, you will be part of the Transport Services business group. The Transport Services group aim to provide, improve and maintain the land transport system to effectively enable transport services. Our focus is to design and deliver an integrated transport system for all New Zealanders.

The opportunity | Te Whiwhinga mahi
You will be reporting into the Team Lead – Safety Engineers, you will bring your road safety or traffic engineering background to provide technical advice and support to the Transport Services group. This is to ensure that traffic and safety policies, procedures and standards are robustly developed, analysed and implemented. You will use your strong communication and relationship management skills to work with key stakeholders externally to identify and prioritise safety measures and programmes.
You will have the opportunity to use your understanding of key data sources to assess outputs and make recommendations, as well as develop and monitor safety programmes of work. There is a travel element to the role, and the ability to work across the Bay of Plenty, Waikato and Gisborne regions.
We would also consider someone at a more junior level for this role, so whether you have three years expereince or are at the top of your game and looking for a new challenge, we want to hear from you.

About you | Ko koe tēnei

To be successful in this role, you will bring:
A background and experience in road safety engineering and/or traffic engineering
Experience with programme management
An awareness and understanding of the Safe System approach
Knowledge and understanding of the applicability and effectiveness of potential safety improvements
Understanding of key data sources (CAS, RAMM, High speed data, KiwiRAP)
Strong relationship building and stakeholder management skills
The ability to communicate the safety vision, including the safe system
The ability to influence and persuade others and bring them on the journey
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong analytical skills
The ability to generate a range of solutions and logically evaluate these
This role can be based in either Hamilton or Tauranga.

Applications close:
24th February 2020
For a copy of the position description and to apply: www.nzta.govt.nz/careers
For further information, email: careers@nzta.govt.nz
To be considered for this position you must have a legal right to live and work in New Zealand. NZ Transport Agency is an equal opportunity employer (EOE). At the Agency we recognise the importance of diversity and inclusion and are committed to providing a working environment that embraces these values. Please let us know if you need any support or have any access requirements that will help you through the recruitment process.

H2R Technology is pleased to have the opportunity to drive the recruitment of a Machine Learning Engineer within an amazing organisation, Volpara Solutions, setting out to change lives globally with its software and products.

As a senior member of the Volpara Science Team, the Machine Learning Engineer will work with the Imaging Scientists and others to apply machine learning to ultimately deliver scientifically and technically robust marketable products. The Machine Learning Engineer will push the boundaries of what we know today about cancer imaging – finding ways of using artificial intelligence to save families from cancer.

Responsibilities
Working with the clinical and product teams to fully understand the clinical problems and to deliver marketable and saleable product features.
Working with imaging scientists to devise and try either classical image processing or machine learning to the problems seeking solutions which are robust, and which will work on the millions of images being processed by us each year from multiple different x-ray machines, all with code which is reliable, robust and fast.
Taking leadership in the conversation of research codes involving classical image processing (e.g. Python/MATLAB) into robust, portable, product code.
Investigating where necessary use of hardware-based approaches to accelerating machine learning.
Educating the science team and the organisation at large regarding the capability of artificial intelligence and application to our products.
Representing the organisation at conferences and seminars, as needed.
Ensuring all the image processing and machine learning done is well documented.
Participating in other development projects outside image processing and machine learning, as needed.
Ensure that work performed by the research team is developed in such a way as to facilitate commercialisation into Volpara products, including consideration for the quality and regulatory environment.
Understand and promote the importance of information security and safeguarding of protected health information.

Experience & Qualifications
PhD specialising in image processing and/or image focussed machine learning (preferable)
Experience in a commercial environment, with a focus on translating research into shippable machine learning features/code.
Have experience of both classical image processing and machine learning
Basic understanding of Physics.
Understand image registration.
Preferably have experience in imaging and data mining.
Be able to code in C#, C++, Python or MATLAB.
Be Agile in approach

If you feel that you can add value during this exciting time at Volpara Solutions and have the above skills then you can Apply by sending your CV to Kane Landers – kane.landers@h2r.co.nz quoting “25465 – Machine Learning Engineer” in the subject line or call (04) 499 9471.
Alternatively, you can apply using the button below.

Summary
Posted: Jul 14, 2019
Role Number:200003348
Design, develop & launch next-generation Wireless Power Technologies in Apple products. We believe the future is Wireless. The mission of the Wireless Power Technology team - Create the world’s best Wireless Charging user-experience by inventing state-of-the-art technologies. The Wireless Power Technology team develops bleeding-edge Wireless Charging designs that are central to Apple’s products - the iPhone, Apple Watch, AirPods, AirPower and more. New challenges arise every day that require the sharp problem-solving skills of talented & smart individuals. The team features a collaborative and hands-on environment that cultivates engineering excellence, creativity & innovation. Join us. We are looking for a bright, self-confident, experienced firmware engineer. Pioneer best-in-class Wireless charging, for a new Wireless world.
Key Qualifications
Ideally, you will have:
5 years minimum proven experience in the field of embedded engineering
Strong skills in C/C++ and scripting languages, such as Python.
Deep understanding of data structures, object-oriented design, and system architecture in an embedded environment
Fundamental knowledge of microprocessors and RTOS concepts
Solid understanding of AGILE design methodologies
Experience with versioning and automation tools, such as git or Unit testing
Proven a strong ability to effectively manage your time and prioritise work accordingly
Effective written and oral communication skills, particularly with technical content.
Description
Working closely with hardware development team on creating wireless power technology, you will learn new concepts and help drive the resolution of ambiguous problems in a fast paced, high technology environment. You will be a technical leader in a team developing firmware for ARM Core processors and other customer ASICs - responsible for delivering features within a project, including planning, documenting and implementation. Interacting with team members locally and remotely, you will effectively communicate progress reports and issues on your work to multi-functional teams and management. We work with a global team across technologies and products that will require you to quickly familiarise and be effective with a range of firmware development tools, processes and procedures. You will be responsible for the development of new tools and general documentation to share your knowledge across the global firmware development team.
Education & Experience
Tertiary qualification(s) in electrical engineering or computer science.
Additional Requirements
Self-motivated, willing and able to operate with little direct guidance or supervision, work effectively with incomplete or vaguely defined requirements
A dedication to following our Company procedures and doing business in a manner consistent with our values
Travel to China and the USA 3 to 4 times per year, 1-2 weeks at a time.

About Rocket lab
Rocket Lab is the global leader in dedicated small satellite launch. Launching from right here in New Zealand, we design and build innovative technology to give small satellites a premium ride to orbit.

Small satellites play a crucial role in our day-to-day lives – they connect us, keep us safe, help us understand our planet and manage our impact on it, and they enable us to innovate and explore. There are endless possibilities for what we can achieve with better access to space, and that access is now a reality thanks to Rocket Lab.

Our relentlessly innovative team is behind Electron, the world’s only truly commercial small satellite launch vehicle in operation today. With multiple orbital launches under our belt and a record of 100% mission success, we’re opening access to space to improve life on Earth. We’ve built a world class team with a reputation for doing the impossible. Collaboration is at our core - every idea is heard, and everyone makes a difference. Every day, we pursue ideas that challenge, excite and demand more of us, and we make them real. Be a part of it.

About the role
As a member of the Avionics Test group, you will be on the front-line of cutting-edge avionics hardware development. You will have the unique opportunity to develop novel and streamlined test systems for mission-critical avionics and software used on the Electron rocket. This includes but is not limited to flight computers, power electronic systems, high-voltage components, FPGAs, RF systems, and components used in guidance, navigation, and control. In your role you will work to uncover how electronic circuits behave under the harshest of conditions and support the development of new test systems from the ground up including software and custom electronics. Our fundamental goal is to ensure our payloads reach orbit on time, every time. Your role working with avionics hardware is critical to this mission, and the main line of defence to ensure the quality and reliability in a fast-paced production environment.

Essential skills:
Bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering or other engineering discipline
5+ years relevant industry experience
Experience with hardware development or electronics test engineering
Experience in programming, preferably in python, LabView or C/C++
Experience in analysing circuits and developing functional test plans
Understanding of electronic circuits, design principles and manufacturing techniques to analyse and improve test coverage
Understanding and experience in environmental design testing, such as vibration, shock, thermal and TVAC
Familiarity with national instruments platforms including DAQ, PXI and cRIO
Understanding of instrumentation, interfaces and sensors including power supplies, oscilloscopes, serial devices, switch topologies, accelerometers, thermocouples, RTDs and 4-20mA sensors

As well as a being a career-defining role, working at Rocket Lab means being part of meaningful projects with world-leading experts.

Collaboration is at our core - every idea is heard, and everyone makes a difference.

We get things done. Our team is nimble, decisions are made quickly, and we are action oriented. While other companies talk about it, we do it. This means projects get the green light faster and ideas are put into practice rapidly.

Everyone works on the big stuff. This isn’t a huge aerospace company where you get lost in bureaucracy and end up a tiny cog in a giant machine. At Rocket Lab, your work directly impacts the success of each mission. Everyone’s voice is heard, and everyone can contribute major projects. This is your chance to play a pivotal role in developing space systems that change the way we access space.

Important Information
For security reasons background checks will be undertaken prior to any employment offers being made to an applicant. These checks will include nationality checks as it is a requirement of this position that you be eligible to access equipment and data regulated by the United States' International Traffic in Arms Regulations. Under these Regulations, you may be ineligible for this role if you do not hold citizenship of Australia, Japan, New Zealand, Switzerland, the European Union or a country that is part of NATO, or if you hold ineligible dual citizenship or nationality. For more information on these Regulations, click here http://www.pmddtc.state.gov/regulations_laws/itar.html.

Mobile-first disruptive tech | young ready-to-scale company | 'done-it-before' exec team
Are you ready to change how people communicate in a mobile-first world?
Here is what Spoke Phone is all about
Spoke Phone is a super-hot and fully-funded mobile-voice startup in Auckland.
We're a SaaS company with over 600 customers in just one year!
We believe the world will become mobile-first.
That's a world where employees prefer using a mobile phone, and where companies have more mobile and remote workers.
By 2025, over 50% of the workforce is expected to be mobile or remote, and they need better and more mobile experiences and capabilities.
Spoke Phone is going to own that future.
Here is what Spoke does
Spoke Phone has reinvented business communication, putting an entire enterprise-grade phone system inside a mobile phone.
We focus on the mobile user first (mobile-first design), making rich and simple user experiences on mobile phones.
Today, desk-bound workers have an advantage over mobile workers. The desk worker sits in the office and has this big screen with easy access to key business systems and customer information.
Spoke Phone brings these rich user experiences and connectivity available to desk-bound users and makes them easy-to-use on a mobile phone.
Why is Spoke Phone unique?
Spoke is all about mobile.
We are the only phone system designed specifically for mobile phones, and customers are loving it. Even Telcos love to hate Spoke Phone, with several Telecom companies now selling Spoke Phone and ripping out their own platforms.
Come join the Spoke Phone team and show us what you can do.
Here is why this job exists:
Our product and customer base is growing, and as they grow so does our roadmap. You will be part of our core team, working to maintain and extend the Spoke platform, writing and extending APIs and back-end services that our front-ends applications consume.
Our platform is fully serverless running on AWS Lambda, with our APIs exposed via GraphQL and data stored in PostgreSQL and DynamoDB. We use terraform to manage our AWS stack and use github to manage our codebase, continuously deploying via CircleCI.
We run a flat organisation and don't follow rigid scrum, kanban or any specific “agile” process; instead we prefer conversation and communication to deliver work continuously in an agile iterative way. We learn from our mistakes and are always improving the way we work and deliver working software.
Here is what you will do:
Write quality platform code - usually in Typescript or ES6/Node.js. On any given day you might be working on our core membership services, working on enhancements to our call handling gateway, or enhancing our routing and call logic to provide our customers with greater flexibility.
You might also occasionally help out with front-end work (and if you want to learn more, we're more than happy for you to do so!). Our mobile app is written in React Native, but our call stack is native code so sometimes there's a bit of Java and Objective-C or Swift code to be wrangled.
Work closely with the team to design and implement new features; whether it's database schema, API contracts, Integrations with Twilio or Stripe, or codebase architecture.
Deploy your code to production - sometimes daily via our automated build pipelines - that you'll also help to maintain.
Keep an eye on our production logs - as we all do - and flag any errors - fixing them along the way if you can.
Actively participate in reviewing everyone's pull requests. At Spoke the team owns the code and the team is collectively responsible for maintaining high standards.
Have fun, be successful, and most importantly, learn!
Here's who you are:
You are a software engineer with experience building platform APIs and services in Tyepscript or ES6/Node.js
Ideally you've worked in a SaaS product environment previously. It would be great if you have had exposure and some experience with AWS.
You're always looking to go deep on new technologies; at Spoke we look to gain advantage by adopting new, often bleeding edge platforms and frameworks.
You hold yourself to high standards; you're confident in your abilities but can check your ego at the door and know how to learn from mistakes (we all make them!)
Here's where you will work:
This is an Auckland based role, working in our co-working space in Parnell
You must already have the rights to live and work in New Zealand

The Company

Diligent is the pioneer in modern governance. We empower leaders to turn governance into a competitive advantage through unparalleled insight and highly secure, integrated SaaS applications, helping organizations thrive and endure in today’s complex, global landscape. The largest global network of corporate directors and executives, Diligent is relied on by more than 16,000 organizations and 650,000 leaders in over 90 countries. With award-winning customer service, Diligent serves more than 50% of the Fortune 1000, 70% of the FTSE 100, and 65% of the ASX. Our passionate, smart, and creative group of more than 1,000 employees support customers around the globe from offices in New York, London, Washington, DC, Amsterdam, Sydney, Christchurch, and Charlotte, NC.

Position Overview
Diligent is looking for a Site Reliability Engineer to join its Team in the US. The Site Reliability Engineer will be responsible for the support of multiple global SAAS applications. The role will focus on applications containerized with Kubernetes and automating deployments and working with the Scrum Teams support product delivery. The ideal candidate will be passionate about automation and highly skilled at in Python, Ruby or the like. We are looking for a team player with excellent communications skills who is committed to continuously improving and delivering results.
Key Responsibilities
Maintenance and support of global applications which run on CentOS Linux, Microsoft Windows, and Kubernetes.
Support development teams and work with them to help operationalize their features and provide expertise on scalability, high availability and performance.
Best-practices administration as it relates to SAAS technologies, confidential data storage and data encryption.
Work with teams to develop Service Level Objective and Indicators and support the process of collecting and these metrics to measure success of the product.
Day-to-day activities include automation of deployments throughout the software development lifecycle, supporting K8’s infrastructure
Provide expertise to development teams on monitoring, scalability and reliability.
Required Experience/Skills:
Advanced Linux administration experience (CentOS or RedHat).
In-depth knowledge of scripting in Python, Ruby, or related language
Experience with Kubernetes or related containerization software
Experience with GitHub Enterprise and GitHub Cloud
Experience with Jenkins, Puppet and Ansible is desirable.
Dynatrace, Zabbix, and other monitoring tools experience are a plus.
Ability to work well in a fast-paced environment.

About the role
Foodies is on an awesome journey to become a truly customer insights-driven and efficient Co-op, and one that is digitally enabled. We want to be a digital business that continuously exploits digital technologies, blurs digital and physical worlds – creating new sources of value for customers and increasing operational agility and simplicity

Write business code that drives our Online customer experience as well as the optimal execution of our most critical Enterprise business processes
Engage with other developers to level up on our engineering and DevOps practice up to selecting the best tools in class

Verizon Connect is guiding a connected world on the go by automating, optimizing and revolutionizing the way people, vehicles and things move through the world. You will lead a dynamic and successful team in our Christchurch office, continuously adapting and improving our methodologies and technologies to be the best at what we do: provide innovative tracking software to trucking companies all around the world. This team is responsible for maintaining and enhancing two native mobile apps (iOS and Android) as well as a legacy hybrid mobile app, and works closely with the API team and other teams within a wider group focused on regulatory compliance solutions. Optimising your squad’s specific needs and strengths.

Experience mentoring junior developers.

Knowledge of Object Oriented/SOLID Design principles and practices.
