We’ve built a world class team with a reputation for doing the impossible. Collaboration is at our core - every idea is heard, and everyone makes a difference. Every day, we pursue ideas that challenge, excite and demand more of us, and we make them real. Come and be a part of it.

About the role
The Electron Launch Vehicle is a fly-by-wire rocket and generates a large quantity of real-time data throughout its production, testing, and launch life-cycle. This data tells a story and it lets Rocket Lab engineers and key stakeholders know how we are performing at all stages.

The Operational Data software team transforms and gives this data a meaning, by providing a bespoke analysis framework customised to support the development of the next generation of spacecrafts. There's no limit to the ambition that we have to create smart, data-driven decision-making capabilities: our Data Analysis Framework is the building block on which numerous engineering teams rely to automate their data processing.

The successful applicant will play a significant role in the development of the Framework, leading the design and implementation of requested features, mentoring team-members and providing guidance to the user communities.


Required Skills and Experience:
Tertiary Diploma, Certificate or degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science or demonstrated equivalent level of knowledge
Minimum of 4 years experience within a software engineering related discipline
Experience in application development
Strong Python development experience
Experience with Git or other source control tools
Experience with Redmine, Jira, Bugzilla, Mantis, or other issue tracker
Experience in database design with SQL
Knowledge of data processing techniques
Python Experience with packages matplotlib, pandas

Desirable:
Experience with TeamCity, Jenkins or other continuous integration tools
Experience using Scrum
Reporting, including experience with creating interactive reports
Knowledge of machine learning and statistical methods
Knowledge of signal processing
Experience in database design with NoSQL databases
Experience with Airflow, Spark or other data processing pipelines
Use of Docker or other containerisation

As well as a being a career-defining role, working at Rocket Lab means being part of meaningful projects with world-leading experts.

Collaboration is at our core - every idea is heard, and everyone makes a difference.

We get things done. Our team is nimble, decisions are made quickly, and we are action oriented. While other companies talk about it, we do it. This means projects get the green light faster and ideas are put into practice rapidly.

Everyone works on the big stuff. This isn’t a huge aerospace company where you get lost in bureaucracy and end up a tiny cog in a giant machine. At Rocket Lab, your work directly impacts the success of each mission. Everyone’s voice is heard, and everyone can contribute major projects. This is your chance to play a pivotal role in developing space systems that change the way we access space.

Important Information
For security reasons background checks will be undertaken prior to any employment offers being made to an applicant. These checks will include nationality checks as it is a requirement of this position that you be eligible to access equipment and data regulated by the United States' International Traffic in Arms Regulations. Under these Regulations, you may be ineligible for this role if you do not hold citizenship of Australia, Japan, New Zealand, Switzerland, the European Union or a country that is part of NATO, or if you hold ineligible dual citizenship or nationality. For more information on these Regulations, click here http://www.pmddtc.state.gov/regulations_laws/itar.html.

Job_title: Senior Customer Advisory Engineer – Data Science / AI / ML
Summary:
Company Overview:
Are you a problem solver, explorer, and knowledge seeker – always asking, “What if?”

If so, then you may be the new team member we’re looking for. SAS is embarking on hiring a new generation of Customer Advisory people locally and globally. This new generation are not the traditional SAS mould - but change agents, leaders and advisors to take SAS’ next generation platform Viya and AI applications to new and existing customers. Our customers are asking us to lead and advise - way beyond to traditional role of a software vendor.

With both technologies and application suites in areas such a fraud, risk, marketing and IOT - SAS has grown every year since it began.

SAS’ new Viya platform revolutionises our previous market leading offering by adding capabilities such as AI and Machine Learning – but also embraces open source and a new, open micro-services, cloud-first architecture.

What we do
At SAS, we believe that curiosity is at the heart of human progress, and therefore we are deeply curious about improving lives through better decisions. We strive to empower and inspire with the most trusted analytics, designed to transform data into intelligence. Our curiosity fuels innovation, pushing boundaries, challenging the status quo and changing the way we live.

What you’ll do
We’re looking for a Data Science thought-leader able to guide our New Zealand customers along their journeys toward evolving analytics. You will use your knowledge of leading practices and technologies in the data and analytics ecosystem to understand where and how analytics can benefit our customers. The compelling solutions you will formulate will demonstrate how SAS drives valuable and dependable business outcomes using the best mix of SAS, open source and cloud options.

You will:
Build trusted relationships and develop your credibility within our market so that your proposed solutions and your practical guidance carry with weight with our customers.
Shape a positive customer experience and measurably valuable outcomes for our customers by designing compelling analytics solutions formulated to meet customer requirements and promote leading practices.
Conduct discovery processes to collect, analyze, clarify and document technical and business requirements that underpin your detailed solution proposals.
Utilize your knowledge of a broad range of SAS, open source and cloud technologies to design and demonstrate solutions to emerging and unique customer needs.
Deliver standard, customised and/or strategic presentations outlining the capabilities of your proposed solutions, including their competitive advantages and business benefits.
Work pro-actively with an extended account team of Sales Executives, Industry & Domain Solution Specialist, Partners and Architects to strategize on customer account planning, assuring customer success and developing opportunities.
Develop and maintain a detailed knowledge of SAS’ core technologies and selected business solution areas, understanding how each solution addresses business challenges and its competitive positioning.
Evangelize SAS’ solutions in the marketplace by presenting demonstrations and providing business development support at vendor-sponsored events, trade shows, and user group meetings.
Formulate winning solutions in response to RFP/RFIs and capture these thoroughly, accurately and in compelling responses.
Utilizes appropriate applications, tools, and solutions to develop and present advanced customized prototype solutions and presentations to customers at highest levels of corporate visibility.

What we’re looking for
In-depth knowledge of industry or market segments or a comprehensive knowledge of a specific industry.
Knowledge of the application of business analytics in one or more of the following domains would be desirable: “Risk Intelligence”, “Fraud, Security& Intelligence”, “Customer Intelligence”
Demonstrated knowledge and expertise across the analytics lifecycle – data preparation, model development, model deployment and governance
Knowledge of open source, COTS or cloud analytics & AI tools and services desirable (SAS, Python, R, Spark, Hadoop, TensorFlow, AWS, Azure & Google)
Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills.
Ability to gain a deep understanding of customers goals, objectives and challenges and to formulate clearly articulated solutions that map to SAS and complimentary capabilities.
Ability to work and learn independently and as part of a team.
Strongly motivated, results-oriented, team player who can manage priorities, is comfortable working in a matrixed environment, can influence effectively at multiple organizational levels and is customer obsessed.
You’re curious, passionate, authentic and accountable. These are our values and influence everything we do.

Why SAS
We love living the #SASlife and believe that happy, healthy people have a passion for life, and bring that energy to work. No matter what your specialty or where you are in the world, your unique contributions will make a difference.
Our multi-dimensional culture blends our different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. Here, it isn’t about fitting into our culture, it’s about adding to it - and we can’t wait to see what you’ll bring.

DevOps Team

ClearPoint
ClearPoint is a digital experience and engineering company. We help businesses navigate and master the perfect intersection between agility, optimised products, data and technologies to create world-class customer experiences.
Our diverse team of strategists, innovators, engineers, architects, developers and designers help solve complex business problems for many of NZ and Australia’s leading enterprises. We design, engineer and coach across products, platforms and teams with the smartest community of 10x talent. Every day is a day of learning at ClearPoint and striving to be the best we can be.
The Role

We are seeking a DevOps Engineer who has proven experience with DevOps, CI/CD and automation tools. As an experienced DevOps Engineer, you will be working closely with our talented software engineers and management to implement and manage a platform to deliver world class software. This is a support role across multiple clients and projects, working with the development teams to provide infrastructure and deployment scripts / tools to support continuous delivery.

We need someone who can:
Manage infrastructure to best practice standards
Provide input to the continuous delivery pipeline processes and look for continuous process improvement
Provide support to the ClearPoint development teams for infrastructure creation and ongoing maintenance
Provide consulting to ClearPoint clients as required

Do you have 3+ years’ experience and have experience in:
AWS / MS Azure / GCP Cloud provider knowledge
Deployment and build tools - Ansible, Artifactory, Ant, Gradle, Maven, Puppet, Chef
Network infrastructure
Unix / Linux administration including scripting with Bash and/or Python
Problem solving and problem analysis
In addition, the following will guarantee interest:
Continuous integration/delivery/deployment (Jenkins / TeamCity / Travis / Bamboo / GO.CD)
Background in some form of programming and or scripting PHP / Java / .Net
CMS or other similar CMS (Wordpress, Joomla etc)
Database MySQL, MS SQL server, Postgress etc. administration and support
Development or scripting experience PHP / Java / C# / Python
Experience with Nagios, Logstash, Hudson / Jenkins
General web dev - HTML5 / CSS / Javascript

Next Steps
Our passion for tech, shared learning and the desire to get the best outcomes for our clients, team and community is what drives us. If you are interested in this role please apply now and one of the Recruitment and Resourcing team will be in touch for a confidential discussion. You must be eligible to work in New Zealand (with a valid working Visa, Residency or Citizenship) to be successful in this application.

We need an awesome senior full-stack engineer to manage our very clever and competent Homes.co.nz tech team as well as help to continue build out NZ best property platform.
About the job:
You will be coming into an exciting, yet small team - a modern tech stack with few restrictions, and lots of data, analysis and models, as well as beautiful frontends. And something you can actually explain to your parents!
We have a microservice architecture, primarily using Go, but have components in RoR, and a front-end in Angular…. and some Python…. and R... Anyway, you should be good at, and love, coding.
Responsibilities
Manage and mentor our current tech team
Develop the homes.co.nz website and API applications to make them a) beautiful, and b) scale to every house in NZ.
Own your production infrastructure end-to-end. You’ll deploy your own code multiple times a week.
Work directly with product management to define, architect, and build new features.
Write quality, maintainable code with extensive test coverage in a fast-paced professional software engineering environment.
Requirements
5+ years building and supporting performant user-facing systems.
Expert level understanding of functional design, micro service architectures and data modelling.
You have an appreciation of design-driven coding.
Ability to mentor and lead junior/mid-level engineers.
Must be a DOer, a curious learner, and …
You must like to code!

Bonus points:
You’ve coded a system from front-end to database, and shown it to users. And then changed it based on what they said, and what you measured.
You know where to look when 100,000 people hit your website and it breaks, and … you know how to avoid that in the first place.
A passion for property
Strong problem solving skills and willingness to “get s*** done”.


Tech we use currently: Go, Angular, AngularJS, React, React Native, Postgres, Redis, ElasticSearch, Kubernetes, Docker, AWS, GitHub, Jira.
Benefits

Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

THIS POSITION IS BASED IN NEW ZEALAND

About Rocket Lab
Rocket Lab is the global leader in dedicated small satellite launch. Launching from right here in New Zealand, we design and build innovative technology to give small satellites a premium ride to orbit.

Small satellites play a crucial role in our day-to-day lives – they connect us, keep us safe, help us understand our planet and manage our impact on it, and they enable us to innovate and explore. There are endless possibilities for what we can achieve with better access to space, and that access is now a reality thanks to Rocket Lab.

Our relentlessly innovative team is behind Electron, the world’s only truly commercial small satellite launch vehicle in operation today. With multiple orbital launches under our belt and a record of 100% mission success, we’re opening access to space to improve life on Earth. We’ve built a world class team with a reputation for doing the impossible. Collaboration is at our core - every idea is heard and everyone makes a difference. Every day, we pursue ideas that challenge, excite and demand more of us, and we make them real. Be a part of it.

About the Role
As a Satellite Fluid Systems Engineer you will be responsible for leading the development of the Photon satellite bus liquid and gas plumbing systems for long term space operations.

In this role you will be tasked with delivering a product that is highly adaptable for the different configurations that the Photon satellite bus could fly with. We are looking for a technical leader with proven experience to achieve the required outcome efficiently

Photon:
Photon is Rocket Lab’s in-house designed and built satellite platform that is designed to pair with Electron as a bundled satellite build and launch service. Photon enables Rocket Lab to deliver an all-inclusive spacecraft build and launch service that helps small satellite customers focus on delivering their service from orbit and generating revenue, rather than building their own satellite hardware. Our Photon engineers provide technical leadership and nuance to all aspects of Photon’s design, development, and build. They collaborate across Rocket Lab’s avionics, manufacturing, engineering, software, and launch teams to manage the process from factory to launch, and also work with our prestigious customers during their launch campaign.

Preferred skills and expertise
5 years experience directly related to in-space fluid systems for satellites
Degree qualified in mechanical, aerospace engineering or equivalent
The ability to interpret information from others and make sound engineering decisions relevant to area of responsibility
The capability to identify work and information needed to achieve development milestones
Experienced working in a multi-disciplined team
A proven record of being able to make effective decisions between selecting “off the shelf” and purpose-built components to achieve requirements.
Strong experience with CAD, thermal & FMEA

Important Information
For security reasons background checks will be undertaken prior to any employment offers being made to an applicant. These checks will include nationality checks as it is a requirement of this position that you be eligible to access equipment and data regulated by the United States' International Traffic in Arms Regulations. Under these Regulations, you may be ineligible for this role if you do not hold citizenship of Australia, Japan, New Zealand, Switzerland, the European Union or a country that is part of NATO, or if you hold ineligible dual citizenship or nationality. For more information on these Regulations, click here http://www.pmddtc.state.gov/regulations_laws/itar.html.

New Zealand - Auckland, Auckland
Job Summary
We are recruiting a Senior Geotechnical Engineer to join our well established and growing Auckland Office. This role offers you an exciting opportunity to contribute to the success of our 40 strong national Ground Engineering team, to work with and support colleagues from a variety of engineering and environmental disciplines and to assist in the growth of our Ground Engineering and Tunnelling team.
We are looking for an ambitious team player who is looking for an opportunity to assist in the development of innovative, cost-effective and buildable solutions in an environment that is collaborative, stimulating and fast-paced. Your extensive geotechnical consultancy experience, in particular, strong capability in geotechnical studies, investigation, and design for highway earthworks, bridge foundations, retaining structures and strengthened earthworks will add to our teams existing strengths.
Nationally our Ground Engineering team provides one-stop access to services ranging from project management, feasibility studies, detailed design, contract administration and construction supervision for geotechnical works.
You will provide technical support to both internal and external clients to a high level of technical quality, to programme and budget
Utilize your expertise to apply advanced scientific principles, theories, practices and existing technologies develop technical solutions to complex problems
Interpret and record data, conducts analyses, compare findings to relevant studies and local, provincial and national regulations to ensure compliance
Undertake design and reporting of a wide variety of geotechnical works including geological and geomorphological mapping, slope stability, foundations, retaining structures, earthworks and ground improvement
Conduct research and investigation as required.
Plan and organize project studies
Assist in resolving conflicting technical information and unsuitability of standard procedures
Perform complex assignments requiring the development of unique solutions to problems.
May oversee the work of less experienced scientists.
Minimum Requirements
Experienced Geotechnical Engineer with a proven track record in studies, investigations and geotechnical design, in particular for new build transportation infrastructure.
Possess strong problem solving and interpersonal skills.
Strong written and verbal communication skills; the ability to write clear and concise technical reports is essential.
In-depth knowledge and experience of relevant design standards.
Ensures that Health and Safety issues are addressed throughout the life of a project.
In-depth hands-on experience of routinely used geotechnical software including gINT, Slope/W, SLIDE and Plaxis; GIS or Geospatial skills desirable.
In-depth knowledge of a wide variety of ground conditions and of soil and rock design parameter selection; local knowledge and experience is advantageous.
Valid driving licence is essential.
Willing to travel to other offices and sites within NZ is essential, and a willing to consider overseas assignments preferred.
Preferred Qualifications
Geotechnical Engineering are preferred, although Engineering Geologists with appropriate design skills will be considered.
What We Offer
When you join AECOM, you become part of a company that is
pioneering the future . Our teams around the world are involved in some of the most cutting-edge and innovative projects and programs of our time, addressing the big challenges of today and shaping the built environment for generations to come. We ensure a workplace that encourages growth, flexibility and creativity, as well as a company culture that champions
inclusion, diversity and overall
employee well-being through programs supported by company leadership. Our
core values define who we are, how we act and what we aspire to, which comes down to not only
delivering a better world , but working to “make amazing happen” in each neighborhood, community and city we touch. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.

Provide your Senior Programming skills to data initiatives
There’s never been a better time to join ANZ; we’re flipping traditional banking on its head
Join one of NZ’s largest technology shops; offering huge scope for career opportunity
About the role
We have an exciting opportunity for a Senior Developer to join our Data and Analytics team.
You will work in an agile and collaborative team, working with other engineers and analysts to deliver industry leading technical platform and deployment solutions which are utilised by other Data scrum teams. You will bring modern development techniques and a continuous improvement mind-set to the team and be passionate about sharing these.
You will have the opportunity to share your knowledge grow those around you whilst also applying your skills to deliver continuous improvements to our platform and process. Your day to day will be spent iteratively delivering technical platform solutions as part of a scrum team. You will be passionate about and experienced in agile development practices such as CI/CD pipelines and Test Driven Development, and will help drive continuous improvement in our scrum teams.
You will be a fast learner with a solid technical background and enjoy learning new technologies and platforms.
You will be part of an awesome, collaborative team. You will be well-supported with opportunities for your personal development and growth. Put that into a great team that is growing and changing, and you might just have your ideal role!


Role Location: Wellington
Role Type: Permanent

About you
To be successful in this role, you will bring the following:
You will be a seasoned Senior Java Developer with well-developed technology domain knowledge required
Data warehousing experience preferred, however not essential.
Experience with CI/CD pipeline automation (Jenkins)
Experience or strong interest in DevOps / SRE teams
An understanding of Openshift
A technical knowledge and understanding of Unix commands
Strong Test Automation experience
Experience with Jenkins and Open
Positive can do attitude and an excellent communicator both written, verbal and visual
Problem solver, critical thinker, agile thinker with practical agile experience (Scrum beneficial)
Experience in assisting breaking down larger features in to small increments of work that can be delivered quicker
Growth Mind-set
Some of our other benefits include:
Various leave options, including family Leave, parental Leave (26 weeks fully paid), lifestyle Leave
Staff Banking and Insurance benefits
Dedicated online learning & development portal to develop your skills and career
Southern Cross Health Insurance
Applications close: Wednesday 26th February

About ANZ
Our purpose is to shape a world where people and communities thrive. That’s why we strive to create a balanced, sustainable economy in which everyone can take part and build a better life. By helping people make the most of what they have, we transform ideas, hard work and ambition into reality.
ANZ recognises the value of an inclusive and diverse work environment. We take pride in the diversity of our people and encourage applications from diverse candidates. Our recruitment decisions are based on the key inherent needs and requirements of each role, and candidates are selected based on their unique strengths and characteristics.
The ANZ values are the foundation of how we work and support our customers.


Integrity – We are honest and fair
Collaboration – We work together for the customer
Accountability – We take ownership and get things done
Respect – We care for all those we serve
Excellence – We challenge ourselves to be better

We work flexibly at ANZ. Talk to us about how this role could be flexible for you.

ANZ recognises the importance of flexible working, watch our stories to see how ANZ aims to meet the needs of our customers and to attract and retain the best people in a changing world
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sjRskqQN4ss&list=PLk-blY9fPT7ZSqvd93KTW7NPjiF8t7i1C&index=3&t=2s
To find out more about working at ANZ or to view other opportunities visit http://www.anz.co.nz/careers
You may apply for this role by visiting ANZ Careers and search for the reference number NEW040382.

What you’ll be doing...
Verizon Connect is guiding a connected world on the go by automating, optimizing and revolutionizing the way people, vehicles and things move through the world. Our full suite of industry-defining solutions and services put innovation, automation and connected data to work for customers and help them be safer, more efficient and more productive. With more than 3,500 dedicated employees in 15 countries, we deliver leading mobile technology platforms and solutions.
As a SaaS leader, we know our talent is the most important component to our success. We hire top talent and empower them to do their best work. As a division of Verizon, we combine the fun and excitement of a startup environment with the resources, operational excellence, and brand recognition of an established tech giant.
You will lead a dynamic and successful team in our Christchurch office, continuously adapting and improving our methodologies and technologies to be the best at what we do: provide innovative tracking software to trucking companies all around the world. This team is responsible for maintaining and enhancing two native mobile apps (iOS and Android) as well as a legacy hybrid mobile app, and works closely with the API team and other teams within a wider group focused on regulatory compliance solutions. You will be working primarily with Java, Swift, Kotlin and Typescript.
Writing high-quality code - we expect a Squad Lead to lead by example in every area, none more so than in the hands-on development of our products.
Leading a cross-functional team using code on multiple platforms.
Managing deployments and testing.
Ensuring that the team is actively contributing to and reacting to automation tests.
Ensuring that code written to a high standard and ensuring a robust code review process is in place.
Educating the team on best practices, workflows, and other processes.
Optimising your squad’s specific needs and strengths.
What we’re looking for...
You’ll need to have:
Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience.
Four or more years of relevant work experience.
Experience in agile/lean methodologies and processes (ideally Kanban) leading process improvements and engineering disciplines.
Experience mentoring junior developers.
Experience in measuring and improving performance of production systems.
Knowledge of Object Oriented/SOLID Design principles and practices.
Experience with common patterns in distributed systems (REST, SOA, and DDD).
Knowledge of GIT or related source control technology.
Even better if you have:
A degree in Computer Science or a related field.
Mobile application development experience.
Knowledge of AWS based architectures and services.
Oral and written communication skills, including the ability to effectively present to engineering and product groups.
Ability to lead systems analysis with application design individually and with an architecture team to deliver detailed application specifications.
Ability to lead and guide a team.
Keyword: VZConnect
When you join Verizon...
You’ll have the power to go beyond – doing the work that’s transforming how people, businesses and things connect with each other. Not only do we provide the fastest and most reliable network for our customers, but we were first to 5G - a quantum leap in connectivity. Our connected solutions are making communities stronger and enabling energy efficiency. Here, you’ll have the ability to make an impact and create positive change. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, join our team of the best and brightest. We offer great pay, amazing benefits and opportunity to learn and grow in every role. Together we’ll go far.

We are recruiting a Senior Geotechnical Engineer to join our well established and growing Auckland Office. This role offers you an exciting opportunity to contribute to the success of our 40 strong national Ground Engineering team, to work with and support colleagues from a variety of engineering and environmental disciplines and to assist in the growth of our Ground Engineering and Tunnelling team.
We are looking for an ambitious team player who is looking for an opportunity to assist in the development of innovative, cost-effective and buildable solutions in an environment that is collaborative, stimulating and fast-paced. Summary
Posted: Feb 19, 2020
Weekly Hours: 38
Role Number:200152661
Imagine what you could do here! At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming phenomenal products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. The success we are striving will be the result of very skilled people working in an environment which cultivates creativity, partnership, and thinking of old problems in new ways. If that sounds like the kind of environment that you find intriguing, then let's talk. We believe the future is Wireless! The ultimate goal of Apple Wireless Power Team is to deliver products with highest quality and provide a seamless user experience for end users. Given the complexity and infinite possibilities comprising the use cases of wireless power technology, we work hand in hand cross-functionally to achieve this. Kicking off design verification at early stages thru validation as the design matures ensures that our team defines the unidentifiable boundary of each designed product. Are you in for the challenges? If you are passionate about evaluation of new technology, conceptualizing new verification methods, and development of new products, you will fit right in. The aim is to develop, organize, design and implement methods of verification that are essential throughout the entire design development cycle.
Key Qualifications
Relevant 5+ years of experience is required.
Self starter and motivator with good communications skills and ability to work independently as well as collaborate proactively within various levels of the organization.
Knowledgeable on Digital and Analog circuit design and circuit analysis.
Basic knowledge on Switch Mode Power Supply, Inductive or Wireless Power Transfer is an advantage.
Takes initiative to proactively identify, solve problems and has a desire to contribute.
Excellent organizational and documentation skills.
Knowledge and experience in six sigma and various statistical methods/concepts is desired.
Experience in using Python, Matlab, Labview and confident using the command line in Unix, Linux, and/or OS X
Background in designing, integrating and testing robotics / automating systems is a plus.
Ability to assess, recommend and make decisions based on data from validation testing.
Flexibility to evolving business needs, this involves willingness to participate beyond normal working hours.
Limited international travel will be required.
Description
- Provide expertise in systems engineering, architecting methods to enable verification and validation of system’s controls and hardware requirements. - Preparing concise and detailed verification/validation documentation and reports with an emphasis on prioritizing tasks to meet challenging deadlines. - Log issues, monitor progress and validate resolution once implemented. - Support analysis of factory test data and publish insightful reports. - Document test procedures, control samples and maintain records of equipment calibration. - Conduct FMEA on some areas of test processes and validation to identify design root causes of issues. - Develop and participate in conceptualizing test tools to effectively simulate user experience at any test phase during design development. - Work with other teams to conceptualize system verification and validation. - Provide close guidance to other teams in the verification and testing of specifications and requirements. - Involvement in factory testing to ensure data is relevant for validation. This is specifically meaningful in quantifying parameters to identify factory limits and margins for products.
Education & Experience
Electrical/Power Electronics Engineering degree and relevant 5+ years of experience in a related field or industry required.

Job Summary
We are recruiting a Senior Geotechnical Engineer to join our well established and growing Auckland Office. This role offers you an exciting opportunity to contribute to the success of our 40 strong national Ground Engineering team, to work with and support colleagues from a variety of engineering and environmental disciplines and to assist in the growth of our Ground Engineering and Tunnelling team.
We are looking for an ambitious team player who is looking for an opportunity to assist in the development of innovative, cost-effective and buildable solutions in an environment that is collaborative, stimulating and fast-paced. Your extensive geotechnical consultancy experience, in particular, strong capability in geotechnical studies, investigation, and design for highway earthworks, bridge foundations, retaining structures and strengthened earthworks will add to our teams existing strengths.
Nationally our Ground Engineering team provides one-stop access to services ranging from project management, feasibility studies, detailed design, contract administration and construction supervision for geotechnical works.
You will provide technical support to both internal and external clients to a high level of technical quality, to programme and budget
Utilize your expertise to apply advanced scientific principles, theories, practices and existing technologies develop technical solutions to complex problems
Interpret and record data, conducts analyses, compare findings to relevant studies and local, provincial and national regulations to ensure compliance
Undertake design and reporting of a wide variety of geotechnical works including geological and geomorphological mapping, slope stability, foundations, retaining structures, earthworks and ground improvement
Conduct research and investigation as required.
Plan and organize project studies
Assist in resolving conflicting technical information and unsuitability of standard procedures
Perform complex assignments requiring the development of unique solutions to problems.
May oversee the work of less experienced scientists.
Minimum Requirements
Experienced Geotechnical Engineer with a proven track record in studies, investigations and geotechnical design, in particular for new build transportation infrastructure.
Possess strong problem solving and interpersonal skills.
Strong written and verbal communication skills; the ability to write clear and concise technical reports is essential.
In-depth knowledge and experience of relevant design standards.
Ensures that Health and Safety issues are addressed throughout the life of a project.
In-depth hands-on experience of routinely used geotechnical software including gINT, Slope/W, SLIDE and Plaxis; GIS or Geospatial skills desirable.
In-depth knowledge of a wide variety of ground conditions and of soil and rock design parameter selection; local knowledge and experience is advantageous.
Valid driving licence is essential.
Willing to travel to other offices and sites within NZ is essential, and a willing to consider overseas assignments preferred.
Preferred Qualifications
Geotechnical Engineering are preferred, although Engineering Geologists with appropriate design skills will be considered.
What We Offer
When you join AECOM, you become part of a company that is
pioneering the future . Our teams around the world are involved in some of the most cutting-edge and innovative projects and programs of our time, addressing the big challenges of today and shaping the built environment for generations to come. We ensure a workplace that encourages growth, flexibility and creativity, as well as a company culture that champions
inclusion, diversity and overall
employee well-being through programs supported by company leadership. Our
core values define who we are, how we act and what we aspire to, which comes down to not only
delivering a better world , but working to “make amazing happen” in each neighborhood, community and city we touch. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.

Structural and Architectural Drafter
· Mix of structural and architectural drafting (Revit).
· Building structures focus.
· Permanent role with a leading company.
Our client is a leading NZ construction company, specialising in a range of commercial, industrial and rural projects. Their workload routinely incorporates large-scale, complex buildings and developments; and over the course of several decades they have established themselves as an industry leader in this field. Their project portfolio is consistently busy, and as a result of this they now require an intermediate/senior-level drafter to join their team in the Dunedin area.
Ideally you will offer 5+ years’ experience and very strong competencies in Revit. The drafting workload is both structural and architectural at a rough 75%/25% ratio respectively.
The duties and responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to:
· Preparation of construction and presentation drawings.
· Liaison and collaboration with engineers.
· Compilation of Design and Build specifications for subcontractors, as well as the evaluation of subcontractor pricing.
· Collation of building and resource consent documentation, as well as liaison with local authorities in regard to consent approval progress.
The person we seek will offer:
· Five or more years’ experience within a similar project environment.
· Demonstrable skills and experience with Revit, including BIM.
· Experience with Navisworks would be well-regarded.
· Solid competencies with both structural and architectural drafting methods.
· A thorough working knowledge of current NZ construction methodologies.
· A full skill set with interpreting plans and specifications, as well as measuring and recording data.
· Proven negotiation and problem-solving skills, and the ability to work well under pressure.
· Excellent verbal and written communication skills in general. This is a role in which you will be interacting with a wide variety of team members, clients and stakeholders; and so your communication skills are as important as your technical ability.
· A good working knowledge of commercial construction matters, such as pricing.
In return we offer the opportunity to join a high-calibre company in which you can continue to develop your career further within an organisation renowned for doing an exceptional job of looking after its people.

No work eligibility is required, I am willing to sponsor the right candidate (e.g. visa) (Preferred)

WSP is a collaborative team of global experts who aspire every day to shape a better tomorrow.

With more than 49,000 people working in over 550 offices across 40 countries, we are one of the world’s leading engineering consultancy firms.

We value our people, our reputation, and our impact on the future. At WSP our role is to plan, design, manage and engineer our communities to thrive. We want our work to bring long-term improvements and to future proof our cities and environments.

The Role:

We have an exciting opportunity for a Surveyor to join our Alexandra office. The successful candidate will provide consultancy services to clients in the areas of cadastral, land development and engineering surveys with particular emphasis on field operations, data processing, plan preparation and reporting for both survey and engineering projects. You will be an active member of the survey team and project manage, investigate, undertake a range of challenging projects. In addition, you will provide business development leadership and general surveying functions to the Alexandra/Queenstown and wider Central Otago markets.

Central Otago is famous for its iconic landscape, climate, rivers, lakes and mountains and there is an abundance of recreational opportunities for every season. You are also spoilt for choice with a wide range of fantastic eateries and award-winning local wines. If you enjoy getting out into the wide, open spaces, there are also many opportunities for recreation in and around Alexandra including boating, swimming, fishing or exploring the hills and valleys by foot, mountain bike or four-wheel drive.

Skills and Experience:

Proven experience in carrying out cadastral and engineering surveys, and reporting to required technical standards.

Experience as a Project Manager

Sound knowledge of appropriate technical standards, legislation, codes of practice and New Zealand standards

Bachelor of Surveying

Current clean and full New Zealand drivers’ licence.

5+ years’ experience in land surveying

The Role + Opportunity
To support the rapid growth of our business, we are seeking highly motivated Senior Software Engineers to join our Christchurch team. This is a fulltime permanent role based in Christchurch.
Working closely with other developers, designers, product owners and quality assurance representatives, you will be a key member of our development team building our world class products. If you are looking for a technically challenging role developing quality scientific software, then Seequent is for you.

CPB Contractors has been engaged by Auckland International Airport Limited to construct their Taxiway Mike and RSS2 Project, which comprises the construction of a new taxiway and remote stands area for servicing the International Airport Terminal Pier B.
The Taxiway Mike and RSS2 Project involves:
Landside construction of a 700m long concrete taxiway, 500mm thick
Landside construction of approx. 145,00m2 of concrete remote stands area, 500mm thick, for aircraft parking
Airside tie in of new works as required
All associated services as required such as fuel lines, power, communications, and water infrastructure
Early works commenced in September 2019, with project completion expected prior to November 2021. Our project works are well underway at the Airport and we are seeking to appoint a Quality Assurance Administrator to support our Concrete Production Team. Reporting to the Senior Project Engineer, this role will provide administrative support to both the engineers and supervisors whom ensure overall construction compliance that include engineering and documentation.

Safety and Health above all else.
Respect for the Community and Environment.
Enduring business relationships.
Our people are the foundation of our success.
Achievement through teamwork.

We are seeking a Quality Assurance Administrator to support our Concrete Production Team. Attending meetings and minute taking.
A personal commitment to working safely in everything you do.

Proficient with using either Aconex and Team Binder quality management software (training can be provided).

Strong ability to develop excellent working relationships with all staff, and other key stakeholders.

Current Drivers License.

ServiceNow DevOps Engineer
Come and make a difference helping all New Zealanders win big in a digital world!
We're looking for an experienced ServiceNow DevOps Engineer.
About Spark:
We are Spark, New Zealand's largest and multi-brand digital services company offering mobile, fixed and IT products and services to millions of New Zealand consumers and businesses. Home to inspired, forward thinkers, Spark people are at the heart of our purpose to get stuck in to enable New Zealanders to unleash their own incredible potential using the amazing technology and digital experiences we deliver. Our progressive, straight up approach to technology is evolving every day and we have a thirst for fresh, creative energy to join us in sparking New Zealand's digital future.
About the role/team:
We are the ITSM Chapter, which is part of the Service Assurance Domain which sits under the Technology tribe and, as a chapter, we are responsible for delivering the best ServiceNow customer experience for our customers, both internal and external, to ensure that they can do their jobs efficiently.
Your responsibilities will include:
You'll be engaged in delivering new capability for ServiceNow via either the implementation of new or enhancing current capability;
Championing ServiceNow will be second nature - you'll be expected to be able to sell your ideas to all areas of the business and then deliver them.;
Sharing your knowledge and expertise with all members of the team.
You'll have the following skills and experience:
At least five years of hands-on ServiceNow configuration and customisation.
You'll be familiar with domain separation, perhaps of ServiceNow being utilised in a Managed Service Provider role.
Integrations will be a major component of the role, so you'll be familiar with Azure AD, LDAP, SAP, MID, transform maps etc
You'll have a deep understanding of a variety of capabilities - Incident, Problem, Change, Service Request, Availability/Capacity Management, CMDB and Asset Management, to name but a few.
You'll have a good understanding of the principles and standards of ServiceNow custom development.
GlideRecord, ACLs, UI policies, Business Rules, Flow Designer, Agent Workspace - these will all mean something to you and not be just a random collection of words.
You'll have performed several platform upgrades in your time and are well versed in the process.
Knowledge of Portal design and widgets, reporting and dashboards is required as getting the right data to the right people at the right time is important.
We are a DevOps team and work using Agile at Scale principles so you'll either already be working in an Agile model or be ready to adapt
To succeed in this role, you'll the following traits and attributes:
You are detailed without losing sight of the big picture;
You can produce a high standard of work in a very fast-paced environment;
You can take ownership of an issue until it's resolved;
You have excellent interpersonal skills and can manage your own workload
You enjoy being part of a diverse and inclusive team
Culture:

Job Summary
We are recruiting a Senior Geotechnical Engineer to join our well established and growing Auckland Office. This role offers you an exciting opportunity to contribute to the success of our 40 strong national Ground Engineering team, to work with and support colleagues from a variety of engineering and environmental disciplines and to assist in the growth of our Ground Engineering and Tunnelling team.
We are looking for an ambitious team player who is looking for an opportunity to assist in the development of innovative, cost-effective and buildable solutions in an environment that is collaborative, stimulating and fast-paced. Your extensive geotechnical consultancy experience, in particular, strong capability in geotechnical studies, investigation, and design for highway earthworks, bridge foundations, retaining structures and strengthened earthworks will add to our teams existing strengths.
Nationally our Ground Engineering team provides one-stop access to services ranging from project management, feasibility studies, detailed design, contract administration and construction supervision for geotechnical works.
You will provide technical support to both internal and external clients to a high level of technical quality, to programme and budget
Utilize your expertise to apply advanced scientific principles, theories, practices and existing technologies develop technical solutions to complex problems
Interpret and record data, conducts analyses, compare findings to relevant studies and local, provincial and national regulations to ensure compliance
Undertake design and reporting of a wide variety of geotechnical works including geological and geomorphological mapping, slope stability, foundations, retaining structures, earthworks and ground improvement
Conduct research and investigation as required.
Plan and organize project studies
Assist in resolving conflicting technical information and unsuitability of standard procedures
Perform complex assignments requiring the development of unique solutions to problems.
May oversee the work of less experienced scientists.
Minimum Requirements
Experienced Geotechnical Engineer with a proven track record in studies, investigations and geotechnical design, in particular for new build transportation infrastructure.
Possess strong problem solving and interpersonal skills.
Strong written and verbal communication skills; the ability to write clear and concise technical reports is essential.
In-depth knowledge and experience of relevant design standards.
Ensures that Health and Safety issues are addressed throughout the life of a project.
In-depth hands-on experience of routinely used geotechnical software including gINT, Slope/W, SLIDE and Plaxis; GIS or Geospatial skills desirable.
In-depth knowledge of a wide variety of ground conditions and of soil and rock design parameter selection; local knowledge and experience is advantageous.
Valid driving licence is essential.
Willing to travel to other offices and sites within NZ is essential, and a willing to consider overseas assignments preferred.
Preferred Qualifications
Geotechnical Engineering are preferred, although Engineering Geologists with appropriate design skills will be considered.
What We Offer
When you join AECOM, you become part of a company that is
pioneering the future . Our teams around the world are involved in some of the most cutting-edge and innovative projects and programs of our time, addressing the big challenges of today and shaping the built environment for generations to come. We ensure a workplace that encourages growth, flexibility and creativity, as well as a company culture that champions
inclusion, diversity and overall
employee well-being through programs supported by company leadership. Our
core values define who we are, how we act and what we aspire to, which comes down to not only
delivering a better world , but working to “make amazing happen” in each neighborhood, community and city we touch. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.

CPB Contractors has been engaged by Auckland International Airport Limited to construct their Taxiway Mike and RSS2 Project, which comprises the construction of a new taxiway and remote stands area for servicing the International Airport Terminal Pier B.
The Taxiway Mike and RSS2 Project involves:
Landside construction of a 700m long concrete taxiway, 500mm thick
Landside construction of approx. 145,00m2 of concrete remote stands area, 500mm thick, for aircraft parking
Airside tie in of new works as required
All associated services as required such as fuel lines, power, communications, and water infrastructure
Early works commenced in September 2019, with project completion expected prior to November 2021. Our project works are well underway at the Airport and we are seeking to appoint a Quality Assurance Administrator to support our Concrete Production Team. Reporting to the Senior Project Engineer, this role will provide administrative support to both the engineers and supervisors whom ensure overall construction compliance that include engineering and documentation.
Our Values:
Safety and Health above all else.
Respect for the Community and Environment.
Enduring business relationships.
Our people are the foundation of our success.
Achievement through teamwork.
The Position
We are seeking a Quality Assurance Administrator to support our Concrete Production Team. The roles is to ensure that effective document and data controls occurs to CPB Contractors and project specific requirements by delivery accurate, timely and responsive general administrative services. The roles includes but is not limited to:
Maintain and administer the selected document control system for concrete production.
Ensure that the document control protocols are in accordance with the project specification, project quality management plan and relevant New Zealand standards. Support for this will be provided by the engineering team and project Quality Manager.
Collecting, collating, filing and archiving of pre and post production test results.
Recording, checking and tracking all incoming and outgoing concrete production documents.
Cost coding and tracking materials imported for concrete production.
Assist with collating information from the engineering team to update our project geographic information system (training will be provided).
Updating document and testing registers.
Attending meetings and minute taking.
A personal commitment to working safely in everything you do.
To be successful you will have:
Proficient with using either Aconex and Team Binder quality management software (training can be provided).
3 years’ experience in a similar role.
Advanced Microsoft Excel, Word and Outlook experience.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Strong ability to develop excellent working relationships with all staff, and other key stakeholders.
Excellent organisational skills and attention to detail.
Current Drivers License.
In return, we offer a range of benefits including:
Market competitive salary.
Structured training and development.
Corporate employee discounts with numerous providers.
Well-being benefits, e.g. vaccinations and life insurance.

Since 2002, Quantium has become the leading data analytics company in Australia. Our partnerships with industry leading companies means that we have un-paralelled access to customer behaviour data that we leverage to provide data-driven insights to our clients across Australia. We are consistently investing in next generation technology, growing our data partnerships and our client base, but most importantly we are investing heavily in our people.
We are a rapidly growing, market leading analytics firm that constantly finds new ways to enable the most progressive businesses to move forward using smart, data-driven analytics to inform practical commercial strategy.
Our team works with clients across a variety of industries including Insurance, Retail, FMCG, Banking, Consumer Services, Property and Health to identify their data and analytics needs and deliver the best combination of analytics products, bespoke analytics services and media execution.
Main headquarters are in Australia; however, we have recently opened an Auckland office and are expanding internationally with on-going projects in Asia, North America and Africa.
Our results
Work we deliver for clients transforms the way they operate. Some examples include:
Automating the modelling for a major insurer allowing their team to focus on more value-added decision support
Developed software providing insights into the behaviour of supermarket customers as it relates to a variety of factors including price, promotion and ranging
Pioneered the use of transactional banking data to provide deep customer insights for use by banks and merchants
Supporting our insurance clients to improve their monitoring, reserving and pricing capabilities
Working with government organisations to eliminate fraudulent health claims and lower the cost of delivering health services
What we are looking for
We are looking for data analysts who are passionate about solving client business problems using large, complex data sets and are interested in the wider application of analytics and data science across different industries.
Ideal candidates will have previous experience scoping and applying statistical techniques and have a passion for enhancing customer insights through applied analytics, as well as:
A degree in Actuarial, Mathematics / Statistics or similar
Knowledge in statistical tools such as SAS, SQL, R, EMBLEM and the desire to learn new coding languages and big data technologies
A flair for data visualisation
Ability to translate data into insights and communicate high level recommendations to clients
Flexibility. Our Auckland office is in its early stages and so many projects will be based out of Australia or other countries, requiring a flexible working style, and a degree of travel
We would also be interested in candidates wanting to move permanently to Australia.
Why work with us?
The Data and analytics industry is still in its infancy and Quantium is an industry leader in the field. Our analysts are focused on using data and cutting edge analytical techniques to drive insight and understanding of the needs, behaviours and habits of consumers and how they are changing.
You will:
Be part of a team that can shape the future direction of applied analytics
Learn and grow alongside some of the brightest minds in data science
Have access to world class technology platforms and innovative work
Receive great compensation and benefits
More about Quantium
As one of the world’s fully diversified data science and AI leaders we operate across every sector of the economy and we’re growing fast - with growth comes opportunity! We’re passionate about building out our team of smart, fun, diverse and motivated people.
We combine a team of experts that spans data scientists, actuaries, statisticians, business analysts, strategy consultants, engineers, technologists, programmers, product developers, and futurists – all dedicated to harnessing the power of data to drive transformational outcomes for our clients.
We actively foster a culture where our people can stretch themselves to reach their full potential. We also know that work has to work for you, and modern life is fast paced and balance can be tricky. You want to work where you are respected and valued as an individual, not a number. Quantium embraces a flexible and supportive environment dedicated to powering possibilities for our team members, clients and partners.
Quantium are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. We are a multicultural team of various beliefs, sexual orientations and gender identities. We celebrate our diversity of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status and disability status.
Please note, this role is not suitable for Graduates.
If you submit an application or expression of interest to The Quantium Group Pty Ltd, we may disclose your application or expression of interest on a confidential basis to our related companies, and joint venture companies, including Quantium Health Pty Limited. We will only make such disclosures for the purpose of considering your application or expression of interest and opportunities in those organisations.

If you are keen to gain geotechnical & civil experience then this is a fantastic opportunity. We have a number of fixed-term positions until the end of May 2020 based in Puhoi and involves working on major construction projects. This role is based Monday to Friday with some Saturdays involved (up to 50 hours per week).

This is a great opportunity to work with a forward-thinking team and experience is not essential as on the job training will be provided.

The work is varied, meaning no two days are the same and will involve:
Civil engineering field testing and investigation
Geotechnical investigation, including soil logging
Sampling of aggregate and soils
Operation of soil testing equipment including the Nuclear Densometer, shear vanes, scales etc.
Concrete testing, including sampling and slump testing
The opportunity to work both autonomously and within a team
Four-wheel driving through a range of terrains
Assisting in data management and the collating of results
Liaising with clients and engineers
The ideal person for this position will have:
A qualification in Earth Science, Geology, Physical Geography, and NZ Dip in Engineering or BE Civil (or similar)
A full drivers licence and ability to operate a manual vehicle.
The role also involves heavy lifting of machinery, so you will need to be physically fit
A passion for being outside and in the field
A reasonable grasp of the Microsoft Office suite of software
Good communication skills
Enjoy a sense of achievement from getting involved in a range of work, and thrive on the learning opportunity we can provide.
A positive attitude towards working, with the ability to maintain a fun work/life balance
About us:
We believe you should love your job and the environment you work in. Our teams are an outgoing, sporty bunch, who enjoy team events and activities. We offer a social club, family events, team competitions, a well-being allowance and a highly competitive nationwide weekly quiz. We have a great reputation within the market place through our belief in our core values of Care, Empowerment, Ingenuity, Integrity, Fun and Futurity.

The Role
From the grandest of ideas to the smallest of details, every day we're turning our passion into performance and improving life through good design.
Here at Fisher & Paykel we're passionate about our customers and we care about the details. It's this passion that inspires us towards reaching our goal - to become the most human-centered appliance brand in the world.
Fisher & Paykel Appliances design, manufacture and market a full range of human-centered appliances. We are a global company built on a heritage of innovation and pioneering spirit that has seen us consistently deliver products tailored to our customer's needs since 1934.
This is where you come in…
As Fisher & Paykel Appliances moves into a new phase of its history, global demand for both our appliances and technology is growing. To gain momentum as a global player leading innovation in the appliances' market, we are looking for a talented industrial statistician (engineer or scientist with suitable statistical expertise) who will help us turn great ideas into products our customers will love.
Product Development is critical to our success. As with earlier developments such as DishDrawerTM and CoolDrawerTM, our ongoing goal is to apply great design to make our products even more useful, more intuitive and more desirable.
To achieve this we are looking for an Industrial Statistician to collaborate with product development and other parts of our company, working closely with our teams to ensure all statistical needs of our key projects are covered. This will include supporting excellence in problem solving, experimental design, data analysis, process control, process capability and analysis of reliability data.
This role will also be instrumental in developing and delivering training to engineers in statistical methodologies relevant to product development and manufacturing environments.
So who are you?
The successful applicant will have a tertiary qualification with a strong emphasis in statistics along with at least five years' experience applying statistics in an industrial or product development environment.
This is a specialist role so strong technical and interpersonal skills, along with a high level of initiative, are essential. This role will suit a person with an outgoing and proactive approach to communication and problem-solving.
If this sounds like you, apply today!

At Geotechnics we believe you should love your job and the environment you work in. Our teams are an outgoing, sporty bunch, who enjoy team events and activities. About Rocket Lab
Rocket Lab is the global leader in dedicated small satellite launch. Launching from right here in New Zealand, we design and build innovative technology to give small satellites a premium ride to orbit.

Small satellites play a crucial role in our day-to-day lives – they connect us, keep us safe, help us understand our planet and manage our impact on it, and they enable us to innovate and explore. There are endless possibilities for what we can achieve with better access to space, and that access is now a reality thanks to Rocket Lab.

Our relentlessly innovative team is behind Electron, the world’s only truly commercial small satellite launch vehicle in operation today. With multiple orbital launches under our belt and a record of 100% mission success, we’re opening access to space to improve life on Earth. We’ve built a world class team with a reputation for doing the impossible. Collaboration is at our core - every idea is heard and everyone makes a difference. Every day, we pursue ideas that challenge, excite and demand more of us, and we make them real. Be a part of it.

About the role
Working as part of the Electron Vehicle Team, you will have the opportunity to work on a new launch vehicle using state of the art manufacturing and production techniques, working closely with the test engineers and the design engineers to achieve the highest product quality and safety standards.

You will be preparing and assembling the orbital vehicle systems and subsystems to the highest quality standards. Key tasks will include the assembly of the rocket tank high-pressure Helium and Nitrogen pressurization systems using Swagelok valves, tubing and fitting components.

Your attention to detail will be vital as you will record and document every modification, deviation & updates.

Minimum requirements
3+ years’ work experience in aeronautic/aerospace systems assembly, construction and modifications. In particularly, experience with high pressure pneumatic Swagelok components assembly is essential.
A very tidy, methodical and meticulous approach to work.
In-depth knowledge of best practices for assembly work and procedures.
A problem-solving, proactive, enthusiastic and creative approach to work
Capable of working effectively as part of a team as well autonomously
The ability to work under pressure and to tight deadlines.
The ability to take a flexible approach and to adapt to change quickly and positively.
The ability to think quickly and make accurate judgements.

As well as a being a career-defining role, working at Rocket Lab means being part of meaningful projects with world-leading experts.

Collaboration is at our core - every idea is heard, and everyone makes a difference.

We get things done. Our team is nimble, decisions are made quickly, and we are action-oriented. While other companies talk about it, we do it. This means projects get the green light faster and ideas are put into practice rapidly.

Everyone works on the big stuff. This isn’t a huge aerospace company where you get lost in bureaucracy and end up a tiny cog in a giant machine. At Rocket Lab, your work directly impacts the success of each mission. Everyone’s voice is heard, and everyone can contribute major projects. This is your chance to play a pivotal role in developing space systems that change the way we access space.


Important Information:
For security reasons background checks will be undertaken prior to any employment offers being made to an applicant. These checks will include nationality checks as it is a requirement of this position that you be eligible to access equipment and data regulated by the United States' International Traffic in Arms Regulations. Under these Regulations, you may be ineligible for this role if you do not hold citizenship of Australia, Japan, New Zealand, Switzerland, the European Union or a country that is part of NATO, or if you hold ineligible dual citizenship or nationality. For more information on these Regulations, click here http://www.pmddtc.state.gov/regulations_laws/itar.html.

What you’ll be doing...
Verizon Connect is guiding a connected world on the go by automating, optimizing and revolutionizing the way people, vehicles and things move through the world. Our full suite of industry-defining solutions and services put innovation, automation and connected data to work for customers and help them be safer, more efficient and more productive. With more than 3,500 dedicated employees in 15 countries, we deliver leading mobile technology platforms and solutions.
As a SaaS leader, we know our talent is the most important component to our success. We hire top talent and empower them to do their best work. As a division of Verizon, we combine the fun and excitement of a startup environment with the resources, operational excellence, and brand recognition of an established tech giant.
You will lead a dynamic and successful team in our Christchurch office, continuously adapting and improving our methodologies and technologies to be the best at what we do: provide innovative tracking software to trucking companies all around the world. This team is responsible for maintaining and enhancing two native mobile apps (iOS and Android) as well as a legacy hybrid mobile app, and works closely with the API team and other teams within a wider group focused on regulatory compliance solutions. You will be working primarily with Java, Swift, Kotlin and Typescript.
Writing high-quality code - we expect a Squad Lead to lead by example in every area, none more so than in the hands-on development of our products.
Leading a cross-functional team using code on multiple platforms.
Managing deployments and testing.
Ensuring that the team is actively contributing to and reacting to automation tests.
Ensuring that code written to a high standard and ensuring a robust code review process is in place.
Educating the team on best practices, workflows, and other processes.
Optimising your squad’s specific needs and strengths.

You’ll need to have:
Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience.
Four or more years of relevant work experience.
Experience in agile/lean methodologies and processes (ideally Kanban) leading process improvements and engineering disciplines.
Experience mentoring junior developers.
Experience in measuring and improving performance of production systems.
Knowledge of Object Oriented/SOLID Design principles and practices.
Experience with common patterns in distributed systems (REST, SOA, and DDD).
Knowledge of GIT or related source control technology.
Even better if you have:
A degree in Computer Science or a related field.
Mobile application development experience.
Knowledge of AWS based architectures and services.
Oral and written communication skills, including the ability to effectively present to engineering and product groups.
Ability to lead systems analysis with application design individually and with an architecture team to deliver detailed application specifications.
Ability to lead and guide a team.
Keyword: VZConnect
When you join Verizon...
You’ll have the power to go beyond – doing the work that’s transforming how people, businesses and things connect with each other. Not only do we provide the fastest and most reliable network for our customers, but we were first to 5G - a quantum leap in connectivity. Our connected solutions are making communities stronger and enabling energy efficiency. Here, you’ll have the ability to make an impact and create positive change. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, join our team of the best and brightest. We offer great pay, amazing benefits and opportunity to learn and grow in every role. Together we’ll go far.

The opportunity to work both autonomously and within a team
Assisting in data management and the collating of results
Liaising with clients, engineers and the batching plant

About you:
Ideally you will have experience in concrete testing or a similar role, however this is not essential
An interest in science and civil engineering
Physically capable to lift 25kgs samples, handle and test aggregate and concrete samples
Have excellent verbal communication
Can work well in a team or independently
Holds a Restricted or Full NZ drivers licence
Attention to detail
Successful candidates are required to undergo a drug test for this role

Why join us?

We believe you should love your job and the environment you work in. Our teams are an outgoing, sporty bunch, who enjoy team events and activities. We offer a social club, family events, team competitions, a well-being allowance and a highly competitive nationwide weekly quiz. We have a great reputation within the market place through our belief in our core values of Care, Empowerment, Ingenuity, Integrity, Fun and Futurity. We are a specialist geotechnical testing company, providing laboratory and field testing services to the civil and environmental engineering industry with offices in Auckland, Hamilton, Tauranga, Wellington, Nelson and Christchurch.

Think you'd fit in? Apply now!

Position description.

What you will do

You will be a member of a six-person team responsible for maintaining and evolving the operational infrastructure for the .nz ccTLD. You will work closely with our research and policy team as well as software developers to advance our DNS platform and implement the bedrock of the New Zealand Internet space.

Our organisation has the responsibility of providing a core service for New Zealand to the entire world and accordingly you will be granted autonomy to see the service done well. We heavily invest in infrastructure that is reliable, secure and manageable. You will automate operations extensively for the sake of security, compliance, and resilience. Our focus on automation means that you will have some software engineering skills and be able to drive a project to accomplish these goals.

The DNS platform is comprised of name server software, switching, anycast, and HSMs deployed in avariety of data centres across New Zealand. DNSSEC, using the OpenDNSSEC signer software, hasbeen fully deployed for all our zones. You will engage with third-party providers regarding the delivery of.nz nationally and overseas.

We have been extensively involved in the development of DNSSEC standards and tools and the signingof the root nameservers. Our preference is to use open source software and to contribute back to the open source community.

What we are looking for

Effective engineers know how to properly prioritise, have a great work ethic and communicate well. Wewill be looking for those skills in candidates.

As well as these skills you will need:
a working familiarity with large scale name server infrastructure and
knowledge of DNS, DNSSEC, routing protocols including BGP
a team-first attitude, automation, tests and documentation critical to a functional team
we provide 24 hour on-call support and so a willingness to be on-call and to provide support to the on-call team for escalated issues is essential for this position. The on-call time is split between theteam of six people.

Skills you'll need to develop

We like Python, but we're open to change. Ansible is used for all system management, with each infrastructure role being testable. Testing this infrastructure is a key ongoing skill.

You'll need to gain domain specific knowledge regarding the .nz registry software, but given the custom-nature of that we don't expect that coming in to the role.

What can we offer you?

Along with a great team environment, we have a range of benefits to offer including:

life and critical illness insurance
paid home internet connection and cellphone contract
support for engaging the wider DNS community, attending and presenting at conferences
additional Kiwisaver contributions
4.5 weeks annual leave
10 days sick leave
Long Service Leave
a strong commitment to training and development.

If applying from offshore a relocation package may be available

If you are interested in this vacancy send your CV and covering letter to recruitment@internetnz.net.nz. In your covering letter please outline how your experience matches what we are looking for.
