Our purpose
Here at Datacom we connect people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in. Our continued commitment to deliver excellence to our customers is built around a true partnership approach.
About the Role
The Senior Cloud Engineer is responsible for the ongoing technical operation of the Datacom Cloud platform and associated services. They will work collaboratively with geographically dispersed teams of Cloud Engineers and Architects to proactively manage the Datacom Cloud platform.
Due to the Nature of the Clients you will be working with you will need to be an NZ/AUS Citizen and have the ability to pass additional security clearances
What you’ll do
As one of our Senior Engineers you will be a hands-on professional technical engineer with responsibilities across a broad range of technologies. You will maintain knowledge of the technologies deployed as well as up to date professional certifications to ensure the delivery of an exceptional service.

What your day to day will look like:
Ongoing management and delivery of the various Datacom Cloud Platforms to agreed OLAs and SLAs
Identifying and implementing improvements to team processes.
Maintaining awareness and knowledge of current market and industry developments and providing suitable interpretation to Management and relevant staff within the organisation.
Reporting: ensuring all operation is managed and prepared for the customer and senior management as required.
Proactive engagement with customers to ensure their requirements are continually being met with positive outcomes.
Facilitating the provision of sound consulting advice to the customer as required and assisting them in the identification of solutions for their identified business requirements.
Reporting: ensuring all operational documentation is managed and prepared for the customer and senior management as required.
Assist with implementing upgrade/refresh programs, customer deployments/migrations and regular patching
Identifying and reporting to management of any risks and issues within the Datacom Cloud environments.
What you’ll bring

Minimum 5 years experience in an Enterprise level Administrator role performing daily server / storage / backup / virtualization maintenance tasks and checks
Strong communication skills.
The ability to produce accurate and concise technical documentation.
Proactive focus with a drive to deliver positive outcomes.
Excellent technical and analytical skills.
Experience working in an ITIL aligned environment
Cross skilled and able to support a Cloud System stack comprising of Automation/Orchestration, Hypervisor, Server, Backups, Storage, Network & Application layers.
Exposure to DR methodologies, planning and execution.
A deep understanding of Enterprise Network Platforms (Cisco preferred) and associated Management Platforms.
Extensive experience in supporting Enterprise VMware, Storage, Windows Server, Network and/or Backup environments.
Experience operating a highly available Platform with rigorous availability and planned downtime targets.
Ability to upskill in new technologies.
The Nitty Gritty
We have over 6,200 people across our global offices, and generate an annual revenue of over $1.2 billion, this makes us one of Australasia’s largest professional IT services companies. We have extensive expertise in operating data centres, providing IT services, software engineering and application management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations. With this comes a long list of significant clients Datacom is committed to hiring, developing and promoting the best talent from a diverse range of backgrounds. We are local at heart, yet world-class in capability.

Fantastic work place and superbly diverse and happy teams.
Easily accessed offices - Auckland City
Constant project and programme environment.

ABOUT THE COMPANY
Our client is a very large end client based in the Auckland City region. The environment is very much an enterprise from a project, system and hardware perspective and highly focussed on providing services to the community and country.

ABOUT THE ROLE
As the ETL & Data Lead, you will be responsible in leading ETL development projects along with ongoing coaching and mentoring of the team wherein you will define and establish technical standards, provide technical guidance and provide ETL architecture along with development, data modelling, dimensional modelling and star schemas.


SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
ETL / Business Intelligence - a minimum of 8yrs commercial experience in which you have also built several Data Warehouses from scratch and have lived and breathed Data Modelling.
Functions - essentially, the person should have solid experience in technical requirements and data modelling using the Kimball methodology.
Tools 1 (essential) - Microsoft BI Suite (SSIS / SSRS / SSAS) / Power BI
Tools 2 (essential) - ETL - WhereScape RED / Cloud - Azure
Communication - excellent written and oral communication skills

HOW TO APPLY

Serko is an established leader in the Australasian market in travel and expense management applications aimed at making business travel personal. Zeno, our new platform, is revolutionising the world of online travel and expense management, providing the control that travel managers need with an easy interface that travellers love. We’re seeking designers and researchers who are interested in joining us on our journey as we extend, adapt and improve our products.
As a Design Research Lead at Serko, you will strategically lead the development of Serko’s research discipline to foster user-centered design thinking and collaborate with cross-functional teams to leverage research methodologies that deliver insights to drive informed decision-making.
This is a ‘player-coach’ role – while undertaking your own research activities, you’ll provide mentorship and critique to Product Designers and other Design Researchers in Auckland and Minneapolis. Within cross-functional teams, you’ll advocate for and drive adoption of best-practice design research methods, ensuring team engagement in studies and a shared understanding of research findings.
You’ll contribute to the overall design strategy, while building relationships with key stakeholders and leaders to evangelise design thinking throughout the organization. Your work will create alignment on user needs, product strategy and inform long-term roadmaps.

Responsibilities
Work collaboratively with product managers, software engineers and designers.
Design, plan and facilitate workshops during discovery and delivery.
Gather data about the market, user needs and behaviours through desk research and field research.
Attend client visits with cross-functional teams to gather first-hand observations of real-world usage and support partners in developing relationships with key customers.
Synthesise findings and data into insights that can be communicated in a coherent and truthful story that resonates with stakeholders.
Contribute to strategic planning and produce business cases where required for larger initiatives.
Requirements
You’ll have 5+ years of proven design research experience in software and be able to articulate how your work in this area has made an impact.
You’ll have a wealth of experience with a variety of quantitative and qualitative research techniques and methodologies, designing and facilitating workshops. You’ll be familiar with all the usual tools and techniques including canvases, ideation, personas, journey maps, wireframes and prototypes.
You understand complex needs across product teams and are able to identify the correct research methodologies and techniques to apply at the right time.
You’ll be able to clearly communicate user needs and insights to both technical and business stakeholders to influence and inspire change.
You thrive in a collaborative, team environment and can provide mentorship that elevates the practice of the entire team.
You are comfortable with rapid change and the dynamic environments that comes with working in a high-growth tech company.
You understand the value of first-hand observation of users and won’t mind a bit of travel to conduct research where required.
Bonus points if you have experience in Design Systems, Chatbots, Artificial Intelligence, Analytics, Information Design and/or a passion for Travel.
Benefits
Serko's people are rewarded for their efforts with a great salary, competitive benefits, offices with a pool table, table tennis table, exceptional coffee and a great social atmosphere.
If you’re up for a challenge and are excited about joining a local business with a growing international reputation, we’d love to hear from you.
To find out more about working at Serko go to https://www.serko.com/careers
Serko is a NZ Immigration Accredited Employer

We are looking for a Senior Application Security Engineer to join our team in Newmarket. Within the Security team, you will improve the robustness of our security engineering practices, tools and product while building a healthy security culture across Vend.

We're not an ordinary company, so we don't expect you to be either. If you love learning new stuff and enjoy digging into hard work - keep on reading!

Who we are and what we do:
--------------------------

Vend is an award-winning, fast-growing Saas company winning on a global scale
We have over 360 talented people across 5 major markets (US, CA, UK, NZ, AU) working to delight approximately 25,000 awesome retailers worldwide
We travel worldwide to research how other SaaS companies work and implement the best bits
Our mission: help our retailers build thriving businesses, live more fulfilling lives and create experiences that people love.

What you'll be doing:
---------------------------------

Threat model existing applications
Be a subject matter expert to engineers empowering them to prevent weaknesses before they are shipped to our retailers
Correctly balance security risk and product advancement
Write code to develop small security tools and libraries, this may be to solve a class of vulnerability throughout the product or tooling to support engineering teams
Perform code reviews and penetration testing on our internal and external applications
Help manage vulnerability reports from external security researchers through our HackerOne bug bounty program
Perform reactive incident response when a security event occurs
We are a lean, multidisciplinary team driving to be progressive in our approach to security and the security culture at Vend. Our mission is to cultivate trust with people by keeping their data and systems resilient to threats.

What you need to bring:
-----------------------

Technical knowledge of security engineering, identity and access management, applied cryptography, and security protocols
Knowledge of, and hands-on experience with common web application vulnerabilities
Experience doing application threat modelling and secure code reviews
Previous software engineering experience in a production environment
Acting responsibly with sensitive and confidential information, and appreciate that some black-hat hackers work at unsociable hours
Why do you want to work at Vend?
--------------------------------

We will provide you with opportunities to develop your career: learning & development budget, regular 'lunch and learns', training sessions…
We offer a flexible working environment: you can work remotely from your home location on an adhoc basis, and enjoy flexible working hours
You can help build an amazing product in a company big enough for growth but lean enough to make a genuine impact
Plus, we have a range of benefits that'll keep you happy, healthy and (not) hungry:

Secure, full-time carpark
Dog-friendly environment
Free fresh fruits, snacks and drinks (and cake for your birthday!)
Paid leave and assistance for new parents
Travel insurance for you and your family
Vend Share Options scheme
Four weeks annual leave + extra day over the Christmas holidays
Where to from here?
-------------------

Obviously, we're looking to ensure it's a solid fit from both sides: we want you to step into a role you love, and we want to offer you a place you're proud to come to every day. For a glimpse into our world, feel free to check out our Instagramhere ( https://www.instagram.com/lifeatvend/ ).

Vend is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values inclusion and diversity.

What you’ll be doing...
Verizon Connect is guiding a connected world on the go by automating, optimizing and revolutionizing the way people, vehicles and things move through the world. Our full suite of industry-defining solutions and services put innovation, automation and connected data to work for customers and help them be safer, more efficient and more productive. With more than 3,500 dedicated employees in 15 countries, we deliver leading mobile technology platforms and solutions.
As a SaaS leader, we know our talent is the most important component to our success. We hire top talent and empower them to do their best work. As a division of Verizon, we combine the fun and excitement of a startup environment with the resources, operational excellence, and brand recognition of an established tech giant.
You will lead a dynamic and successful team in our Christchurch office, continuously adapting and improving our methodologies and technologies to be the best at what we do: provide innovative tracking software to trucking companies all around the world. This team is responsible for maintaining and enhancing two native mobile apps (iOS and Android) as well as a legacy hybrid mobile app, and works closely with the API team and other teams within a wider group focused on regulatory compliance solutions. You will be working primarily with Java, Swift, Kotlin and Typescript.
Writing high-quality code - we expect a Squad Lead to lead by example in every area, none more so than in the hands-on development of our products.
Leading a cross-functional team using code on multiple platforms.
Managing deployments and testing.
Ensuring that the team is actively contributing to and reacting to automation tests.
Ensuring that code written to a high standard and ensuring a robust code review process is in place.
Educating the team on best practices, workflows, and other processes.
Optimising your squad’s specific needs and strengths.
What we’re looking for...
You’ll need to have:
Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience.
Four or more years of relevant work experience.
Experience in agile/lean methodologies and processes (ideally Kanban) leading process improvements and engineering disciplines.
Experience mentoring junior developers.
Experience in measuring and improving performance of production systems.
Knowledge of Object Oriented/SOLID Design principles and practices.
Experience with common patterns in distributed systems (REST, SOA, and DDD).
Knowledge of GIT or related source control technology.
Even better if you have:
A degree in Computer Science or a related field.
Mobile application development experience.
Knowledge of AWS based architectures and services.
Oral and written communication skills, including the ability to effectively present to engineering and product groups.
Ability to lead systems analysis with application design individually and with an architecture team to deliver detailed application specifications.
Ability to lead and guide a team.
Keyword: VZConnect
When you join Verizon...
You’ll have the power to go beyond – doing the work that’s transforming how people, businesses and things connect with each other. Not only do we provide the fastest and most reliable network for our customers, but we were first to 5G - a quantum leap in connectivity. Our connected solutions are making communities stronger and enabling energy efficiency. Here, you’ll have the ability to make an impact and create positive change. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, join our team of the best and brightest. We offer great pay, amazing benefits and opportunity to learn and grow in every role. Together we’ll go far.

ClearPoint
ClearPoint is a digital experience, platforms and engineering company. We help businesses navigate and master the perfect intersection between agility, optimised products, data and technologies to create world-class customer experiences. Our diverse team of strategists, innovators, engineers, architects, developers and designers help solve complex business problems for many of NZ and Australia’s leading enterprises. We design, engineer and coach across products, platforms and teams to make an impact with our clients and striving to be the best we can be.
Our company strategy has recently evolved and to ensure we better serve our existing and new customers, ClearPoint is following a focus on platforms. It’s only natural that key to that strategy is the world’s #1 CRM solution Salesforce, which we are now an official consulting partner for.
We are building our Salesforce practice and seek experience Salesforce professionals that want to make a difference for New Zealand & Australian companies. We work in the enterprise & corporate segments primarily and have an enviable list of customers we have built up over the last 12+ years.
We have the scale to provide our customers, including in Financial Services & Retail, with end-to-end solutions to help them transform their businesses.

The Role
To help with the growth of our Salesforce practice, we are seeking experienced Salesforce Functional Consultants. Specifically in Service Cloud & Sales Cloud, of which you will hold a consultant level certification in at least one of these. Experience working within Financial Services or Retail will be highly advantageous.
This is a diverse role where you’ll have ample opportunity to apply your cross-domain, cross-functional and cross-industry expertise. You will be involved right from pre-sales, through implementation and beyond.
We are looking for both permanent team members and seasoned contract professionals. Both Senior & Intermediate.
You’ll also have experience in the following areas:
Salesforce Service Cloud
Salesforce Sales Cloud
Running workshops to elicit requirements
Running demo’s and presenting Salesforce to stakeholders
Mapping functional requirements to out of the box capabilities
Estimating effort to configure or customise Salesforce based on requirements
Solution design and creating a vision for our a customer will manage their business process.
Working with customer product owners to ensure a solution that fits their expectations and budget requirements
Running end-user or train the trainer sessions.
Experience working in an Agile software methodology/delivery
Ability to consult, negotiate and influence with stakeholders and members of the team
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with good stakeholder engagement skills
Certified Salesforce professional in either Service Cloud or Sales Cloud.
Experience working within enterprise or corporate level customers
At least 2 years working with Salesforce.
Next Steps
Our passion for tech, shared learning and the desire to get the best outcomes for our clients, team and community is what drives us. If you are interested in this role please apply now and one of the Recruitment & Resourcing team will be in touch for a confidential discussion. You must be eligible to work in New Zealand (with a valid working Visa, Residency or Citizenship).

Company Description
Do you want to be part of a small team of skilled engineers ensuring the TWG businesses stay connected and operational 24 x 7? From our Retail stores, to our Distribution Centres, Data Centres and Corporate offices, this role is part of a team responsible for setting the standards, designing, testing and overseeing the implementation and support of the IS Network (both Wireless and wired) across The Warehouse Group including The Warehouse, Noel Leeming Group, Warehouse Stationery and Torpedo7.

Job Description
As a skilled Network Engineer, you will be work within a high functioning team who are responsible for supporting a wide range of network technologies and environments. You will work across our business and be a key driver in delivering new solutions, as we continue to align the businesses across common networking solutions.

Qualifications
You are an experienced Senior network engineer, well versed in designing, supporting and enabling networking solutions at an enterprise level. You have a positive attitude, are highly motivated, maintain high energy levels, drive and enthusiasm towards achieving the company's and your personal goals and objectives.
In terms of a technical skill set, you'll bring the following:
Significant experience within a large enterprise building and maintaining networks.
Significant understanding of wired and wireless technology.
Significant knowledge of Security appliances and solutions.
Delivers complex systems that achieve their goals.
Recommends team architecture vision.
Deep technical proficiency of Server operating systems, Hypervisors, terminal servers, databases.
Good understanding of Cloud solutions and DevOps working methodologies
Must demonstrate the ability to formulate sound solutions based on formal training, research, and expertise with little guidance from management
Must possess strong analytical and problem-solving skills while maintaining a view of the ‘big picture’ and strategic goals.
Experience in a systems design role with specific skills in designing, implementing & supporting complex highly available redundant systems
Up to date understanding of current and emerging threats.
Demonstrate an understanding of the value and use of procedures and standards
Solid written and presentation skills and verbal communication
Ideally, you’ll have the following certifications OR proven experience in each area:
Cisco certification (CCNP essential)
Palo Alto certification (PCNSA essential) (PCNSE preferred)
Aerohive certification (ACTP preferred)
CWNA certification (preferred)
You’ll be joining a team who places huge emphasis on being a team. We’re serious about getting the job done but we like to have fun while doing it. We know any one of us doesn’t have all the answers so we’re always looking to leverage each other’s strengths, share knowledge and learn from the people next to us.

Additional Information
We've got an awesome North Shore location with views across the Waitemata Harbour, and an onsite café. We'll also give you your birthday off, great discounts across all our brands and excellent career development opportunities.
If you think you've got what it takes to support one of New Zealand's largest businesses apply now!

Would you like to be part of a team that is redefining the IT industry? Amazon Web Services is leading the next paradigm shift in computing and is looking for a world class candidate for the role of Partner Solution Architect, within our Global Systems Integrators (GSI) Channels & Alliances business function.

This is an ideal role for someone who has experience working for or with a global systems integrator, technology consulting firm, or a Fortune 1000 company. If you are a problem solver with broad technical skills, and have the ability to drive technical conversations you will enjoy this role.

Working with partners is a team effort that will require influence and coordination with many stakeholders. You should be just as comfortable talking storage and networking with the VP of Infrastructure or continuous deployment with the DevOps team, TCO with the CFO, and cloud strategy with the CIO. The ideal candidate should also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges.

In this technical role, you will architect enterprise-grade Amazon Web Services solutions, own the technical relationship and deliverables for a GSI, develop and execute multi-day workshops, lead white boarding sessions, author white papers and blog posts, and respond to complex technical inquiries. As a Partner Solution Architect focused on Global System Integrators within Amazon Web Services (AWS), you will have the opportunity to help shape and deliver on a strategy to build mind share and broad use of the AWS platform across the partner community.

The ideal candidate will possess deep technical skill in software architecture, information security, compliance initiatives, software deployment and cloud computing as well as customer facing skills at all levels of a partner organization. The ideal candidate should also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges. The ideal candidate is also an influencer by nature and must be seen as someone the partners are eager to engage with and have a strong hands-on approach.

Key Responsibilities:
As a strategic member of the regional Partner Solution Architect team, you will act as a trusted advisor to our managed global systems integrators. This includes:
Provide the architectural guidance and recommendations necessary to promote successful partner engagements worldwide.
Work closely with Partner Sales Managers, AWS Professional Services and other Solutions Architects throughout the lifecycle of customer engagements.
Assist partners define the approach, tools, and target architecture as they migrate customers or build cloud native solutions on Amazon Web Services.
Validate Partner architectures, deliverables, SOW’s, Project plans, and other assets required to successfully deliver partner lead customer engagements.
Assist solution providers with the definition of technical strategies that will enable them to sell more of their offering on the AWS platform.
Capture and share best-practice knowledge with our broader Solution Architect community.
Share partner and customer feedback to internal product management and engineering teams to help drive the future of AWS.
Up to 40% travel is required.

Exhibit the attributes of learn and be curious by demonstrating the ability to quickly assimilate information about new technologies and business models
Experience designing and implementing enterprise-grade architectures for Fortune 1000 companies
Passion for working with global systems integrators
Broad based technology experience including: cloud computing, applications development, DevOps, IoT, relational databases, NoSQL databases, analytics, networking, security, storage, compute, continuous deployment, containers, and management and monitoring
Demonstrated ability to think strategically, and act tactically, about business, product, and technical challenges
Experience executing large scale data center transformation or application migration and modernization projects
Cloud and/or AWS experience; AWS Certifications: AWS Certified Solutions Architect - Associate Level, AWS Certified Developer - Associate Level, AWS Certified SysOps Administrator - Associate Level; and AWS Certified Solutions Architect – Professional, AWS Certified Devops Engineer - Professional
Visible IT Industry thought leadership on relevant topics related to enterprise IT infrastructure
International technical sales and delivery experience w/ global F500 enterprise customers and partners
Use of AWS services in distributed environments with Enterprise Software

If you've always wanted to apply your skills to a large-scale Kiwi success story, then today is your lucky day - as we are on the lookout for new System Specialists and Senior System Specialists to join us here at ASB!
About us:
We're not your average bank and break the assumptions of tech in banking being old and decrepit (yay us!). We embrace innovation at speed, using modern tools and technologies to get us ahead of the game and stay there.
You'll be part of a team that are on the forefront of working to deliver a secure, functional and performant product that delights our customers every day. In our diverse and accepting environment, our people grow their agile mind-set, learn, evolve and utilise their skills, while being empowered to make decisions.
About the role:
As part of a larger team providing the foundational technologies behind ASB, we're looking for the right people to build and facilitate the implementation and evolution of modern observability services and practices across and on behalf of our ENTIRE ASB technology team.
It's a large ongoing responsibility; a typical day might see us considering how a team can understand what the right choice is between using Docker and Kubernetes for their container management, how we can proactively understand the impact of moving to the latest version of Windows for a 20-year-old legacy application, or what's the latest unnecessary toil we can remove from a team just by better managing our data points?
As a Systems Specialist with an interest and desire to work on observability, you'll be keen to be part of a squad focussed on providing solutions to these types of challenges. You'll not only possess the technical skills to drive the implementation and scaling of modern monitoring, logging and alerting systems, but you'll have the voice to collaborate with other engineering teams and share your ideas on what the future could and should hold for observability at ASB.
This will include the following responsibilities:
Identifying and configuring data collection points from source systems or existing tooling
Building observability into our foundational technologies
Working with teams to meet their observability needs using appropriate alerting and dashboards
Operating the underlying hardware ensuring it meeting the capacity and performance needs of customers
About you:
We'll value your proven initiative, problem solving abilities and leadership skills as we look for every engineer to lead from their position.
With regards to background, you might have the following capabilities:
Experience with the Elastic stack of technologies in an observability context is a must.
Experience with AppDynamics will also be a huge advantage.
Experience operating the underlying hardware to run large scale observability solutions
Solid understanding and experience with a variety of technology logging and tracing mechanisms.
In addition, any of the following would be a huge bonus:
Experience specifically with Elasticsearch
Programming or scripting skills, especially in Groovy, JS or Python
Experience in defining Service Level Indicators and Objectives
Experience with other observability and monitoring tools like Datadog, Grafana/Promethius or Nagios

What's in it for you:
We offer a competitive salary and bonus, great banking benefits, heaps of personal and career development opportunities, flexible working styles, extra holidays and parental benefits.
If we've nailed our pitch and this role sounds like it might be the one for you then please click "apply"… we'd love to hear from you!

Who is RUSH?
We are an integrated design + technology studio.
We're a squad of strategic thinkers, empathetic designers and technical mavericks.
We’re united by our love of technology and its potential for making lives better. Some of us are big picture thinkers, some of us creatively driven. And some of us love nothing more than deep diving into a thorny technical challenge. But we’re all human, inspired by human stories and driven by a desire to create human-centred experiences.
We're chasing down the future. We design and engineer exciting new ways to engage with the world's challenges, big or small. Sometimes they're business challenges, sometimes they're about being better humans. But we get the same rush from taking them on.
Love making things for people to enjoy? Join the team designing the technology that matters.
What matters to us?
Put people first - It's about the people, not the tech.
Push the boundaries - Who wants to do what's been done already?
Play the long game - We create sustainable solutions, not quick fixes.
Say it like it is - Life's too short for miscommunication.
Live for the RUSH - Nothing's more exciting than the rush of doing and discovering.
Requirements
Is this for you?
You are someone who is comfortable with getting neck deep in data, while having the ability to zoom out and see the big picture
You are naturally intrigued by what makes people tick and how that manifests in user behaviour
- Good understanding of live testing methods - i.e. A/B testing, cohort analysis
(Preferred) knowledge of query languages (SQL, SumoLogic or similar)

(Preferred) knowledge of data analysis and visualisation software (R, python, Excel)

What will you do?
Define and measure goals, signals and metrics of products in collaboration with Product Managers, Business Analysts, UX Designers and Engineers
Design the data strategy for user engagement and behaviour and how it drives business value to our clients
Design and run quantitative experiments to optimise products based on behavioural data of users
Improve and iterate on the user experience of apps and services by generating and testing hypotheses
Drive change by communicating insights and experiment results with client side stakeholders as well as internal RUSH leadership
Develop statistical models to understand customer behaviours
Benefits
What's The Company Culture Like? What Are The People Like?
Put simply, our office culture is awesome!

It has a start-up buzz, it's youthful, we have lots of social events, we have cake days, fruit days, lunch put-on frequently - put simply, we have a lot of fun together. We also invest in your ongoing training and development with regular goal-setting, group training, lunch and learns and personalised development plans.

We have a very flat structure. You can spark up a conversation with the CEO or anyone in senior management and they'll treat you like family. No staff politics. Not egos, no BS. I promise!
If you've read this far, you're probably interested in the job. If you meet the criteria, want to supercharge your career and work in an environment that cares more about you than your mum does, APPLY FOR THE ROLE - we want to meet you!

Applications are open for a very short time. We'll be making a decision fast so spruce up your CV and send it over - but if you are organised, it will be updated already!

About us
Aderant, headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia, is a global industry leader in providing comprehensive legal business management software for law firms and other professional services organizations. Aderant is a market leader in technology solutions for practice and financial management, knowledge management, business intelligence, matter planning, calendaring and docketing. Aderant is an established and trusted partner due to its versatile and innovative technology solutions, superior customer support and reliable implementation process. Aderant operates as a unit of Roper Technologies, a constituent of the S&P 500®, Fortune 1000® and the Russell 1000® indices.
While our headquarters are in the US, our largest development centre is here in New Zealand on the North Shore with over 100 engineers focused on expanding and improving our products. We have a diverse mix of highly talented folks, ranging from fresh, eager graduates to domain and technology experts with decades of experience to draw on.
From internships and entry level positions to leadership roles at all levels, we offer rewarding and challenging opportunities that will propel your career in an environment where you can achieve your potential. We are always on the lookout for talented, energetic employees who are committed to driving success. Ours is a collaborative environment where you can leverage your expertise, learn and further your career.

About the Role
There will always be something new and exciting for you to get stuck into – our teams are working on the latest technology, the products are complex and challenging and you’ll get fantastic experience alongside some very sharp people.
This isn’t just another job; it’s about building your career and working together to support your aspiration of becoming a real IT professional.
As an Application and Technical Support Specialist based in our Albany office you will be providing exceptional customer service to our clients by providing technical support and answering complex questions on the function and usage of our product via telephone and or internet. This dynamic role addresses, documents, and resolves client issues while adhering to service level agreements to move the product forward.
Responsibilities
Provides technical support to customers, answering complex questions on function and usage of product via the telephone and/or Internet.
Serves as primary liaison between company and client.
Conveys customer feedback to product development staff. Possesses thorough knowledge of company’s products used by customers. Operates under moderate supervision.
Resolves clients' questions or problems over the telephone or Internet in the areas of system configurations/setup, product functionality and bugs/enhancements.
Keeps customer informed of how and when issues are resolved.
Involved in any additional follow up, testing and troubleshooting.
Responsible for appropriate referral to other departments and quality assurance areas.
Promotes and maintains a high quality, professional, service-oriented company image among users.
What You'll Be Doing
Get hands-on in the first week!
Support our Asia/Pacific clients with technical and product queries relating to our practice management software.
Answering complex questions on business process, function and use of our products.
Analyse issues, research and identify solutions, working closely with clients through to resolution.
Grow your core skills while getting to work with some of the latest technology releases from Microsoft.
Your technology focus will include:
Databases – Maintenance and optimization of the SQL schema and database structures.

Our Culture
Our industry requires continuous learning and we’re here to encourage that. There are bonuses for achieving certifications, we’re a Microsoft Gold partner, and shared learning is encouraged in many ways such as lunch ‘n’ learns, hackathons and meet-ups. There’s a range of lunchtime activities such as basketball, MtG or you can try to work up the table tennis ladder. There are bikes racks in garage and a couple of showers in the office if you want to avoid commuting by car, there’s also a small gym onsite. Our social club arranges a number of events during the year.

Our Package

What is PredictHQ?
PredictHQ is a demand intelligence platform powering companies such as Uber, Booking.com, Accenture, Amadeus and many more to instantly unlock profitability hiding in plain sight.
We are solving a major blind spot in demand forecasting: the impact of real-world events. This is our expertise - building systems that find, verify and enrich intelligence on the millions of significant events that impact demand, so companies can act before it's too late. Our core product is an API of verified and ranked event data to provide machine-readable intelligence for better pricing, demand and planning decisions.
We originally targeted the $2.3 trillion travel and transportation industry, but are already signing up customers from a far wider range of industries.
Launched in 2016, PredictHQ is growing rapidly and backed by Lightspeed Venture Partners and Aspect Ventures. PredictHQ’s team is now more than 60 people across San Francisco, USA, and Auckland, New Zealand.
Our team combines the best of the American ambition and drive with New Zealand’s empathy and community spirit. We have high standards and huge plans.

Are excited about developing an innovative and world leading product

Be comfortable in both the design and implementation of maintainable HTML, CSS and Javascript
Take complex ideas and build interfaces that are easy to understand, look beautiful and are performant
Work closely with backend engineers to understand problems and collaborate on defining APIs
Suggest design improvements and work collaboratively with our Product team

Job Summary
We are recruiting a Senior Geotechnical Engineer to join our well established and growing Auckland Office. This role offers you an exciting opportunity to contribute to the success of our 40 strong national Ground Engineering team, to work with and support colleagues from a variety of engineering and environmental disciplines and to assist in the growth of our Ground Engineering and Tunnelling team.
We are looking for an ambitious team player who is looking for an opportunity to assist in the development of innovative, cost-effective and buildable solutions in an environment that is collaborative, stimulating and fast-paced. Your extensive geotechnical consultancy experience, in particular, strong capability in geotechnical studies, investigation, and design for highway earthworks, bridge foundations, retaining structures and strengthened earthworks will add to our teams existing strengths.
Nationally our Ground Engineering team provides one-stop access to services ranging from project management, feasibility studies, detailed design, contract administration and construction supervision for geotechnical works.
You will provide technical support to both internal and external clients to a high level of technical quality, to programme and budget
Utilize your expertise to apply advanced scientific principles, theories, practices and existing technologies develop technical solutions to complex problems
Interpret and record data, conducts analyses, compare findings to relevant studies and local, provincial and national regulations to ensure compliance
Undertake design and reporting of a wide variety of geotechnical works including geological and geomorphological mapping, slope stability, foundations, retaining structures, earthworks and ground improvement
Conduct research and investigation as required.
Plan and organize project studies
Assist in resolving conflicting technical information and unsuitability of standard procedures
Perform complex assignments requiring the development of unique solutions to problems.
May oversee the work of less experienced scientists.
Minimum Requirements
Experienced Geotechnical Engineer with a proven track record in studies, investigations and geotechnical design, in particular for new build transportation infrastructure.
Possess strong problem solving and interpersonal skills.
Strong written and verbal communication skills; the ability to write clear and concise technical reports is essential.
In-depth knowledge and experience of relevant design standards.
Ensures that Health and Safety issues are addressed throughout the life of a project.
In-depth hands-on experience of routinely used geotechnical software including gINT, Slope/W, SLIDE and Plaxis; GIS or Geospatial skills desirable.
In-depth knowledge of a wide variety of ground conditions and of soil and rock design parameter selection; local knowledge and experience is advantageous.
Valid driving licence is essential.
Willing to travel to other offices and sites within NZ is essential, and a willing to consider overseas assignments preferred.
Preferred Qualifications
Geotechnical Engineering are preferred, although Engineering Geologists with appropriate design skills will be considered.
What We Offer
When you join AECOM, you become part of a company that is
pioneering the future . Our teams around the world are involved in some of the most cutting-edge and innovative projects and programs of our time, addressing the big challenges of today and shaping the built environment for generations to come. We ensure a workplace that encourages growth, flexibility and creativity, as well as a company culture that champions
inclusion, diversity and overall
employee well-being through programs supported by company leadership. Our
core values define who we are, how we act and what we aspire to, which comes down to not only
delivering a better world , but working to “make amazing happen” in each neighborhood, community and city we touch. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.

Verizon Connect is guiding a connected world on the go by automating, optimizing and revolutionizing the way people, vehicles and things move through the world. About the Business:

Civil Construction takes great pride in delivering high quality civil works, earthworks, drainage, roading and general contracting solutions to the South Island construction industry.
Our success is built from long-standing morals and ethics, with CCL obtaining respect and repeat business for our honesty, skills and innovation. Our business is growing and needs people who can grow with us to provide our clients with 100% customer satisfaction time and time again.
CCL invests in you personally, offering a variety of training and personal career development opportunities. We recognise our team as our biggest asset and invest accordingly.

About the Role:
The Construction Surveyor is responsible for assisting the construction teams as follows:
Completing tasks in a safe and precise manner for bulk earthworks, drainage, roading, civil and general contracting projects. plan and conduct ground surveys, set outs and collect and interpret data to assist project progress.
The right candidate will be self motivated, good communication skills and be able to self-manage.
Duties and responsibilities:
Conduct physical site surveys using a variety of equipment and tools in order to establish boundaries and set out proposed works. May also be asked to calculate heights, depths, contours and other various dimensions of site terrain
Verify the accuracy of survey data, including measurements and calculations conducted at survey sites
Record results and other important data and prepare reports, charts, maps etc
Coordinate findings with the work of engineering and architectural personnel, clients and others concerned with projects
Establish fixed points for use in making maps, using geodetic and engineering instruments
Adjust surveying instruments in order to maintain their accuracy.
Calibration – responsible for ensuring all survey orientated equipment is fit for purpose and holds current calibration.. Ensure certification are correctly displayed and filed.
Analyse survey objectives and specifications in order to prepare survey proposals or to direct others in survey proposal preparation
Compute geodetic measurements and interpret survey data in order to determine positions, shapes, and elevations of geomorphic and topographic features
Develop criteria for survey methods and procedures
Develop criteria for the design and modification of survey instruments specific to 3D machine control
Conduct research in surveying and mapping methods, using knowledge of techniques of photogrammetric map compilation and electronic data processing
Schedule project in logical steps and budget time and resources required to meet deadlines and profitability targets
Overall responsibility for and maintaining 3D machine control equipment. Assist and mentor operators in correct use of such equipment.
Assist Project Engineers with Quality Assurance, Documentation and Filing
Benefits and perks
In return for your commitment, you will be working for a company that looks after its employees:
The opportunity to upskill
Work in a culture of established vision and values
Work on exciting and challenging projects in some beautiful locations
Health Insurance offered after 9 months, profit share after 5 years, financial checks and advice
Competitive remuneration based on experience
Ongoing career development through company paid training.

Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa. Must also pass a pre-employment drug and alcohol test.

LOCATION: Auckland, New Zealand

REPORTS TO: Regional Sales Manager, ANZ

I. Purpose of Position

To support the effective growth of business for channel partners in assigned region.
Promote and support corporate initiatives, plans, policies, by example and through direct action.
II. Key Responsibilities

Core commercial responsibilities
Develops annual business plans using input to identify and develops specific marketing tactics and commercial action plans to deliver annual growth objectives. Plans should include focus on the continued growth of the core business, new product launch plans, competitive response plans, new channel penetration plans, and demand creation plan.
Translates Policy Deployment strategies and requirement into the Business plans for channel partners in assigned area
Controls & analyze regional team data by measuring KPIs, transparent results and deliver sustaining forecasts; takes countermeasures where necessary
Identifies new Distribution and/or Representation channels to address geographic and/or vertical markets coverage gaps
Collects, analyzes and presents evidence in Problem Solving Review (PSR) meetings
Trains, coaches and acts as a consultant of associates, customers and channel partners on water treatment process and application topics
Supports the sales organization with pre-sales applications expertise and market intelligence
Develops/maintains fact-based understanding of market pricing for UV products
Advises clients, offices and representatives/distributors about all aspects of UV treatment applications in municipal and industrial markets
Supports Distributors in achieving sales growth targets. Takes actions to bring about improvement and growth
Regularly reviews performance of the Channel Partners/Distributors, sets direction and provides feedback on any performance shortfalls in a positive manner.
Gets self/team committed using tools (Value Selling, PD, CRM, etc.)
Be sensitive about costs, incurring expenses responsibly
Acts according to Danaher Standards of Conduct and ensures front line staff of the Channel Partners act in the same way
Manage Customer Administration and Technical Support
Manages customer support to effectively deal with customer orders and queries
Ensures requests on pricing, shipping, product availability, terms and conditions, and stock information for channel partners are dealt with promptly
Provide good working environment for team of Channel Partners
Help build an environment that encourages creativity, operates with honesty and fairness, and is open to new ideas, and encourages and solicits contribution of ideas.
Support and assist Management in identifying where change will be beneficial to the company/department; promote, be supportive of, and help accomplish change.
Promote concept of serving internal and external customers with quality service in a timely manner.
Support learning; Be a mentor in the areas that you have strengths and create opportunities for learning to occur with others.
Provide good communication
Provide high and open communication; to all Trojan customers and distributors and Trojan personnel in a timely manner.
Communicate regularly and effectively corporate plans, initiatives and performance to local Channel Partners.
Continuous learning:
Keep abreast of new technology and activities in industry.
Keep abreast of industry Business Development trends.
Maintains a high level of expertise in all areas of applications and associated products within functional group, i.e. municipal and industrial.
Trojan Familiarization
Successfully demonstrates a thorough understanding of the Trojan business model, business systems, organization, and culture.
Successfully demonstrates a thorough understanding of the Trojan business environment, including customers, competitors and markets.
Demonstrates understanding of Trojan core competencies and key capabilities.
Demonstrates understanding of Trojan Quality Policy and adherence to ISO standards.

This role reports to Regional Sales Manager, ANZ.

Marketing Manager

Project Manager
Application Engineers
Project Designers
Project Managers
External Relationships:
Trojan Distributors

Contractors

Achievement of bookings, revenue, service and customer support goals by Channel Partners

B.S. Degree in Chemical Engineering or relevant other qualification
Minimum of 5 years Business Development/Sales experience in a scientific and capital instrument environment. Experience in municipal wastewater treatment is highly preferred.
Must have excellent communications skills, both oral and written
Must be able to interact with others effectively and influence others positively
Demonstrated ability to work effectively as an individual contributor and self-manage to achieve excellent results.

Experience using Safesforce.com or an equivalent tool to manage sales processes would be an advantage.
VI. Personal Trait Profile
Must have excellent coaching, communication and continuous improvement skills along with a strategic outlook and desire to exceed objectives.
Is process driven; uses Danaher Business System (DBS) tools to drive customer satisfaction.
Is results focused and exhibits a bias for action.
Has commercial acumen – is skilled at managing the entire commercial side of the business, including product development, inbound and outbound marketing, competitors, distribution, sales, pricing and customer relations.

Here at Datacom we connect people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in
The Nitty Gritty
We have over 6,200 people across our global offices, and generate an annual revenue of over $1.2 billion, this makes us one of Australasia’s largest professional IT services companies. We have extensive expertise in operating data centres, providing IT services, software engineering and application management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations. With this comes a long list of significant clients Datacom is committed to hiring, developing and promoting the best talent from a diverse range of backgrounds. We are local at heart, yet world-class in capability.
About the Role
The Lead Engineer - Lifecycle is a hands-on professional technical engineer with deep technical skills across a range of technologies. They are primarily responsible for the activities required to support lifecycle refresh and product team activities. They are customer service focused and are constantly seeking ways to optimise and automate processes to improve quality and reduce cost. They assist the Product and Lifecycle Manager ANZ with the delivery of all Life Cycle activities.
What you’ll bring
Cross skilled and able to support an infrastructure stack comprising of Backups, Server, Storage, Hypervisor, Network & Application layers. Key focus on Storage, Backups and hypervisor.
Deep understanding of virtualised environments running on VMWare, Hyper-V or other hypervisors
Knowledge of the VMWare suite of virtualization products
Knowledge of enterprise backup management systems such as Netbackup (Preferred), Legato or CommVault
Extensive knowledge of ITIL: creating and rolling out of processes, change management and project management.
Responsibilities
Coaching and mentoring team members in technical and behavioural competencies to improve team performance
Creating, implementing and optimising operational plans, processes & procedures to achieve organisational goals, empowering others with accountability and responsibility to contribute to outcomes and leading change.
Using deep technical knowledge to provide leadership to cloud engineers.
Creating, reviewing and submitting any required reporting on all aspects on the cloud platform and its customers.
Owning the delivery for Datacom Cloud team on shift left opportunities and innovation around automation, efficiency and the implementation of new technologies.
Technical impact assessment within the change management process.
Providing a checkpoint to ensure that architectural designs meet operational requirements for reliability, flexibility, scalability and cost-effective management.
Ensuring security, patching and compliance standards are being met on the Datacom Cloud platform and putting in place remediation plans and implementing them to mitigate against security/compliance risks
Why you want to join us
At Datacom we believe that doing good, is good for business. We’ve maintained our local family feel whilst expanding globally, across Australia, ASIA, US and the UK. Our brand and reputation depend on ‘proving the promise’ and we aspire to be the trusted advisor for our customers across Government and the private sector from enterprise scale to regional business. We offer our staff a competitive salary package, fantastic perks and benefits like healthcare, life insurance, discounts at local retailers and a supportive, flexible working environment. If you want to join a company making a difference, apply now!

We are looking for a DevOps Engineer to join our Cloud, Integration and DevOps team. Clear communication skills, both written and verbal
Experience working in cloud technologies like AWS, Azure

Can work independently to design and automate solutions, or as part of a larger team

Integration technologies such as 3Scale, WSO2, Oracle/IBM integration suites, Apache Camel, or similar

Voyager Internet is a leading New Zealand provider of business connectivity and communication services. Our services are used by more than 50,000 customers across New Zealand and our product portfolio includes broadband, VoIP and Cloud PBX, domain names, email hosting and cloud servers.
As a member of the senior technology team, you will lead the small systems team, developing robust sustainable practices to support the build and maintenance of systems solutions and engineering. There is component of hands-on engineering as part of this role.
In addition to playing a key role in developing the team and ensuring robust and sustainable practices are in place, you will work closely with our architecture team as well as senior business leaders and product owners. This role is key to ensuring Voyager’s internal and client facing infrastructure and systems are fit for purpose, commercially viable and align with our strategy.
Development of our people is high on our agenda. We will invest in developing your skills and knowledge and in turn you will play a key role in developing the wider technology team.

We are looking for a Systems Engineer with:

Excellent collaboration skills with technical and non-technical teams
An understanding and commitment to working in a collaborative and agile culture

We're a team of 100 Voyagers across our Auckland, Wellington and Christchurch offices supporting a customer base of over 40,000 Residential and Business customers.
We're well established, but not boring! We take pride in our company culture and ensure its fostered by holding regular social events.

In your role as End Point Security Engineer, you will support our customer environments and be part of our extensive Operations business, who support each other working collaboratively across locations.
About the Role

As End Point Security Engineer, you will provide end point vulnerability management, proactive desktop analytics and risk mitigation services to our operations customer base. Key responsibilities include, but are not limited to, monthly Microsoft patching, MS desktop analytics, Tier 0 and 1 application security patching, antivirus console management and distribution of AV signatures to end points.
What you’ll do
As End Point Security Engineer, the core objectives and responsibilities of your role would include:
Using tools and processes to deliver services to customers in accordance with SLAs
Proactively manage and maintain customer security profile with regard to standard end point management processes
Initiate and drive service and process improvement
Own personal development, by maintaining certifications relevant to the role
Engage collaboratively with internal and external parties
Proactively contribute to the team and Datacom’s success.
What you’ll bring
We are looking for someone with 5 years plus experience in the IT industry, preferably within an IT outsourced environment. You will bring advanced End User Support experience, a desire to learn and an exceptional work ethic. You will have strong trouble shooting and customer service skills, and be able to work autonomously.
You will have knowledge of Hardware and Software Vendors support processes, including product Lifecycles, advanced knowledge of SCCM, Intune, desktop analytics, and Windows 7, 8 and 10. You have had exposure to a range of AV tools and consoles and a deep understanding of the ASD “Essential 8” and endpoint security mitigation approaches.
Please note that you must be an NZ Citizen to apply, and be able to obtain government security clearance.

New Zealand - Auckland, Auckland
Job Summary
We are recruiting a Senior Geotechnical Engineer to join our well established and growing Auckland Office. This role offers you an exciting opportunity to contribute to the success of our 40 strong national Ground Engineering team, to work with and support colleagues from a variety of engineering and environmental disciplines and to assist in the growth of our Ground Engineering and Tunnelling team.
We are looking for an ambitious team player who is looking for an opportunity to assist in the development of innovative, cost-effective and buildable solutions in an environment that is collaborative, stimulating and fast-paced. Your extensive geotechnical consultancy experience, in particular, strong capability in geotechnical studies, investigation, and design for highway earthworks, bridge foundations, retaining structures and strengthened earthworks will add to our teams existing strengths.
Nationally our Ground Engineering team provides one-stop access to services ranging from project management, feasibility studies, detailed design, contract administration and construction supervision for geotechnical works.
You will provide technical support to both internal and external clients to a high level of technical quality, to programme and budget
Utilize your expertise to apply advanced scientific principles, theories, practices and existing technologies develop technical solutions to complex problems
Interpret and record data, conducts analyses, compare findings to relevant studies and local, provincial and national regulations to ensure compliance
Undertake design and reporting of a wide variety of geotechnical works including geological and geomorphological mapping, slope stability, foundations, retaining structures, earthworks and ground improvement
Conduct research and investigation as required.
Plan and organize project studies
Assist in resolving conflicting technical information and unsuitability of standard procedures
Perform complex assignments requiring the development of unique solutions to problems.
May oversee the work of less experienced scientists.
Minimum Requirements
Experienced Geotechnical Engineer with a proven track record in studies, investigations and geotechnical design, in particular for new build transportation infrastructure.
Possess strong problem solving and interpersonal skills.
Strong written and verbal communication skills; the ability to write clear and concise technical reports is essential.
In-depth knowledge and experience of relevant design standards.
Ensures that Health and Safety issues are addressed throughout the life of a project.
In-depth hands-on experience of routinely used geotechnical software including gINT, Slope/W, SLIDE and Plaxis; GIS or Geospatial skills desirable.
In-depth knowledge of a wide variety of ground conditions and of soil and rock design parameter selection; local knowledge and experience is advantageous.
Valid driving licence is essential.
Willing to travel to other offices and sites within NZ is essential, and a willing to consider overseas assignments preferred.
Preferred Qualifications
Geotechnical Engineering are preferred, although Engineering Geologists with appropriate design skills will be considered.

pioneering the future . Our teams around the world are involved in some of the most cutting-edge and innovative projects and programs of our time, addressing the big challenges of today and shaping the built environment for generations to come. We ensure a workplace that encourages growth, flexibility and creativity, as well as a company culture that champions
inclusion, diversity and overall
employee well-being through programs supported by company leadership. Our
core values define who we are, how we act and what we aspire to, which comes down to not only
delivering a better world , but working to “make amazing happen” in each neighborhood, community and city we touch. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.

What you’ll be doing...
Verizon Connect is guiding a connected world on the go by automating, optimizing and revolutionizing the way people, vehicles and things move through the world. Our full suite of industry-defining solutions and services put innovation, automation and connected data to work for customers and help them be safer, more efficient and more productive. With more than 3,500 dedicated employees in 15 countries, we deliver leading mobile technology platforms and solutions.
As a SaaS leader, we know our talent is the most important component to our success. We hire top talent and empower them to do their best work. As a division of Verizon, we combine the fun and excitement of a startup environment with the resources, operational excellence, and brand recognition of an established tech giant.
You will lead a dynamic and successful team in our Christchurch office, continuously adapting and improving our methodologies and technologies to be the best at what we do: provide innovative tracking software to trucking companies all around the world. This team is responsible for maintaining and enhancing two native mobile apps (iOS and Android) as well as a legacy hybrid mobile app, and works closely with the API team and other teams within a wider group focused on regulatory compliance solutions. You will be working primarily with Java, Swift, Kotlin and Typescript.
Writing high-quality code - we expect a Squad Lead to lead by example in every area, none more so than in the hands-on development of our products.
Leading a cross-functional team using code on multiple platforms.
Managing deployments and testing.
Ensuring that the team is actively contributing to and reacting to automation tests.
Ensuring that code written to a high standard and ensuring a robust code review process is in place.
Educating the team on best practices, workflows, and other processes.
Optimising your squad’s specific needs and strengths.
What we’re looking for...
You’ll need to have:
Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience.
Four or more years of relevant work experience.
Experience in agile/lean methodologies and processes (ideally Kanban) leading process improvements and engineering disciplines.
Experience mentoring junior developers.
Experience in measuring and improving performance of production systems.
Knowledge of Object Oriented/SOLID Design principles and practices.
Experience with common patterns in distributed systems (REST, SOA, and DDD).
Knowledge of GIT or related source control technology.
Even better if you have:
A degree in Computer Science or a related field.
Mobile application development experience.
Knowledge of AWS based architectures and services.
Oral and written communication skills, including the ability to effectively present to engineering and product groups.
Ability to lead systems analysis with application design individually and with an architecture team to deliver detailed application specifications.
Ability to lead and guide a team.
Keyword: VZConnect
When you join Verizon...
You’ll have the power to go beyond – doing the work that’s transforming how people, businesses and things connect with each other. Not only do we provide the fastest and most reliable network for our customers, but we were first to 5G - a quantum leap in connectivity. Our connected solutions are making communities stronger and enabling energy efficiency. Here, you’ll have the ability to make an impact and create positive change. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, join our team of the best and brightest. We offer great pay, amazing benefits and opportunity to learn and grow in every role. Together we’ll go far.

About the role
Foodies is on an awesome journey to become a truly customer insights-driven and efficient Co-op, and one that is digitally enabled. We want to be a digital business that continuously exploits digital technologies, blurs digital and physical worlds – creating new sources of value for customers and increasing operational agility and simplicity
Releasing software in-time that meets highest quality standards, is easy to deploy, low on memory, starts fast, scales well and almost never breaks you’ll;
Design, implement and improve our highly-scalable, Java 8 and Java 11 based micro-services in an AWS, Kubernetes cloud centric environment
Write business code that drives our Online customer experience as well as the optimal execution of our most critical Enterprise business processes

A senior operator, you’ll be passionate about tech, opinionated about software and a fantastic team player who thrives in agile, collaborative environments.

To know how to master AWS cloud technologies like S3, SNS, SQS, Lambda and tools like Kubernetes, Docker, Helm, Ansible
To be versed with Git, Bamboo, Maven, Bitbucket, Confluence
Development on a Mac with IntelliJ or alternative IDEs and using the k8s CLI is a no-brainer to you
Driving significant parts of our business, you’ll build awesome user experiences in our digital channels across the digital customer journey.
