Business Development Executive
Beca’s past is full of 'world firsts' and the highest accolades for implementing green building principles. Today we are focused on surpassing these achievements by continually challenging and overcoming convention and constraints, to transform our world for the better.
We’re looking for a senior salesperson who has experience taking unique business offerings to market. Our new B-Tune service is growing at a rapid pace and we need someone with the expertise and drive to dramatically scale up sales for our B-Tune offering.
About B-Tune
B-Tune brings together our experienced building scientists and engineers with advanced technology, to provide our clients with cost effective energy savings and increased comfort for occupants of their buildings.
How do we do this? We collect data from building management systems, energy meters, utility bills and other sources to help reduce energy consumption, costs and emissions in three easy steps: Understand, Monitor and Improve. Investment is typically paid back in 12-18 months. Find out more.
The opportunity
We seek a dedicated salesperson, experienced in direct sales of products and services, and ideally experienced creating and closing sales partnership agreements. This is a key role to drive business growth within New Zealand’s largest professional services engineering consultancy, and an exciting opportunity to play an integral part to shape the future of a winning service.
You’ll join a high-performing and innovative team who is passionate about reducing the carbon and energy footprints of New Zealand’s non-residential buildings.
The role is nationwide with significant travel, mostly between Auckland, Wellington and Christchurch, with the potential to expand internationally to Australia and Singapore.
This is a unique opportunity to become part of the solution to climate change by helping thousands of building owners make the journey to lower carbon footprints. You will be backed by the success of a 100-year-old company and have fun and a sense of achievement from expanding an awesome business into new territory.
About you
Your core focus will be developing and driving a sales strategy to sell at scale and executing on that plan. You will be given scope to create the blueprint for success. We’re looking for a leader to convert opportunities to our bottom line. More than that, we’re looking for a sales entrepreneur who is passionate about developing and testing new sales and business models, to grow our business.
We are looking for someone with 5+ years of selling experience:
A self-starter with proven sales and business development track record.
Experience selling to building owners, or selling technology, or energy efficiency solutions, would be highly advantageous but is not essential.
Digitally savvy and adept at using modern sales generation and analytic tools. We want to build a highly scalable sales machine and want the underlying analytics to inform that journey.
Ability to construct, document and share sales strategies and pitch plans that reflect our value proposition in the market.
Commercially savvy to build marketing tactics, strategy and a sustainable pipeline
Ability to build and maintain relationships externally and internally.
Experience constructing, managing or working in sales partnerships.
Experience gathering market intelligence to qualify and quantify market opportunities.
You will be expected to acquire a basic technical understanding around energy consumption and carbon footprints, but the deep technical knowledge is handled by others in the team.
A team player; sharing success plus helping the team grow with and around you.
Creative and inquisitive mindset to help explore and recognise the true potential of a unique service/solution.
What we offer
Beca prides itself on supporting a diverse and inclusive culture – open to inputs from creative people of all genders, ethnicity, identity, thought and experiences.
As well as offering a competitive professional base salary + commission, and a diverse, fun and supportive working environment, we offer:
The potential for Beca shareholding
On the job and external training
Professional membership
Health Insurance
Parental leave
Flexible working arrangements
A challenging career in a professional, family-orientated office
Ongoing career development including support for your professional registration
Work-life balance – we hold regular team social events and like to have fun at work.
About Beca
Beca is one of Asia Pacific's largest independent advisory, design and engineering consultancies. 2020 is a landmark year for Beca, representing both the dawn of a new decade and the beginning of our 2nd century. Throughout this year, we will celebrate our innovators, our thinkers, our explorers and our entrepreneurs; past, present and future.

We are a team of 3300-plus who brings a wide range of perspectives and expertise to every client and challenge, creating resourceful, smart solutions from our collective experience and insights.
While our experience has been 100 years in the making, it’s the fresh talent we’re nurturing, the innovative thinking we’re developing and the connections that we’re forging that gets us most excited for the future.
Apply
You can find out more about our people and projects by visiting www.beca.com
Please make your application online. Applications close 25 February 2020.

At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 600 cities around the world.

We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let’s move the world forward, together.
About the Role

Operations are the heart of every JUMP launch - ensuring our e-mobility vehicles are maintained and charged - exactly when and where our customers need them, 24/7/365. As the Senior Operations Manager, you will create the operational strategies, establish and refine processes, and drive the innovation that will determine the continued success of not only JUMP in Auckland, but will lay the blueprint for future JUMP systems everywhere.

The Senior Operations Manager role demands a self starting, challenge-seeking problem solver. We're looking for someone who is process-driven, detail-oriented, and organized, but also excited to roll up their sleeves and get their hands dirty. The role will split time behind a computer and in our logistics hub / field, as you will be responsible for owning and refining operational processes.
What You’ll Do:
Manage our local logistics hub and workforce - Operations is core to this role. You will have the responsibility for defining our hiring needs, building our local team and managing our logistics hub. You will focus on ensuring our operations are safe for riders and contractors as well as efficient in executing on what needs to be done to make our business is a success in Auckland. This includes allocation of labor, assigning job duties, managing staffing agencies, allocating and tracking performance KPI’s.
Create & Optimise Process - we are a new company launching a new product in new environments - we not only need to create and constantly optimise our own processes for this operation, but for the many JUMP systems that are to follow in the near future.
Grow the business - you will be constantly seeking solutions that scale, while overseeing the growth of our business. Your processes and projects will directly contribute to the city’s growth.
Analyse Data - you will ensure you are creating, collecting, and incorporating as much data about operations as possible to constantly monitor performance and find opportunities to improve. You, with help from colleagues, will build the analytical frameworks and operational models to enable constant improvement.
Problem Solve - all day everyday. You will operate a technology platform and capital assets in dynamic urban environments. All kinds of obstacles, barriers, problems, and snags happen on a daily basis and you must be ready to solve them as fast as they happen. You see upcoming systemic problems from far away, and nip them in the bud.
Collaborate - operations will need to collaborate with data scientists, communications and marketing, engineers, supply chain professionals, HR, and other teams.
Balance attention to detail with swift execution - we need to do things quickly, and we need to do them well. Balancing those can be challenging, and this should be a strength.
Wear many different hats - This role will have ownership over areas including managing a large and diverse team of field technicians and/or mechanics, overseeing our operations in the field or our logistics hub, facilities and vehicle upkeep, workplace safety, parts inventory, charging infrastructure, process creation, project management, etc.
Ability to learn new skills and grow with the role - As JUMP continues to expand, this role will be charged with directing and overseeing additional operational processes and projects.
What You’ll Need:
Minimum of 7 years of experience in operations, supply chain, engineering, manufacturing, or relevant business / industries.
Minimum of 3 years leadership experience
Experience solving complex problems, exercising good judgment in ambiguous circumstances, and effectively communicating across a diverse team.
Comfortable learning and using new software tools.
Strong interpersonal skills. Ability to build relationships, lead a team, manage employees, and create a hard-working but fun workplace
Proven to be self-motivated, self-directed, and eager to take ownership of tasks to ensure a solution.
Black belt in problem-solving.
Excellent organization and time management systems for yourself and your team.
Knowledge or passion for any of the following a plus: the local market, mobility, mechanics, engineering, and data/analytics.
About JUMP:
JUMP is building the future of urban mobility: shared electric vehicles that are the quickest, most enjoyable, and most empowering way to get around a city. Cheaper than most transportation options and faster than cars in traffic, JUMP is a game-changer for local transportation. Founded in 2010, JUMP pioneered dockless bike share and has deployed more than 14,000 bikes in 6 countries. This year JUMP is launching the next generation of e-mobility options across ANZ. Our goal is to transform cities, making them more sustainable, equitable, and livable through electric mobility.
To make this vision a reality, we need to grow our team. We place tremendous value on our company's roots and culture: a mix of ingenuity, controlled chaos, hard work, and sense of purpose. This is a great opportunity to join a rapidly growing team that is shaping the future of transportation.

Summary:

People across this business are passionate about what they do and know their industry inside and out, as such, they have high expectations of technology and the support team. The environment is fun and collaborative, a sense of humour will go a long way here.

BIM / VDC Manager
Our Beca Buildings Team
Across our global footprint, there are endless opportunities for building engineers - in terms of where you live, the projects you work on, and the opportunities and support you have to progress your career. Every building we work on is different, and the challenges we face constantly change. But we know the power of working together to create smart solutions. This means being part of a team that shares ideas across geographies and time-zones, to push boundaries and go beyond conventional approaches. We're also dedicated to developing and sharing technical innovation and sustainable practices. Our past is full of 'world firsts' and the highest accolades for implementing green building principles. Today we are focused on surpassing these achievements by continually challenging and overcoming convention and constraints, to transform our world for the better
The Opportunity
This is an opportunity for a talented individual who has a considerable interest in Digital Engineering and a passion for BIM and VDC, aligned with industry best practices and workflows. Our BIM and VDC division are expanding, and you will be part of collaborative team tasked with developing BIM and VDC content and processes which interlink with our automation and data analytic solutions. You will be supported with expertise from our Digital Engineering Leader, Engineering Team Leader and Technical Directors who will guide and mentor your Digital career with us. This opportunity requires high level of critical thinking and communication skills to interact with our internal teams and external project stakeholders. The career opportunities include both technical advancement but also business creation and expansion.
About you
You are driven by making a positive difference for our industry and our world. You are excited about the prospect of working on challenging projects (internal or external) where you are surrounded by some of the best technical minds and connected people in our business.
If you thrive on challenging yourself, enjoy solving problems and have a considerable interest in Digital Engineering, Building Information Modeling (BIM) and Virtual Design & Construction (VDC), then this opportunity is for you.
High-Level Attributes
Proactive, organized, accurate, able to apply your own initiative towards activities and comfortable collaborating with others.
Ability to work with key users and stakeholders to develop best practice standards, tools, templates, processes and procedures for successful BIM/VDC project delivery.
Capability to help lead project delivery, which includes working with sub-contractors and help manage them.
BIM literate, including proven understanding of Revit MEP content creation, standardisation, maintenance and the have the ability to run model audits.
Education Requirements
Tertiary/Technical qualification
Experience in a construction environment and/or consulting
Professional body certification/recognition would be advantageous
Significant expertise in application of principles and practices within discipline
Autodesk Certified Profession in Revit would be advantageous
Experience Requirements
Primary Role:
Minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in BIM processes and tools, mainly with Revit MEP, Navisworks Manage and BIM360 products.
(Please note: We will be considering candidates with varied years of experience, however, five years’ experience within the building design and construction areas is a minimum).
Assist in the set-up and review of BIM Execution Plans (BEP’s) and Construction Execution Plans (CEP’s) on key projects.
Contribute to the on-going development of Beca Group BIM/VDC strategy and to the achievement of business plans.
Establishing BIM standards for quality and monitoring adherence through expertise and direction provided on job sites, at BIM coordination meetings, etc.
Visiting job sites as required to troubleshoot BIM issues and resolve problems.
Leading the work within detail working methods, processes and systems for BIM/VDC project delivery across New Zealand.
Capable of generating and managing Federated Models
Capable of generating and managing co-ordination templates and workflows which includes the capability of chairing BIM coordination meeting.
Good understanding of Revit MEP content management, template development, workflow creation and implementation across an organization.
Ability to understand and implement the use of formulas to drive parametric values in families.
Strong management capabilities relating to BIM standards development, implementation and system management.
Educating project teams on digital delivery best practices and workflows.
Ability to assess and communicate new technology considerations, progress on projects, changes to policies and process to the Digital Engineering Leadership Team.
Willingness to further develop your digital skillset.
Developing and maintaining relationships with engineers, design consultants, subcontractors, suppliers and owner's representatives.
Advantageous:
Familiar with Dynamo or similar
Familiar with PowerBI
A good understanding of fundamental business drivers and management
About Beca
Beca is one of Asia Pacific's largest independent advisory, design and engineering consultancies. 2020 is a landmark year for Beca, representing both the dawn of a new decade and the beginning of our 2nd century. Throughout this year, we will celebrate our innovators, our thinkers, our explorers and our entrepreneurs; past, present and future. We are a team of 3300-plus who brings a wide range of perspectives and expertise to every client and challenge, creating resourceful, smart solutions from our collective experience and insights.
While our experience has been 100 years in the making, it’s the fresh talent we’re nurturing, the innovative thinking we’re developing and the connections that we’re forging that gets us most excited for the future. www.beca.com.

GoodMeasure develops energy monitoring and control solutions using IOT and AWS platforms. We want to be at the heart of electricity smartgrids and DER (Distributed Energy Resources) and we need fantastic people who can help build this vision.
FCL Metering (FCLM) is an end to end Metering Equipment Provider to the Energy Retail and Consumer markets. Specialising in bespoke installations, FCLM provides Smart (AMI) and Legacy meter installations and asset management, including Data and Field Services.

The role
We are looking for someone to join our team who is committed to applying engineering best practice in a balanced and pragmatic way. The Senior DevOps Engineer is responsible for leading the software development and support for the GoodMeasure product range as well as supporting the systems architecture for FCLM. This role leads a small software team of permanent and contract resource responsible for firmware, cloud and apps.
As someone that is experienced with DevOps on an AWS and similar tech stacks, you will ensure that our customers experience best practise uptime, while continuing to implement and deploy new features.

As this is a small team, you will be providing both technical leadership as well as hands on supporting and implementing the solution.

The requirements
To be successful in this role, you will have:

An appropriate tertiary qualification in engineering
5+ years’ experience in a senior engineering DevOps role
Demonstrable experience with AWS technology stack including Elastic Search
Experience in Ubuntu/ Debian Linux; Nodejs/Expres / angularjs and Atlassian Jira/Confluence
Experience with IOT services
Solid understanding of modern engineering techniques for cloud services
Proficient at MS Word, Excel and PowerPoint.
Ability to demonstrate a flexible and creative approach to problem solving, good judgement and a proactive, positive “can do” attitude.
Excellent interpersonal and relationship management skills with a collaborative style of engagement and experience dealing with external parties.
Demonstrated ability to organise and motivate self to meet deadlines.
An uncompromising approach to health & safety and ability to drive H&S excellence through a controlled network environment for all work carried out on or supporting the network.
Ideally you will have knowledge of energy and telecommunications industries with the ability to think and act strategically. You will be pragmatic in your approach to challenges and be able to articulate ideas to technical and non-technical audiences. Most importantly, you will be team player and enjoy working in a collaborative working environment.
Safety and wellbeing are paramount to us, so our recruitment process involves a Ministry of Justice criminal background check, medical and fitness checks and a pre-employment alcohol and drug test.
We may close the position early if we find a great person, so apply today!

Waikato - Hamilton City
Engineer

Serko is an established leader in the Australasian market in travel and expense management applications aimed at making business travel personal. Zeno, our new platform, is revolutionising the world of online travel and expense management, providing the control that travel managers need with an easy interface that travellers love. We’re seeking designers and researchers who are interested in joining us on our journey as we extend, adapt and improve our products.
As a Senior Product Designer at Serko, you will work within cross-functional teams to design intuitive, innovative and well-crafted product experiences informed by research that solves real problems for our growing user base.

Key accountabilities
Work collaboratively with product managers, software engineers and other designers. Gather and evaluate user requirements in collaboration with product managers and engineers
Prototype concepts for new features and improvements.
Facilitate and/or observe usability testing of prototypes; customer interviews and field research.
Participate in workshops during discovery and delivery.
Gather data about the market, user needs and behaviours through desk research and field research.
Design interactions and workflows using components from Zeno's Design System, ZUI, and collaborate with design and front-end engineers to extend the component library where required.
Requirements
You’ll have 5+ years of proven experience as a Product Designer / User Experience Designer in software and be able to articulate how your work in this area has made an impact.
You’ll have a portfolio that demonstrates impeccable foundational design skills (typography, colour, layout, interactions).
You’ll have experience with a variety of quantitative and qualitative research techniques and methodologies. You’ll be familiar with all the usual tools and techniques including canvases, ideation, personas, journey maps, wireframes and prototypes.
You’ll have experiencing working with and/or building and maintaining a Design System and be comfortable using Sketch with Libraries. An understanding of atomic principles and web development are a plus.
You thrive in a collaborative, team environment; have excellent communication skills (both written and verbal) and are comfortable liaising with internal and external stakeholders.
You’ll have excellent time management skills and be able to use your initiative when it comes to prioritising based on impact and value.
You’ll be able to articulate user needs and insights to both technical and business stakeholders to influence decisions and inspire customer-centricity.
You are comfortable with rapid change and the dynamic environments that comes with working in a high-growth tech company.
Bonus points if you have experience in Artificial Intelligence, Chatbots, Analytics, Information Design and/or a passion for Travel.
Benefits
Serko's people are rewarded for their efforts with a great salary, competitive benefits, offices with a pool table, table tennis table, exceptional coffee and a great social atmosphere.
If you’re up for a challenge and are excited about joining a local business with a growing international reputation, we’d love to hear from you.
To find out more about working at Serko go to https://www.serko.com/careers
Serko is a NZ Immigration Accredited Employer.

Systems Engineer – Datacom Northern Region
Our purpose
Here at Datacom we connect people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in.
Our team
Imagine living in one of New Zealand’s regions where a positive lifestyle is not only achievable but is reality. We are offering a role as a Systems Engineer.
In the regions we continue to grow and are focused on being a great place to work. We provide opportunities for people to build their career in joining us, local jobs, supporting our local business contributing local families. We have a family friendly work environment. You’ll be recognised and valued for your contributions and enjoy benefits such as medical, income and life insurance, plus many other great perks. Above all our culture is one of trust and respect for our employees and customers alike.
The Nitty Gritty
We have over 6,200 people across our global offices, and generate an annual revenue of over $1.2 billion, this makes us one of Australasia’s largest professional IT services companies. We have extensive expertise in operating data centres, providing IT services, software engineering and application management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations. With this comes a long list of significant clients Datacom is committed to hiring, developing and promoting the best talent from a diverse range of backgrounds. We are local at heart, yet world-class in capability.
About the Role
At Datacom, we do our bit to make the world around us better, no matter if this through a small contribution or a grand gesture. We are continuously on a journey alongside our customers to help transform their organisations and being able to innovate, adapt and adjust is just what we do. As a System Engineer your knowledge, and more importantly ability to learn and apply your skills, will lead to success in the role and for the team.
We build and run some of key systems for iconic Kiwi companies and we keep their business’s running globally whilst supporting them from the heart of the North Island. As a result, we are passionate about getting the results that the customer needs and adding value to their business.
What you’ll bring
You are someone who takes pride in customer service and enjoys helping end users in their use of technology. We are looking for someone who:
Has passion and pride in everything that they do
Has the knack to easily multi-task between our varied client environments
Is honest and transparent communication with excellent organisation skills
Who is self-motivated and managing (although you’ll be backed by senior managers and your peers)
And on the technical side, some of the technologies we play with and you will ideally understand include..
Microsoft product range with focus on core server fundamentals (2008+) Virtualisation (VMware 4.1+ or Hyper-V 2012+)
Microsoft Azure IaaS, PaaS
Cloud services, e.g. Office365, MS365
Citrix (v6+), Hyper-V
Exchange (2013, 2016, Online)
Backup
Security
Certifications are beneficial
If this sounds like an exciting challenging role for your next career move we are keen to hear from you. Please apply online.

About Movio
Movio’s purpose is to connect moviegoers to their ideal movie. We achieve this by being the global leader in marketing data analytics and campaign management for the world’s cinema exhibitors, studios and distributors.
Love technology, love movies? This is your chance to work with some of the world’s largest cinemas!
About the role
This isn’t your typical support role working off tickets all day. You’ll be responsible for the end-to-end resolution of issues, ranging from basic to complex technical problems, accountable for new client implementations and providing Level 2-3 technical support for our clients.
You’ll develop trusting relationships with clients across the APAC region, building solutions and providing techncial guidance. You'll be part of a global support team. There is no hierarchy in this team, you’ll all roll up your sleeves to get the job done.
Maybe you’ve come from a data analyst, data engineer, application support or software support background and looking for a more diverse and more collaborative role.
Regardless you’ll:
Love learning - Our Support team is fuelled by peer-to-peer learning, collaboration and extensive knowledge sharing
Be fearless in tackling problems that are outside of your comfort zone. We rely on your inquisitive mind to dig around the product to find out what’s going on
Be a big picture thinker - This role is not just about solving issues raised by our clients - We want to highlight recurring patterns and trends
Take pride in your work - At Movio we don’t cut corners. You will understand that every interaction with our clients should help to build their trust in Movio’s ability to deliver top-of-class products and services
Love engaging with a wide variety of people - This role often requires conversations between our Engineering team, Regional teams and clients to solve a problem
Requirements
Tech skills / Experience required:
A strong working knowledge with SQL
2 + years’ experience in a technical support capacity for a SaaS product company, or software-driven environment
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong client relationship skills
Great problem solving and analytical skills
A natural curiosity about how things work
Ability to translate technical situations into easy to understand explanations for everyone


Movio is part of Vista Group International Ltd (NZX & ASX: VGL), a world-leading enterprise comprised of eight businesses that provide software, digital and online solutions to the film industry, we're in great company. But we're often on the look-out for new brains and faces to join us along the way. If film, data, and technology seem like the perfect fit, it's time to apply.

Here at Movio we value inclusivity and celebrate diversity. We’re committed to offering equal opportunity to our staff and candidates — regardless of gender, age, race, ethnicity, marital status, disability, sex, sexual orientation, religious, ethical beliefs or political opinion. This commitment is reflected in all our employment policies and procedures.

Company Overview:

Are you a problem solver, explorer, and knowledge seeker – always asking, “What if?”

If so, then you may be the new team member we’re looking for. Because at SAS, your curiosity matters – whether you’re developing algorithms, creating customer experiences or answering critical questions. Curiosity is our code, and the opportunities here are endless.

What we do
We’re the leader in analytics. Through our software and services, we inspire customers around the world to transform data into intelligence. Our curiosity fuels innovation, pushing boundaries, challenging the status quo and changing the way we live.

What you’ll do
We’re looking for a Technical Account Manager to build broad relationships with customer, identify strategic opportunities, bringing the necessary domain and SAS expertise to assist with the development of new sales initiatives as well as existing SAS implementations. Communicate and present current SAS technologies and solutions as well as future direction. Lead teams working with the Account Executive in all customer related activities involving SAS while ensuring highest customer satisfaction. Helps to ensure that the customer maximizes the value of their SAS purchase and ensures adoption ultimately resulting in the preservation of our renewal revenue. Provides follow-up support in disseminating technical across both organizations.

You will:
Engage client at executive and other levels to nurture and enhance relationship.
Deliver up-to-date information on our capabilities including roadmap and strategic direction.
Establish and maintain a strategic partnership with the client.
Serves as the primary technical contact between the Account Executive, Systems Engineer, and other services available on all pre-sales activity.
Works with SAS Professional Services to coordinate pre-sales efforts with paid consulting opportunity.
Acts as the strategic advisor to SAS users and customer IT management.
Serves as a resource to Sales Managers.
Collaborates with Account Executive in order to pursue relationships and opportunities in parallel to widen the bandwidth of sales activity, build trust with all customer contacts, and to promote and maintain the integrity of the SAS/client relationship.
Assists the Account Executive in developing and moving sales leads and opportunities forward.
Works with Account Executive to learn about customer business, identify latent pain, and set priorities on specific action items.
Partners with sales team to develop and manage overall Account Engagement Plan (AEP) that documents all SSOs, Action Plans, the support resources (SE, consulting, etc.) required for each step, and the timeframes for all elements.
Compiles status reports and ensures that account action items are completed and/or escalates to appropriate level of management when needed.
Documents how SAS is being used throughout the account. May periodically recommend changes or enhancements.
Promotes use of other SAS technology, solutions and resources (consulting, technical support, training, conferences) available to ensure optimal use and customer satisfaction.
Maintains up-to-date knowledge of competitive marketplace as well as key competitors at client.
You’re curious, passionate, authentic and accountable. These are our values and influence everything we do.

What we’re looking for
Must have advanced knowledge of SAS technology, architecture and resources.
Clear understanding of sales strategies and cycles.
Excellent problem solving, organizational, decision-making written, oral and interpersonal skills.
Ability to conceptualize client needs and translate into specific implementation strategies.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Travel as business requirements dictate at management discretion

Why SAS
We love living the #SASlife and believe that happy, healthy people have a passion for life, and bring that energy to work. No matter what your specialty or where you are in the world, your unique contributions will make a difference.

ABOUT THE COMPANY
Our client is a very large governmental department based in the Auckland City region. The environment is very much an enterprise from a project, system and applications perspective and highly focussed on providing services to the wider Auckland community.
This organisation prides itself in that the majority of its employees have remained with them for long periods of time. This is through a fine balance of being highly diverse in structure of their cherished employees along with them being very fair in respect to performance and financial reviews along with an ever eternal requirement for evolving its technologies and thus upskilling its employees to allow such technology advancement.
ABOUT THE ROLE
As a Senior BI & Data Warehouse Developer within the team, you will be responsible for driving Data Engineering, Data Modelling, Schema Designs and ETL based activities. This is very much a MS BI environment with additional WhereScape RED ETL needs.

SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
Business Intelligence / Data Modelling - a minimum of 7yrs MS related experience along with existing leadership experience that includes coaching and mentoring other BI & ETL Data Engineers.
Data Warehousing Functions - essentially you will have solid experience in Data Engineering to include building Data Models through Star Schemas along with using WhereScape RED as the IDE for building SQL Server based Data Warehouses.
IDEAL (not essential) - Ideally you will also have used WhereScape RED for DW solutions in other tools such as SAP or Oracle
Tools Other - Microsoft BI Stack SSIS / SSRS / SSAS
Cloud - MS Azure based Data Factory
Communication - excellent written and oral communication skills

What is in it for you:
upto $120,000 as a starting salary and a multitude of staff benefits and discounts throughout NZ
an opportunity to join an end client who can evolve their technology needs as quickly as specialist consulting and software services practices.

HOW TO APPLY
Click the APPLY button and include your resume and cover letter or for further information please call Carl Robinson or Arzel Ramos on 09 302 5313
NOTE to overseas enquiries and non-NZ residents:
Whereas we welcome international enquiries, only applicants that are legally entitled to work in New Zealand and can make themselves available for interviews in New Zealand will be considered for advertised positions.
Others may not necessarily be responded to.

What you’ll be doing...
Verizon Connect is guiding a connected world on the go by automating, optimizing and revolutionizing the way people, vehicles and things move through the world. Our full suite of industry-defining solutions and services put innovation, automation and connected data to work for customers and help them be safer, more efficient and more productive. With more than 3,500 dedicated employees in 15 countries, we deliver leading mobile technology platforms and solutions.
As a SaaS leader, we know our talent is the most important component to our success. We hire top talent and empower them to do their best work. As a division of Verizon, we combine the fun and excitement of a startup environment with the resources, operational excellence, and brand recognition of an established tech giant.
You will lead a dynamic and successful team in our Christchurch office, continuously adapting and improving our methodologies and technologies to be the best at what we do: provide innovative tracking software to trucking companies all around the world. This team is responsible for maintaining and enhancing two native mobile apps (iOS and Android) as well as a legacy hybrid mobile app, and works closely with the API team and other teams within a wider group focused on regulatory compliance solutions. You will be working primarily with Java, Swift, Kotlin and Typescript.
Writing high-quality code - we expect a Squad Lead to lead by example in every area, none more so than in the hands-on development of our products.
Leading a cross-functional team using code on multiple platforms.
Managing deployments and testing.
Ensuring that the team is actively contributing to and reacting to automation tests.
Ensuring that code written to a high standard and ensuring a robust code review process is in place.
Educating the team on best practices, workflows, and other processes.
Optimising your squad’s specific needs and strengths.
What we’re looking for...
You’ll need to have:
Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience.
Four or more years of relevant work experience.
Experience in agile/lean methodologies and processes (ideally Kanban) leading process improvements and engineering disciplines.
Experience mentoring junior developers.
Experience in measuring and improving performance of production systems.
Knowledge of Object Oriented/SOLID Design principles and practices.
Experience with common patterns in distributed systems (REST, SOA, and DDD).
Knowledge of GIT or related source control technology.
Even better if you have:
A degree in Computer Science or a related field.
Mobile application development experience.
Knowledge of AWS based architectures and services.
Oral and written communication skills, including the ability to effectively present to engineering and product groups.
Ability to lead systems analysis with application design individually and with an architecture team to deliver detailed application specifications.
Ability to lead and guide a team.
Keyword: VZConnect
When you join Verizon...
You’ll have the power to go beyond – doing the work that’s transforming how people, businesses and things connect with each other. Not only do we provide the fastest and most reliable network for our customers, but we were first to 5G - a quantum leap in connectivity. Our connected solutions are making communities stronger and enabling energy efficiency. Here, you’ll have the ability to make an impact and create positive change. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, join our team of the best and brightest. We offer great pay, amazing benefits and opportunity to learn and grow in every role. Together we’ll go far.

Job Summary
We are recruiting a Senior Geotechnical Engineer to join our well established and growing Auckland Office. This role offers you an exciting opportunity to contribute to the success of our 40 strong national Ground Engineering team, to work with and support colleagues from a variety of engineering and environmental disciplines and to assist in the growth of our Ground Engineering and Tunnelling team.
We are looking for an ambitious team player who is looking for an opportunity to assist in the development of innovative, cost-effective and buildable solutions in an environment that is collaborative, stimulating and fast-paced. Your extensive geotechnical consultancy experience, in particular, strong capability in geotechnical studies, investigation, and design for highway earthworks, bridge foundations, retaining structures and strengthened earthworks will add to our teams existing strengths.
Nationally our Ground Engineering team provides one-stop access to services ranging from project management, feasibility studies, detailed design, contract administration and construction supervision for geotechnical works.
You will provide technical support to both internal and external clients to a high level of technical quality, to programme and budget
Utilize your expertise to apply advanced scientific principles, theories, practices and existing technologies develop technical solutions to complex problems
Interpret and record data, conducts analyses, compare findings to relevant studies and local, provincial and national regulations to ensure compliance
Undertake design and reporting of a wide variety of geotechnical works including geological and geomorphological mapping, slope stability, foundations, retaining structures, earthworks and ground improvement
Conduct research and investigation as required.
Plan and organize project studies
Assist in resolving conflicting technical information and unsuitability of standard procedures
Perform complex assignments requiring the development of unique solutions to problems.
May oversee the work of less experienced scientists.
Minimum Requirements
Experienced Geotechnical Engineer with a proven track record in studies, investigations and geotechnical design, in particular for new build transportation infrastructure.
Possess strong problem solving and interpersonal skills.
Strong written and verbal communication skills; the ability to write clear and concise technical reports is essential.
In-depth knowledge and experience of relevant design standards.
Ensures that Health and Safety issues are addressed throughout the life of a project.
In-depth hands-on experience of routinely used geotechnical software including gINT, Slope/W, SLIDE and Plaxis; GIS or Geospatial skills desirable.
In-depth knowledge of a wide variety of ground conditions and of soil and rock design parameter selection; local knowledge and experience is advantageous.
Valid driving licence is essential.
Willing to travel to other offices and sites within NZ is essential, and a willing to consider overseas assignments preferred.
Preferred Qualifications
Geotechnical Engineering are preferred, although Engineering Geologists with appropriate design skills will be considered.
What We Offer
When you join AECOM, you become part of a company that is
pioneering the future . Our teams around the world are involved in some of the most cutting-edge and innovative projects and programs of our time, addressing the big challenges of today and shaping the built environment for generations to come. We ensure a workplace that encourages growth, flexibility and creativity, as well as a company culture that champions
inclusion, diversity and overall
employee well-being through programs supported by company leadership. Our
core values define who we are, how we act and what we aspire to, which comes down to not only
delivering a better world , but working to “make amazing happen” in each neighborhood, community and city we touch. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.

Xe has an exciting opportunity for an experienced Team Lead / Senior Software Engineer in our Christchurch office.
Working closely with our global Product, Operations and Business Teams, Xe offers a collaborative environment where people are encouraged to ask questions and share their specialty knowledge.
Key responsibilities:
Manage and build strong relationships with our Global Development Teams and other key stakeholders to ensure we’re delivering positive strategic outcomes for our business and customers.
Manage both your own and your teams’ time to identify, remove, delegate or escalate impediments that prevent the team from achieving their Sprint goals, whilst contributing technically and ‘jumping in’ to fill any gaps.
Facilitate the technical elaboration of the team’s product backlog.
Collaborate with our Product Team and stakeholders to ensure we are building the right thing the right way; asking probing questions and communicating technical concepts to audiences with varying technical knowledge.
Requirements
Solid experience in a similar role. Financial services experience preferred but not essential.
Demonstrable experience in C#, Relational Databases, JS/Frontend, Oracle, ASP.Net, .Net Core, MVC, Git, Jenkins, Octopus
Good understanding of the SDLC with an emphasis on Lean/Agile principles
Strong communication skills; sharing knowledge and outcomes.
Positive enabler of change; motivated, collaborative, pro-active team player.
Benefits
We pride ourselves on having a fun, friendly working environment, where we’re passionate about our customers, product and services and developing our people.
Xe offers a competitive salary, 10% annual bonus, 1 additional day of annual leave per year (capped at 25 days), discount gym membership, paid birthday off, paid health insurance, fresh fruit, active social club and the opportunity to be part of the Euronet Employee Share Purchase Plan (ESPP).

Who we are
At XE, we live currencies. We provide a comprehensive range of currency services and products, including our Currency Converter, Market Analysis, Currency Data API and quick, easy, secure Money Transfers for individuals and businesses. We leverage technology to deliver these services through our website, mobile apps and over the phone.
Last year, we helped nearly 300 million people access information about the currencies that matter to them and over 350,000 people used us to send money overseas. Thousands of businesses relied on us for information about the currency markets, advice on managing their foreign exchange risk or trusted us with their business-critical international payments.
At XE, we share the belief that behind every currency exchange, query or transaction is a person or business trying to accomplish something important, so we work together to develop new and better currency services that put our customers first.
We are proud to be part of Euronet Worldwide (Nasdaq: EEFT), a global leader in processing secure electronic financial transactions. Under Euronet, we have brought together our three key brands – XE, HiFX and Ria Money Transfer – to become the business that XE is today.
Visit www.xe.com to find out more.

The Desktop Support Engineer role is responsible for providing technical support to the internal users of our end user computing devices and software located in New Zealand. This role will also help support the server and network infrastructure located in the New Zealand Data centre.
A passion for excellent Customer service, professional dedication and being driven to do things right the first time are essential to be successful in the role.
Day to day requirements of this role will include:
Installation and maintenance of workstations, printers, mobile phones, desk phone handsets, computer peripherals, video conferencing hardware, etc including hardware and software upgrades.
Work with vendors for hardware delivery and support.
Software upgrades performed in line with user and project requirements, subject to licensing agreements
Knowledge of the desktop build process and software delivery mechanisms using SCCM 2012.
Software licensing requirements complied with at all times.
Creation and maintenance of user profiles. User profiles created in accordance with security policy and within customers required timeframes.
Provide second level support to internal and external customers to analyse and solve their computer problems as rapidly and effectively as possible.
All incidents logged in the ticketing system.
All calls closed to customer’s satisfaction as quickly and effectively as possible, with regular updates provided during resolution of long calls.
Deliver a high standard of customer service through polite and timely communication to all parties involved in the resolution of a problem.
Required skills are:
Excellent troubleshooting and diagnostic skills
Minimum 2 years supporting desktop and mobile computing environments for 300+ seat sites.
Minimum 2 year of proven experience with SCCM is required.
Knowledge of ConfigMgr 2012 technologies is advantageous
Successful candidate must be able to demonstrate knowledge of deploying OS images and applications using SCCM and troubleshooting deployment issues on the end-point devices
Demonstrated operating knowledge of the following
Windows 7, 10
Microsoft Active Directory
Laptop, desktop, mobile devices
Printing technologies
General knowledge of desktop applications, e.g. Microsoft Office.
Windows 2008/2012
File server administration including NTFS permissions
A solid understanding of LAN/WAN topologies
General communications patching, knowledge of cabling technologies
Ability to work autonomously, and with a remote team

Experience with VMware ESX (2 year min)

Job_title: Xaxis | Client Engagement Director, New Zealand
Summary:
Overview of job
As the Client Development Director, you will be responsible for evangelizing Xaxis outcomes solutions amongst your peers within agencies, and developing deep relationships to ensure optimal adoption of our outcomes business model. You will collaborate with a group of quick-witted co-workers and clients who are all passionate about digital media. You will engage with our clients in professional and social settings, build relationships and define and implement solutions, that make us indispensable to clients.
Reporting of the role
This role reports to the Group M Managing Director, Digital Services
3 best things about the job:
This is a high profile position with a wealth of opportunity for growth both professionally and personally.
Xaxis is at the forefront of local growth and has grown from 1 person to a team of 9 in just two years. Working within the world’s largest programmatic media company empowers you with the support you need to continue this trajectory.
A fun environment that combines the best of being entrepreneurial whilst at the same time being part of the largest marketing services group in the world
Measures of success –
In three months you will:
Fully understand and be able to communicate the Xaxis value proposition and products
Have built strong relationships with your team members and agency peers
Developed your first outcome proposal for existing clients
Led your first internal Xaxis education session with agency peers
In six months, you will have:
Built and refined your tier 1 client engagement strategy to deliver expected targets set by your Managing Director (short & long term).
to be able to present existing and new Xaxis capabilities to existing / new clients
Identify new opportunities via product offerings to grow incremental revenue with client
Worked with your local and regional support team to develop ongoing client and agency educational initiatives
Responsibilities of the role:
Deliver expected revenue targets defined
Work closely with key stakeholders to assess market demand and establish current and future growth potential.
Build marketing and sales engagement strategies to drive Xaxis revenue.
Ongoing agency and client programmatic and outcomes education
Consult and provide proactive programmatic solutions to agency clients / direct clients
Influence and drive adoption of Xaxis programmatic solutions via workshops, training, brainstorm and pitch sessions with agency.
Conduct market competitive analysis and provide feedback to strengthen Xaxis positioning
Conduct analysis on client need and build new local product offerings to drive incremental revenue
Work closely with Xaxis local and regional team to feedback on key client matters (provide meaningful input) and build proposition for local market.
Work closely with Operations and Supply teams locally to ensure smooth roll out of campaigns.
What you will need:
5 years digital media experience mínimum
An ability to connect digital investrjent with clear business outcomes for clients
Advanced knowledge of the programmatic eco system
Proven digital campaign planning credentials
Agency OR digital sales background to include experience of senior/strategic level interaction with customers
Articulate & strong communicator
Polished presentation skills
Fluent with Excel and Powerpoint skills
Experience in delivering against revenue targets or measureable deliverables
Experience in maintaining senior client relationships and overcoming issues and objections to achieve core business objectives
Logical reasoning skills and comfort with numbers
Experience in managing key clients and maintain long term external client relationships
Experience of multiple industry categories and what drives their online advertising success
Strong understanding of online media market, dynamics and competition.
About Xaxis
Xaxis is a global digital media platform that programmatically connects advertisers and publishers to audiences across all addressable channels. Xaxis combines proprietary technology, unique data assets and exclusive media relationships with the brightest team of audience analysts, data scientists and software engineers. Advertisers working with Xaxis achieve higher ROI from digital marketing campaigns. Xaxis works with over 2,700 clients across 34 markets in North America, Europe, Asia Pacific and Latin America. For more information, visit www.xaxis.com.

Data Engineering, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Azure Cloud Solutions
Diversity - Post-Sales liaisons with customer / Data Consulting
Provide high level strategy and data engineering.
An extremely sociable and professional team - highly respected in the market

We are urgently seeking a Senior BI Consultant who can provide a multiple skillset to include high level Data Engineering, Consulting and Post-Sales support to the customers.
The role is also diverse as not only are we seeking a solid Data Engineer type but equally an individual who is well versed in Azure Cloud Solutions, Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning.

This is your opportunity to join our client and act as a major point of contact between the organisation and its many customers within the Business Intelligence & Data domain while working closely with both the key clients and internal Business Directorship team.


This is very much the key role to our client and will be the major focus by them to quickly move your career to a Principal Consultant.




The essential skill base that we see includes:
BI Consulting - a minimum of 10yrs Data Engineering using the MS BI Stack.
Business Intelligence / Data Warehousing - 10yrs as a very minimum commercial experience. Expertise must include providing end to end solutions to 'end client'.
Artificial Intelligence & Machine Leaning - we essentially require existing experience in ML using tools such as Python, Julia or 'R Programming'. Equally existing AI capability using at least one recognised AI or Data Science tool.
Azure Cloud Services - Azure Data Factory / Azure Data Lake
Environment - existing experience of working within a Consulting capacity where you have been very much client focussed and thus providing a technical and business solution (via pre-sales) aligned to the employers needs. This could include Business Intelligence Reporting, Data Integration or Analytics
Visa - please see below (this is a must)



What is in it for you?
A base salary of $150,000 + Benefits
An immediate opportunity to grow within a BI practice.

Please do not hesitate to forward your details via this website - we really are keen to commence the interview procedure immediately.

We expect applicants will already hold one of the following -
- New Zealand - Work Visa
OR
- Australian Residency or Citizenship

For further information, please call Arzel Ramos or Carl Robinson at absoluteIT on 09 302 7024, or apply directly right now by clicking below.

NOTE for Overseas Enquiries and Non NZ Residents: Whereas we welcome international enquiries, only applicants that are legally entitled to work in New Zealand and can make themselves available for interviews in New Zealand will be considered for advertised positions. Others may not necessarily be responded to.

Job_title: SAS Customer Advisory Academy – Pre/Post Sales Associate Systems Engineer
Summary:
Company Overview:

Are you an emerging technologist interested in solving complex business problems? Would you like to be paid to attend an in-person training in Cary, North Carolina USA to learn innovative technologies like cloud infrastructures and big data analysis? If so, this is the opportunity for you!

The SAS Customer Advisory Academy is a 10-week global training program where you will be paid to learn SAS’ technologies and solutions specifically addressing the different cloud infrastructures, including AWS, Google, Azure, Dockers and Kubernetes.
You will receive training in SAS advanced analytics, data management and visualization, as well as learn consultative skills and methodology, product positioning and business practices – ensuring you are well-equipped with the necessary skills to succeed. The training will take place both virtually and at SAS World Headquarters in Cary, North Carolina USA. Candidates hired for this position will participate in the training program beginning in August 2020.
Upon graduation from the Academy, you will begin a role as an Associate Customer Advisor where you will provide technical assistance for software pre-sale and/or post-sale activities utilizing you the skills acquired during training, along with your knowledge of industry segment processes and challenges to do the following:

Primary Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Working with the sales team on technical activities to maximize revenue opportunities and ensure the highest level of customer satisfaction.
Co-operating with sales in developing customer account strategies, assessment of customer needs and critical sales issues to ensure customer satisfaction.
Providing consultative services, including architecture recommendations to support proposed solutions, and possessing technical aptitude to solve complex big data business problems based on SAS core competencies in advanced analytics, data management and visualization.
Translating business requirements into SAS technical solutions and linking to business value.
Identifying appropriate architecture, applications, tools and solutions for targeted accounts.
Preparing technical demonstrations, proof of concepts and presentations based on client needs.
Conducting discovery meetings to collect, analyze, clarify and document business requirements during the sales cycle to support the implementation team and produce a detailed solution proposal.
Developing familiarity with company sales initiatives, product positioning, pricing, proposals and models.
Providing reliable delivery of targeted project results through the application of specific SAS methodologies, projects and technologies.
Installing SAS solutions and any required supporting products for knowledge sharing, demonstration purposes or post-sale implementations as assigned.
Understanding, utilizing and communicating best practice methodologies and industry standards internally and externally.
Essential Skills
Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Management Information Systems, Engineering, or another related quantitative field.
Experience in programming with open source languages such as R, Python, and Lua.
Strong analytical, technical and problem-solving skills.
Academic projects or work experience in information technology, engineering, and/or business analysis.
Significant project and/or internship experience demonstrating individual and team work abilities.
Candidates must be willing to work in Cary, NC, USA for the duration of the Academy program.(10 weeks starting 31st August)
Ability to travel up to 30-40% or as business needs dictate.
Strong written and verbal English language communication skills and fluency.
Strong academic performance.
Preferred Skills
Experience with cloud software or cloud computing such as Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform or Microsoft Azure.
Familiarity with Linux.
Experience in programming with SAS
Why SAS
We love living the #SASlife and believe that happy, healthy people have a passion for life, and bring that energy to work. No matter what your specialty or where you are in the world, your unique contributions will make a difference.
Our multi-dimensional culture blends our different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. Here, it isn’t about fitting into our culture, it’s about adding to it - and we can’t wait to see what you’ll bring.
Check out our #Data4Good efforts to see how we’re using our analytics capabilities to solve humanitarian issues around poverty, health, human rights, education and the environmen. #LI-AS2
Additional Information:
SAS is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

We believe work is not a place, but rather a thing you do. Our technology revolves around this core philosophy. We are relentlessly committed to helping people work and play from anywhere, on any device. Innovation, creativity and a passion for ever-improving performance drive our company and our people forward. We empower the original mobile device: YOU!
What we're looking for:
As a seasoned Principal Corporate Account Manager, you will be the face of Citrix with major commercial accounts in NZ.
Job Summary
You will be driving revenue generation for the entire Citrix portfolio, transforming transactional/opportunistic customer relationships into continuous relationships.
You will engage and orchestrate a team of Citrix and channel partner resources. You will establish and maintain partnerships with customer senior managers, directors and VPs (potentially up to C-suite level). You will create traction in “high potential” large accounts.
You will be defining and executing the strategy for the account, assessing opportunity across suite of Citrix solutions, gathering competitive information (e.g., offerings/locations served by competitor), developing and maintaining action plan for how the account will achieve targets, coordinating action planning across functions within Citrix, (e.g., product specialist, Sales engineer) and Alliance partners (e.g., Cisco) to define offerings for customers.
You will be passionate about your customer’s successful adoption of Citrix technologies in their workplace.
Responsibilities
Covers 15-20 corporate accounts (~175-225K seats)
Establish relationships and engage with the business and IT management level to identify opportunities and sell Citrix products and services direct to existing large and strategic accounts.
Understand their business and IT strategies, priorities and goals.
Carry a revenue quota to meets or exceed sales targets and demonstrate continuous progress towards achieving account strategies.
Interact strongly with customer at the Senior Management level with support on forming a relationship with C level contacts within these accounts. Understand and document customer’s business and IT strategies, priorities and goals
Identify, develop, execute, and maintain account strategies to drive adoption of Citrix products and services revenue within assigned enterprise accounts and their subsidiaries and affiliates.
Establish and lead teams of internal and external resources to identify, pursue, and close specific opportunities consistent with account strategies.
Establish and maintain close relationships with inside sales, systems engineers, consultants, and sales specialists to access and leverage from appropriate internal resources.
Establish and maintain relationships with resellers, system integrators, and any other external partner to develop and achieve account strategies and opportunity plans.
Understand and navigate account procurement practices to successfully negotiate profitable licensing contracts.
Drive prompt resolution of customer issues and ensures high levels of customer satisfaction with Citrix products and services.
Serve as the primary client contact for non-technical or support issues requiring escalation.
Provide regular and efficient updates on assigned accounts to sales management.
Ensure accurate and timely forecasts and management reporting in SalesForce.com.
Assist in securing non-commissionable revenue in assigned accounts (including Subscription Advantage)
Requirements
Minimum of 10 years IT industry sales experience including major accounts
Strong Executive presence
Demonstrate the ability to operate at C-Suite levels in customer organisations
Exceptional communications skills in face to face and written situations
Case study innovation with customers
Strong financial acumen
Discipline with data hygiene in sales tools
Influencing skills
History of overachievement of sales quotas
Basic Qualifications
Typically requires a University Degree or equivalent
#LI-AT2
What you’re looking for:
Our technology is built on the idea that everyone should be able to work from anywhere, at any time, and on any device. It’s a simple philosophy that guides everything we do — including how we work. If you’re in sales, we’ll help you make your numbers and a difference with a brand you can believe in. We want employees to do what they do best, every day.
Be bold. Take risks. Imagine a better way to work. If we just described you, then we really need to talk.
Functional Area:
Corporate Account Manager
About us:
Citrix is a cloud company that enables mobile workstyles. We create a continuum between work and life by allowing people to work whenever, wherever, and however they choose. Flexibility and collaboration is what we’re all about. The Perks: We offer competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits package. You’ll enjoy our workstyle within an incredible culture. We’ll give you all the tools you need to succeed so you can grow and develop with us.
Citrix Systems, Inc. is firmly committed to Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and to compliance with all federal, state and local laws that prohibit employment discrimination on the basis of age, race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, ethnicity, national origin, citizenship, religion, genetic carrier status, disability, pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions, marital status, protected veteran status and other protected classifications.
Citrix uses applicant information consistent with the Citrix Recruitment Policy Notice at https://www.citrix.com/about/legal/privacy/citrix-recruitment-privacy-notice.html
Citrix welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Reasonable accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the job application process, please contact us at (877) 924-8749 or email us at ASKHR@citrix.com for assistance.
If this is an evergreen requisition, by applying you are giving Citrix consent to be considered for future openings of other roles of similar qualifications.

Our purpose
Here at Datacom we connect people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in
The Nitty Gritty
We have over 6,200 people across our global offices, and generate an annual revenue of over $1.2 billion, this makes us one of Australasia’s largest professional IT services companies. We have extensive expertise in operating data centres, providing IT services, software engineering and application management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations. With this comes a long list of significant clients Datacom is committed to hiring, developing and promoting the best talent from a diverse range of backgrounds. We are local at heart, yet world-class in capability.
About the Role
The Platform Lead - Cloud is a hands-on professional technical engineer with responsibilities across a broad range of technologies. They maintain an extensive knowledge of the technologies deployed as well as up to date professional certifications to ensure the delivery of an exceptional service. They are passionate about technology with an innovative approach to solving complex problems. They provide technical leadership and guidance/mentoring as well as providing an escalation point for assisting with the resolution of complex problems. They are customer service focused and are constantly seeking ways to optimize and automate processes to improve quality and reduce cost.
What you’ll bring
Cross skilled and able to support a Cloud System stack comprising of Automation/Orchestration, Hypervisor, Server, Backups, Storage, Network & Application layers.
Extensive knowledge of ITIL: creating and rolling out of processes, change management and project management.
Exposure to DR methodologies, planning and execution.
Understanding of how an outcomes-based contract operates
Extensive knowledge of Virtualised environments running on VMware, Hyper-V or other hypervisors.
Extensive understanding/knowledge of Unified Computing Systems (Cisco UCS Preferred)
General understanding/knowledge of virtualized environments running on VMWare, Hyper-V or other Hypervisors
OR
General understanding/knowledge of virtualized environments running on VMWare, Hyper-V or other Hypervisors
Responsibilities
Compliance with all Datacom Cloud operational and Information Security Management policies, procedures and processes to ensure an exceptional level of quality.
Maintaining awareness and knowledge of current market and industry developments and providing suitable interpretation to Management and relevant staff within the organisation
Developing operational technical process and documentation for new systems and technologies
Creating, implementing, documenting and optimising operational plans, processes and procedures to achieve organisational goals. Empoweringothers with accountability and responsibility to contribute to outcomes and leading change Ensuring all operational Cloud Platform documentation is relevant and up to date
Preparation of monthly reporting for Platform Management
Ongoing management and delivery of the Cloud Platform to agreed OLAs / SLAs including:
Incident management
Change management
Capacity management
Availability
Why you want to join us

At Datacom we believe that doing good, is good for business. We’ve maintained our local family feel whilst expanding globally, across Australia, ASIA, US and the UK. Our brand and reputation depend on ‘proving the promise’ and we aspire to be the trusted advisor for our customers across Government and the private sector from enterprise scale to regional business. We offer our staff a competitive salary package, fantastic perks and benefits like healthcare, life insurance, discounts at local retailers and a supportive, flexible working environment. If you want to join a company making a difference, apply now!

We're Auckland Airport. The chances are you've already met us, driven into or flown out of our airport, or at least know friends or family who have. You may have wondered at times, how it all comes together. The short answer is, it's our people - The Journey Makers. We are all proudly contributing to making journeys better.

Our Business Technology team is entering an exciting period of change as we transform the way we work and deliver technology solutions to the Airport. To help us make this happen, we’re on the lookout for a dynamic and savvy technology professional to join us in the role of Senior Infrastructure Architect.

You will lead the creation and maintenance of overall roadmaps, technical designs and plans, encompassing the (physical or virtual hardware, software, network services and data storage) either on-premises or provisioned as cloud services) that is required to deliver and support the information systems needs of AIAL.

This is a senior role providing leadership in infrastructure and network architecture development and design. We’ll be looking to you to partner closely with the business and our technology vendors to develop the logical technical infrastructure and network architecture for business systems, act as the lead design authority on infrastructure and network design, and ultimately ensure we’re maximising our use and return from our infrastructure and network investments.

You’d be entering an overall new model for technology delivery so this role promises to be packed with challenge, and will really put a stamp on your career!

Is this the role for you?

We’re looking for someone with extensive experience in technology, and at least 3 years under your belt as an infrastructure engineer, designer or architect acting as design authority in a large and complex commercial environment. You’ll also:
have sound knowledge of infrastructure, virtualisation, storage, security, cloud and network architecture
be great at managing stakeholder relationships and understanding business needs
be well up-to-speed on emerging technologies and trends
be commercially savvy and able to ensure robust commercial analysis behind our infrastructure and network investments
have previously worked in a vendor delivery model, holding oversight for vendor activities and delivery to design plans
come to us with hands-on exposure and understanding of ITIL, formal architecture and Devops practices
demonstrate your ability to lead a high performing team
hold the appropriate qualifications in networking, infrastructure architecture, virtualisation, security and storage to complement your experience

Applications for the role closes on the 03 March 2020.

What are you waiting for? If you have what we’re looking for and you’re ready for your next challenge - come join The Journey Makers.

Hewlett Packard Enterprise advances the way people live and work. We bring together the brightest minds to create breakthrough technology solutions, helping our customers make their mark on the world.
Cloud Technology Partners (CTP) is the premier cloud services and Software Company for enterprises moving to AWS, Azure, GCP and other cloud platforms.
We’re not learning a new way of doing things – we’re defining the best way to do them. Our architects and engineers have been crafting, building and implementing IT solutions for enterprise customers across industries for an average of more than 20 years.
We focus solely on cloud-based technologies and are the preferred partner for companies seeking to rapidly achieve high-demand business goals through cloud transformation.
In a typical day as a Cloud Architect, you would..
Position yourself as a trusted advisor to CTP's clients, and partner with them to understand their requirements for cloud implementations.
Provide recommendations to clients with respect to cloud migrations and prepare technical implementation roadmaps for AWS adoption.
Create functional design specifications, reference architectures, and assist with other project deliverables as needed.
Design state-of-the-art technical solutions on AWS that address customer’s requirements for scalability, reliability, security, and performance.
Collaborate with other project teams on technical solutions and help improve CTP's service IP.
Learn, learn, and learn by staying up-to-date on all technical developments related to AWS.
Travel and work onsite at client locations (typically 40%).
WHAT YOU HAVE DONE SO FAR
Obtained a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, other technical field.
Become well versed in building product-quality software on AWS including experience in designing for high availability, building multi-zone and multi-region architectures, and designing across appropriate SQL and NoSQL data layer technologies.
Familiar with various application stacks such as Java, C#, .Net, etc.
Configuration and deployment experience in two or more of the following:
AWS apps technologies such as RDS, ElasticBeanstalk, DynamoDB, RedShift
AWS IaaS Technologies such as EC2, S3, EBS, ELB, VPC, Route 53,
Deployed applications with Web UI frontends
Deployed application with RESTful/SOAP services interfaces
Have significant experience building private AMI’s on VPC’s
Have a firm grasp on cloud security, leveraging Linux and Windows operating systems, using the AWS console and CLI (command line interface).
Have experience as a hands-on technical practitioner/specialist in client facing roles in large enterprises and demonstrated client facing consulting skills, including building strong client relationships.
Excellent verbal, presentation and written communications skills.
Strong team skills including the ability to be a clutch team player.
Join us and make your mark!
We offer:
A competitive salary and extensive social benefits
Diverse and dynamic work environment
Work-life balance and support for career development
An amazing life inside the element! Want to know more about it?
Then let’s stay connected!

https://twitter.com/HPE_Careers
