What you’ll be doing...
Verizon Connect is guiding a connected world on the go by automating, optimizing and revolutionizing the way people, vehicles and things move through the world. Our full suite of industry-defining solutions and services put innovation, automation and connected data to work for customers and help them be safer, more efficient and more productive. With more than 3,500 dedicated employees in 15 countries, we deliver leading mobile technology platforms and solutions.
As a SaaS leader, we know our talent is the most important component to our success. We hire top talent and empower them to do their best work. As a division of Verizon, we combine the fun and excitement of a startup environment with the resources, operational excellence, and brand recognition of an established tech giant.
You will lead a dynamic and successful team in our Christchurch office, continuously adapting and improving our methodologies and technologies to be the best at what we do: provide innovative tracking software to trucking companies all around the world. This team is responsible for maintaining and enhancing two native mobile apps (iOS and Android) as well as a legacy hybrid mobile app, and works closely with the API team and other teams within a wider group focused on regulatory compliance solutions. You will be working primarily with Java, Swift, Kotlin and Typescript.
Writing high-quality code - we expect a Squad Lead to lead by example in every area, none more so than in the hands-on development of our products.
Leading a cross-functional team using code on multiple platforms.
Managing deployments and testing.
Ensuring that the team is actively contributing to and reacting to automation tests.
Ensuring that code written to a high standard and ensuring a robust code review process is in place.
Educating the team on best practices, workflows, and other processes.
Optimising your squad’s specific needs and strengths.
What we’re looking for...
You’ll need to have:
Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience.
Four or more years of relevant work experience.
Experience in agile/lean methodologies and processes (ideally Kanban) leading process improvements and engineering disciplines.
Experience mentoring junior developers.
Experience in measuring and improving performance of production systems.
Knowledge of Object Oriented/SOLID Design principles and practices.
Experience with common patterns in distributed systems (REST, SOA, and DDD).
Knowledge of GIT or related source control technology.
Even better if you have:
A degree in Computer Science or a related field.
Mobile application development experience.
Knowledge of AWS based architectures and services.
Oral and written communication skills, including the ability to effectively present to engineering and product groups.
Ability to lead systems analysis with application design individually and with an architecture team to deliver detailed application specifications.
Ability to lead and guide a team.
Keyword: VZConnect
When you join Verizon...
You’ll have the power to go beyond – doing the work that’s transforming how people, businesses and things connect with each other. Not only do we provide the fastest and most reliable network for our customers, but we were first to 5G - a quantum leap in connectivity. Our connected solutions are making communities stronger and enabling energy efficiency. Here, you’ll have the ability to make an impact and create positive change. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, join our team of the best and brightest. We offer great pay, amazing benefits and opportunity to learn and grow in every role. Together we’ll go far.

About the role
Foodies is on an awesome journey to become a truly customer insights-driven and efficient Co-op, and one that is digitally enabled. We want to be a digital business that continuously exploits digital technologies, blurs digital and physical worlds – creating new sources of value for customers and increasing operational agility and simplicity
Releasing software in-time that meets highest quality standards, is easy to deploy, low on memory, starts fast, scales well and almost never breaks you’ll;
Design, implement and improve our highly-scalable, Java 8 and Java 11 based micro-services in an AWS, Kubernetes cloud centric environment
Write business code that drives our Online customer experience as well as the optimal execution of our most critical Enterprise business processes
Engage with other developers to level up on our engineering and DevOps practice up to selecting the best tools in class
About you
A senior operator, you’ll be passionate about tech, opinionated about software and a fantastic team player who thrives in agile, collaborative environments.
With several successful years in Java (8 or later, ideally in Spring Boot, Maven or REST environments), you’ll know how to deal with Hibernate, Ebean and Spring Data. A technical role – here’s what else you’ll need:
Have Up-to-date knowledge in PostgreSQL with a good amount of exposure to other SQL DBs as well as some NoSQL
Have expert level experience in messaging and integration patterns, ActiveMQ, JMS
To know how to master AWS cloud technologies like S3, SNS, SQS, Lambda and tools like Kubernetes, Docker, Helm, Ansible
To be versed with Git, Bamboo, Maven, Bitbucket, Confluence
Development on a Mac with IntelliJ or alternative IDEs and using the k8s CLI is a no-brainer to you
Driving significant parts of our business, you’ll build awesome user experiences in our digital channels across the digital customer journey.
About us
We’re a team of 22,000 New Zealanders in a growing network of 300+ stores (PAK’nSAVE, New World, Four Square, Gilmours & Fresh Collective). We serve over 1.3 million customers every week in the most awesome little country in the world!

Company Description
Everything’s in place for you to win at Veeam – the global leader in Cloud Data Management. We provide trusted back-up solutions that deliver cloud data management and protection, keeping the world moving for over 360,000 customers including the vast majority of Fortune 500 companies. We’re extremely successful: a billion-dollar company and Leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant that’s won over 170 top industry awards. But we’re always looking forward. Everyone here plays a part in finding new opportunities and winning new deals, and you’ll be backed by a best-in-service product and an unrivalled reputation for delivering customer satisfaction – our net promoter score is 3.5x the industry average.
Ultimately though, we grow together, so we’ll support you fully to be successful in your role. We’ll invest in you through our on-demand learning systems. Mentoring, training and coaching will help you to find your feet, take big challenges in your stride and perform at your best. There are acceleration programmes that could propel you further forward than you imagined. And whether it’s learning additional skills, gaining a new experience or taking the next step in your career, there will be lots of scope for development.
All this in a place where people talk from the heart. We have a culture of focus and excellence. We encourage innovation and iteration. And since our achievements are tangible, we can keep it real and be genuine with each other. We’re inclusive, diverse, open and honest people who collaborate, support each other and have fun together. And we’re nimble enough for people to speak up. We play to win; we’re competitive, hungry and driven, but we remain humble. If that’s you, get ready to do Veeamazing things.

Growth Marketing Manager
We're looking for a world class Growth Marketing Manager to come and join our talented team.
About the team and work environment at Spoke
We have some really awesome humans in our team of engineers, entrepreneurs, customer success, marketing and sales people working across Australia, New Zealand, Asia and growing into the US and UK. We are all passionate about making a meaningful difference in the lives and businesses of our customers in a modern, mobile first way. At Spoke we still have that start-up feel, customer-centric mentality, a culture of innovation, outside the box thinking and heaps of variety in what we do each day.
We are three years young, growing quickly and with the support of our fantastic investors and passionate team are on a stellar trajectory of growth.
What we do
At Spoke Phone we are a mobile first phone system for the modern workplace.
We turn mobile phones into a modern business phone system for small, medium and enterprise size businesses. Built in the cloud, Spoke is a mobile native app that can be setup in minutes and provide the full functionality of an old expensive desk based phone system, all in the palm of your hand. Spoke gives your mobile phone a second business line that truly separates your work life from your personal life. Our app also connects with a growing list of other smart software that businesses use for their teams and customers to ensure contacts are easy to access, capture and action whether your team are at their desks or out on the road.
What you'll do
To support our fast growth, we're expanding our marketing team and are looking for a growth expert, someone who knows their way around user acquisition, retention and revenue increase. Your deep knowledge of the SaaS scene, its trends and tricks means you've got a track record delighting users and stakeholders alike! We want you to take this new role and fly with it, breaking the marketing mould to accelerate the pace at Spoke.
As a Growth Marketing Manager, you will be involved in every step of the funnel and will enjoy the agile and dynamic startup environment, combined with the stability of a well funded and fast-growing organisation.
You'll get to
Work with cross functional teams to establish growth strategies, focusing on conversion of free trial to paid subscriptions.
Partner closely with the Senior Leadership Team to develop and drive the user conversion funnel to help scale our global product.
Partner with Finance and Operations teams on forecasting customer growth and retention.
Assess potential growth experiments with a framework for decision making on priorities/investment/testing/measurement and reporting.
Ensure Spoke has the most efficient tools and processes to drive rapid growth.
Partner closely with Engineering teams to design analytics and monitoring tools including dashboards, reports, and alerts.
Plan and execute growth experiments that aim to achieve a higher conversion rate, including acquisition methods and recommendations for application changes.
Work closely with the product and customer success teams to identify reasons for churn.
Develop and execute creative ways to reduce churn.
Extract insights from research and analytics to make recommendations and execute to the product team.
Manage relationships with agencies that can assist in paid performance-based marketing channels such as social and PPC.
Your background
3-5 years experience in a Growth Marketing function, ideally in SaaS.
A hands-on, roll up your sleeves attitude, building and leading growth initiatives.
Previously worked collaboratively with cross-functional teams to execute projects and reach targets
Demonstrated track record in growth experimentation, funnel optimisation and product analysis.
Created and executed on high impact strategies resulting in subscriber, growth, conversion, and retention.
Created and executed high impact strategies resulting in the reduction of churn.
A love of data.
Deep understanding of integrating marketing channels.
What we need from you
Strong people skills—you will need to demonstrate empathy on a daily basis and constantly adjust your approach based on the customer's specific needs, confidence, and personality
Adaptability—you thrive in a highly collaborative, fast-moving environment, and you enjoy working closely with colleagues from all different backgrounds
Excellent communication skills—verbal and written. The ability to communicate technical topics to non-technical users; and to find out what a customer is really trying to communicate, rather than just hearing and reacting to the words they say
Willingness to take initiative—you need to be creative and curious, and willing to throw out new ideas or suggestions on how to improve
A patient and cheerful nature—you have endless amounts of patience! You do not lose your temper when someone else lacks the understanding you have
Tech-native—you are competent with technology and understand what the “Cloud” and an “API” is
Relational—you have a relaxed, confident manner and the ability to develop excellent customer relationships.
What you can look forward to
The chance to join an innovative and fast-growing tech start-up, led by some key industry folks who have been successful and are doing it all again.
Since the team is small, you'll be involved in helping create and evolve best practices. You will have lots of responsibility, and room to grow as we grow.
You'll be part of a collaborative, high-performing diverse and inclusive team alongside people who will respect, challenge, support and mentor you.
You'll have the chance to work on real projects that directly impact our business. You'll be working for a purpose; you'll see every day how your work directly affects and helps our users.
We see the value in work-life balance, many of us take advantage of our flexible working arrangements, so whether you like to get a surf in before work, like to head home in time to pick up the kids or you just like working from the comfort of your own home now and then, we want to support you.
We trust you to build your career to the best of your ability and we will support your hunger to learn with training and career mentorship, to help you flourish.
To read more about who we are and what we do, have a look at www.spokephone.com (http://www.spokephone.com/)
Instructions for applying:
You must already have the rights to live and work in New Zealand

Job_title: Senior Software Engineer- Christchurch Based Role
Summary:
The Company
Seequent is a world leader in the development of geoscience visualisation software. We have employees in 15 countries across 6 continents and currently have solutions tailored for the Civil Engineering, Environmental, Mining & Minerals, Energy and Government sectors.
Our Leapfrog, Geosoft and GEOSLOPE product suites, optionally combined with our Seequent Central model management solution enable people to create rich stories and uncover valuable insights from geological and geophysical data, and ultimately make better decisions about their earth, environment and energy challenges.
The Role + Opportunity
To support the rapid growth of our business, we are seeking highly motivated Senior Software Engineers to join our Christchurch team. This is a fulltime permanent role based in Christchurch.
Working closely with other developers, designers, product owners and quality assurance representatives, you will be a key member of our development team building our world class products. If you are looking for a technically challenging role developing quality scientific software, then Seequent is for you.

Requirements
You will have:
An interest in science (mathematical or science background)
Brilliance, drive and motivation to work in a highly technical environment
A high level of experience in coding practices and designs
Adaptability – we develop cloud, enterprise and Windows desktop applications using open-source tools; can you keep up?
Excellent collaboration skills
We will encourage you to:
Solve technically challenging problems
Flex your debugging muscles
Experience working with a team of like-minded developers
Unleash your design flair
Use your maths skills every day
Champion the cause of great software

Technology we utilise:
Python, C/C++, TypeScript, ReactJS, Redux, Qt
Ansible, Terraform, PowerShell, Robot Framework
SQLite, PostgreSQL, RabbitMQ
Windows (Windows Services, IIS), Linux
Microsoft Azure, Docker, Kubernetes, Datadog, Sentry
Tools we prefer:
PyCharm, Visual Studio, Visual Studio Code
Atlassian Suite (JIRA, Confluence, etc), Github
TeamCity
Techniques we believe in:
Lean/Agile
In-team domain experts
Continuous Improvement
Flat development team structure
Benefits
Seequent's global team is diverse – we’re geologists, geoscientists, software engineers, salespeople and communication specialists. We’re technical experts who are motivated by the challenges our customers face. We use the experience of our people to solve the highly complex problems of today, and work towards the bigger solutions of tomorrow.
Seequent provides medical insurance, relocation assistance, healthy snacks, an on-site gym, flexible hours and a Christchurch office located right next to Hagley Park.
We offer market competitive salaries and support continuing growth and education.
How to apply
If this sounds like the role for you, apply today through the link with a covering letter and CV.
In your cover letter, please include your:
Right to work in New Zealand (if any)
Notice period in your current role (if applicable)
Location where you are currently based

Job_title: Talent Acquisition / Recruitment Advisor - 12 month contract
Summary:
Creative, collaborative team who want to push the boundaries of sourcing
Flexible working advocates
Global brand, currently ranked in the top 10 of most desirable employers in NZ

We are looking for an experienced Talent Acquisition Recruitment Advisor to join our award winning National team for a 12 month placement. We strive to make an impact that matters in all we do by continuing to push the boundaries of recruitment excellence in New Zealand. Join our market leading team and increase your experience, experimentation and exposure to a wide range of recruitment practices. We really love our applicant tracking system and we continue to automate what we do, if that excites you, then read on...

Here's what you need to know about the role...

You will support business partners nationally, manage the full life cycle of the recruitment process from working alongside the business to building & fostering talent communities, briefing through to placement. Your ability to develop excellent working relationships, influence business partners, candidates and recruitment agencies will be critical to your success in this position.

Our need is for a flexible recruiter who can turn their hand to all of our portfolios, this role requires a generalist who can then hone in when they need to.

You will
Create innovative sourcing tactics/strategies to differentiate Deloitte in the market, working with the business to facilitate a ready pipeline of technology, finance and/or consulting candidates in line with the needs of the business (social media, employee referrals, advertising, networking events and more).
Advise the business on most cost effective and high quality sourcing channels to best meet their unique needs.
Deliver a high-quality service that supports candidates and meets the needs of the business.
Harness data power. Analyse, produce and present reports and metrics to demonstrate time to fill and cost to hire saving as well as other relevant company information and metrics.
Drive best practice across selection processes, global mobility policy etc.
Work in partnership with stakeholders to understand competitor and market intelligence.
Contribute and share ideas on commercial information, talent attraction strategies and process improvement.
Capture the data that we need to meet the needs of the business.

Most of all help us find exceptional talent!
About you
You will be a creative, confident, highly commercial recruitment professional who gets excited about taking our talent acquisition to the next level.
2 years + recruitment experience ideally within the technology or finance space, agency or internal recruiters / sourcing professionals welcome!
Demonstrated success in using creative sourcing techniques, understands the value of networking online and offline to build your personal brand and enhance the brand of the business.
Social engineer, naturally inquisitive, passionate about social recruiting strategies with ability to source using these methods. (LinkedIn, Boolean searching: show us what you can do!)
Empathetic and understands the importance of candidate care
Excellent organisation skills and the ability to prioritise workload with a sense of urgency
Proven ability to influence key stakeholders. Strong interpersonal skills, and the ability to communicate effectively with all levels of the organisation.
A positive & resilient attitude with the ability to cope with ambiguity and proactively develop solutions in a high performance environment.

For a confidential discussion please contact Laura Wiltshier on 09 303 0787 or click apply and start the journey right now!

This role offers you an exciting opportunity to contribute to the success of our 40 strong national Ground Engineering team, to work with and support colleagues from a variety of engineering and environmental disciplines and to assist in the growth of our Ground Engineering and Tunnelling team.
We are looking for an ambitious team player who is looking for an opportunity to assist in the development of innovative, cost-effective and buildable solutions in an environment that is collaborative, stimulating and fast-paced. Your extensive geotechnical consultancy experience, in particular, strong capability in geotechnical studies, investigation, and design for highway earthworks, bridge foundations, retaining structures and strengthened earthworks will add to our teams existing strengths.
Nationally our Ground Engineering team provides one-stop access to services ranging from project management, feasibility studies, detailed design, contract administration and construction supervision for geotechnical works.
You will provide technical support to both internal and external clients to a high level of technical quality, to programme and budget
Utilize your expertise to apply advanced scientific principles, theories, practices and existing technologies develop technical solutions to complex problems
Interpret and record data, conducts analyses, compare findings to relevant studies and local, provincial and national regulations to ensure compliance
Undertake design and reporting of a wide variety of geotechnical works including geological and geomorphological mapping, slope stability, foundations, retaining structures, earthworks and ground improvement
Conduct research and investigation as required.
Plan and organize project studies
Assist in resolving conflicting technical information and unsuitability of standard procedures
Perform complex assignments requiring the development of unique solutions to problems.
May oversee the work of less experienced scientists.
Minimum Requirements
Experienced Geotechnical Engineer with a proven track record in studies, investigations and geotechnical design, in particular for new build transportation infrastructure.
Possess strong problem solving and interpersonal skills.
Strong written and verbal communication skills; the ability to write clear and concise technical reports is essential.
In-depth knowledge and experience of relevant design standards.
Ensures that Health and Safety issues are addressed throughout the life of a project.
In-depth hands-on experience of routinely used geotechnical software including gINT, Slope/W, SLIDE and Plaxis; GIS or Geospatial skills desirable.
In-depth knowledge of a wide variety of ground conditions and of soil and rock design parameter selection; local knowledge and experience is advantageous.
Valid driving licence is essential.
Willing to travel to other offices and sites within NZ is essential, and a willing to consider overseas assignments preferred.
Preferred Qualifications
Geotechnical Engineering are preferred, although Engineering Geologists with appropriate design skills will be considered.
What We Offer
When you join AECOM, you become part of a company that is
pioneering the future . Our teams around the world are involved in some of the most cutting-edge and innovative projects and programs of our time, addressing the big challenges of today and shaping the built environment for generations to come. We ensure a workplace that encourages growth, flexibility and creativity, as well as a company culture that champions
inclusion, diversity and overall
employee well-being through programs supported by company leadership. Our
core values define who we are, how we act and what we aspire to, which comes down to not only
delivering a better world , but working to “make amazing happen” in each neighborhood, community and city we touch. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.

What you’ll be doing...
Verizon Connect is guiding a connected world on the go by automating, optimizing and revolutionizing the way people, vehicles and things move through the world. Our full suite of industry-defining solutions and services put innovation, automation and connected data to work for customers and help them be safer, more efficient and more productive. With more than 3,500 dedicated employees in 15 countries, we deliver leading mobile technology platforms and solutions.
As a SaaS leader, we know our talent is the most important component to our success. We hire top talent and empower them to do their best work. As a division of Verizon, we combine the fun and excitement of a startup environment with the resources, operational excellence, and brand recognition of an established tech giant.
You will lead a dynamic and successful team in our Christchurch office, continuously adapting and improving our methodologies and technologies to be the best at what we do: provide innovative tracking software to trucking companies all around the world. This team is responsible for maintaining and enhancing two native mobile apps (iOS and Android) as well as a legacy hybrid mobile app, and works closely with the API team and other teams within a wider group focused on regulatory compliance solutions. You will be working primarily with Java, Swift, Kotlin and Typescript.
Writing high-quality code - we expect a Squad Lead to lead by example in every area, none more so than in the hands-on development of our products.
Leading a cross-functional team using code on multiple platforms.
Managing deployments and testing.
Ensuring that the team is actively contributing to and reacting to automation tests.
Ensuring that code written to a high standard and ensuring a robust code review process is in place.
Educating the team on best practices, workflows, and other processes.
Optimising your squad’s specific needs and strengths.
What we’re looking for...
You’ll need to have:
Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience.
Four or more years of relevant work experience.
Experience in agile/lean methodologies and processes (ideally Kanban) leading process improvements and engineering disciplines.
Experience mentoring junior developers.
Experience in measuring and improving performance of production systems.
Knowledge of Object Oriented/SOLID Design principles and practices.
Experience with common patterns in distributed systems (REST, SOA, and DDD).
Knowledge of GIT or related source control technology.
Even better if you have:
A degree in Computer Science or a related field.
Mobile application development experience.
Knowledge of AWS based architectures and services.
Oral and written communication skills, including the ability to effectively present to engineering and product groups.
Ability to lead systems analysis with application design individually and with an architecture team to deliver detailed application specifications.
Ability to lead and guide a team.
Keyword: VZConnect
When you join Verizon...
You’ll have the power to go beyond – doing the work that’s transforming how people, businesses and things connect with each other. Not only do we provide the fastest and most reliable network for our customers, but we were first to 5G - a quantum leap in connectivity. Our connected solutions are making communities stronger and enabling energy efficiency. Here, you’ll have the ability to make an impact and create positive change. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, join our team of the best and brightest. We offer great pay, amazing benefits and opportunity to learn and grow in every role. Together we’ll go far.

Industry:Technology & Telecoms

Contract Type:Permanent
Consultant name:Samee Amin

Our purpose
Here at Datacom we connect people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in.
Our team
This is an excellent technical opportunity, joining a fantastic team of peers with a chance to take your career to new heights! You will be part of our extensive Operations business who support each other working collaboratively across locations.
About the Role
Due to a new business initiative, Datacom Operations are seeking a Technical Operations Centre Engineer whose role is to monitor systems including Windows, UNIX, Database and backups in real-time. The Technical Operations Centre Engineer will be able to trouble shoot/triage/resolve events or escalate to the specialist team for resolution if required. The team will be initially be focused on delivering services outside of business hours while we build towards a 24x7x365 rotational basis.
What you’ll do
As Technical Operations Centre Engineer, you will be responsible for but not limited to:
Accepting, prioritising and managing Incidents and Requests
Real-time monitoring of all infrastructure for availability, capacity and performance monitoring and Reporting
Performing compliance activities/tasks e.g. Anti-Virus & Back-up checks
Proactivity identifying potential issues through our health check regime
Completion and monitoring of patching activities
Prompt detection, resolution and escalation of incidents through MIM & Resolver Groups
Exposure to BPC/DR methodologies and planning
Creating & managing change requests and assigned tasks
Proactively working with the team & resolver groups on continuous process improvements
The role involves shift work, so you need to be able to work autonomously or part of small team
You need to be able to think on your feet as some shifts will involve working alone.
What you’ll bring
This is an excellent opportunity for someone looking to grow their career within a brand-new team. We are looking for someone with 2-5 years' IT experience, preferably within an IT service management environment. You will hold tertiary qualifications in IT, Computer Science or a related discipline.
To excel in this role, you will have clear communication skills, great attention to detail and good time management. You will be able to produce accurate and concise technical and process documentation.
Please note that to be considered for this position you will need to be an NZ Permanent Resident at a minimum due to the clearances our customers require.
The Nitty Gritty
We have over 6,500 people across our global offices and generate an annual revenue of over NZ $1.2 billion annually. This makes us one of Australasia’s largest professional IT services companies.

We have extensive expertise in operating data centres, IT services, software engineering and application management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations.
With this comes a long list of significant clients and Datacom is committed to hiring, developing and promoting the best talent from a diverse range of backgrounds to serve those clients.
We are local at heart, yet world-class in capability.

Who is RUSH?
We are an integrated design + technology studio.
We're a squad of strategic thinkers, empathetic designers and technical mavericks.
We’re united by our love of technology and its potential for making lives better. Some of us are big picture thinkers, some of us creatively driven. And some of us love nothing more than deep diving into a thorny technical challenge. But we’re all human, inspired by human stories and driven by a desire to create human-centred experiences.
We're chasing down the future. We design and engineer exciting new ways to engage with the world's challenges, big or small. Sometimes they're business challenges, sometimes they're about being better humans. But we get the same rush from taking them on.
Love making things for people to enjoy? Join the team designing the technology that matters.
What matters to us?
Put people first - It's about the people, not the tech.
Push the boundaries - Who wants to do what's been done already?
Play the long game - We create sustainable solutions, not quick fixes.
Say it like it is - Life's too short for miscommunication.
Live for the RUSH - Nothing's more exciting than the rush of doing and discovering.
Requirements
We are looking for someone with a background in leading and mentoring a team who can work closely with the team to ensure they are upskilling and developing their skills as BA's.
We are looking for someone who has:
Proven track record in a Business Analyst / Product Analyst/ Product Owner role
Ideally a technical / IT background with experience in UX, Development, Testing or Analytics
Management of the team of Business analysts, managing resourcing, escalations, recruitment and team development.
Leading the Rush BA practice, defining the BA strategy, approach and handling project resourcing and support demands across the the different project teams.
Attention to detail to create high quality user stories, use cases, data models, workflows with multiple context scenarios
Able to apply agile analysis techniques specifically for defining and creating user stories and acceptance criteria
Experience of using analysis tools & techniques including wireframes and business process modelling
Well versed with reading and writing specifications and test cases – strong evidence of having drafted or analysed APIs/Web Services
Experience of using work management tools such as Jira and Confluence
Excellent presentation skills, with prior experience presenting to senior managers within a business
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Ability to challenge effectively at all levels, and confident pushing back where required for optimal and balanced outcomes between cost, time and quality
Confident with all aspects of consumer experience mapping, business process analysis and requirements elicitation
The ability to plan and work flexibly to multiple deadlines
Solid experience of Agile delivery techniques, particularly utilising Scrum frameworks
Previous product analysis experience gained either in house or within a consultancy
Previous experience designing digital customer experiences, across channels
Strong stakeholder management techniques and with a demonstrable track record
Passion for working collaboratively within and thriving in a multi-disciplinary team environment
Experience of market leading technology packages e.g. content management, eCommerce, search, social, mobile
Bonus skills & experience
Judgement: Digital product teams are empowered to make strong data-driven decisions, but as a successful Product Analyst you’ll also know when it is important to seek support or other viewpoints.
Drive: You’ll be working with and facilitating sessions with a team of bright, energetic specialists. The right person will have plenty of drive to keep the team moving smoothly, looking ahead to remove/resolve any potential obstacles/dependencies in good time.
Influence: Some problems are best solved with others. By involving others in problem solving, we often bring people together. The successful candidate will be able to spot potential barriers to success, and have experience in using soft skills to break these barriers down.
Benefits
What's The Company Culture Like? What Are The People Like?
Put simply, our office culture is awesome!

It has a start-up buzz, it's youthful, we have lots of social events, we have cake days, fruit days, lunch put-on frequently - put simply, we have a lot of fun together. We also invest in your ongoing training and development with regular goal-setting, group training, lunch and learns and personalised development plans.

We have a very flat structure. You can spark up a conversation with the CEO or anyone in senior management and they'll treat you like family. No staff politics. Not egos, no BS. I promise!
If you've read this far, you're probably interested in the job. If you meet the criteria, want to supercharge your career and work in an environment that cares more about you than your mum does, APPLY FOR THE ROLE - we want to meet you!

Applications are open for a very short time. We'll be making a decision fast so spruce up your CV and send it over - but if you are organised, it will be updated already!
PLEASE NOTE: We have a shut down period between 24th December and 13th January. If you don't hear from us before this period then we will be in touch in the new year.

About the Role

They maintain a deep knowledge of the technologies deployed as well as up to date professional certifications to ensure the delivery of an exceptional service. They are passionate about technology with an innovative approach to solving complex problems. They are customer service focused and are constantly seeking ways to optimise and automate processes to improve quality and reduce cost.
What you’ll bring
A deep understanding of Enterprise Storage platforms (EMC preferred), fibre channel switching infrastructure (Cisco preferred) and associated Management platforms
Cross skilled and able to support a Cloud System stack comprising of Automation/Orchestration, Hypervisor, Server, Backups, Storage, Network & Application layers.

Why you want to join us
At Datacom we believe that doing good, is good for business. We’ve maintained our local family feel whilst expanding globally, across Australia, ASIA, US and the UK. AskNicely is a fast growing, funded SaaS startup built (literally) on customer happiness - check out our reviews on G2 Crowd. We are seeking diverse applicants for a software developer role. Degrees and formal qualifications are nice to have, but relevant experience is more important.
Helping businesses grow faster by improving their customer experience is our mission and the key to our success. We are moving at a fast pace to deliver the world's most loved Net Promoter Score software to a global market and are looking for an enthusiastic software developer who enjoys being part of the solution for a range of customers.
You'll be familiar with Saas web apps or mobile apps, know how to orchestrate data centers, and be comfortable with production operations. We're using AWS, Terraform, Packer, Ansible, and Puppet. Services run on Linux, PHP, Nginx, EC2, MySQL, Elasticsearch, and Redis, and Jenkins does our CI/CD multiple times a day. We're eager to use the right tools for the job, whether it be Datadog, Loggly, PagerDuty, or something else. If you haven’t used these exact systems but have experience in similar tech, please apply.
As a senior engineer you will be comfortable with taking the lead on projects, ensuring the other team members have clear direction and understanding of what matters. You will want to mentor other members on the engineering team to help them develop and grow their skills.

Requirements:
Be you.
The core essence of AskNicely is "appreciation". It's what we stand for and a principle to guide what we do each day. We appreciate different backgrounds, different contributions, different backgrounds, different points of view and, most importantly, each other. It's how we win, together. We check our egos at the door and approach our work with curiosity because we don't have all the answers but we learn fastest together and celebrate our wins along the way. You're awesome. We're hiring.

The team we’re building will have people who are:
Diverse in race, gender, and background;
Comfortable working in multicultural environments;
Diverse in skills: initially generalists and later specialists;
As able to effectively share ideas as receive those of others;
As able to support as to challenge;
Supporting the successful testing and deployment of their software, not merely coding and throwing over the wall;
Understanding that people are the most important part of technology.
Benefits:
If, like us, you put a lot of value in culture, lifestyle and opportunity as well as benefits, you'll like what's on offer here (watch this).

Lot’s of people ask about the culture at AskNicely. There are three non-negotiables to what we call “living in the purple”:
Be NICE: We believe a great business can be built by nice people that are nice to each other.
Play to WIN: Bring your "A" game. We have high standards but favor speed over perfection.
Love your FEEDBACK: Get feedback to improve your game and give feedback generously to help others improve theirs.
We offer a comprehensive benefits package including share options, programs for learning and development, community and wellness plus 5 “Nice Days” each year which you can take at any time to catch your breath, just because : )
Plus, we're proud to be another New Zealand technology company taking on the world, we have offices in Auckland, Portland, OR ( USA ) and Amsterdam. This role is based on our Auckland office, but you'll be helping Kiwis to take on the world.

Be You

We appreciate different backgrounds, different contributions, different points of view and, most importantly, each other. It's how we win, together. Job_title: Technical Account Manager - Come Build with Us
Summary:
Experience in a similar role as a Technical Consultant, Solutions Architect, Platform Engineer, Systems Engineer, Cloud Architect, Devops Engineer, Infrastructure Lead etc.
Understand operational parameters and troubleshooting for at least two of the following: Compute, Storage, Networking, CDN, Databases, DevOps, Big Data and Analytics, Security, Applications Development
Internal enterprise or external customer-facing experience with the ability to clearly articulate to small and large audiences

Do you have a technical background and looking for a flexible role where you can help businesses scale in the cloud?

At Amazon, our vision is to be earth’s most customer-centric company. In 2006, we launched Amazon Web Services, giving customers access to the same cloud technology we built to serve millions of shoppers on Amazon.com. Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a secure cloud services platform, offering computing power, database storage, content delivery, and other functionality to help millions of businesses scale and grow.

The Role

As a Trusted Advisor you’ll have a direct impact in helping our customers gain the most value from cloud technology. You’ll craft and execute strategies to drive our customers’ adoption and use of AWS services. Our Technical Account Managers (TAMs) partner with some of the most iconic businesses in the country. These range from rising startups building their business from scratch through to large enterprises going through significant transformation.

You’ll provide advice on architecture, support, project, and launch planning as well as ongoing operational issues. Watch these short videos about life as a Technical Account Manager (https://bit.ly/2AivWrM) and hear from our ANZ Head of Enterprise Support - Sarah Farrell (https://bit.ly/2Xzct0W).

Responsibilities include: -
You’ll build solutions, provide technical guidance and advocate for the customer
Ensure AWS environments remain operationally healthy whilst reducing cost and complexity
Develop trusting relationships with customers, understanding their business needs and technical challenges
Using your technical acumen and customer obsession, you’ll drive technical discussions regarding incidents, trade-offs, and risk management
Consult with a range of partners from developers through to managers
Collaborate with AWS Solutions Architects, Business Developers, Professional Services Consultants, and Sales Account Managers
With a bias for action, you'll proactively find opportunities for customers to gain additional value from AWS
Provide detailed reviews of service disruptions, metrics, detailed prelaunch planning
Being part of a wider Enterprise Support team you’ll provide post-sales, consultative expertise
Solve a variety of problems across different customers as they migrate their workloads to the cloud
Uplift customer capabilities by running workshops, brown bag sessions, etc.
Longer term, you will have the chance to further develop your technical, consulting and leadership skills as we continue to grow the team. You’ll develop your knowledge of AWS services, have the opportunity to gain further certifications as well as receive mentorship. In your first 90 days you’ll receive hands on training to set you up for success!

Our TAMs work autonomously with a focus on customer outcomes. You’ll spend time between the office and customer sites as well as have the opportunity to work from home.

Culture

At Amazon Web Services, we don't mind being called "peculiar." We have our own way of doing things. We're obsessed with customers, we see beauty in simplifying the complex, and we're comfortable with being misunderstood. That might sound unorthodox, but our unusual approach and our culture - focused on removing obstacles so builders can build - are part of why our people enjoy working in AWS.

We’re passionate about supporting the needs of our people and their family members. Benefits include Medical Cover, Employee Assistance Programs and Global Mobility opportunities.

What if I’m not an expert in all qualifications? That’s okay here at as we have training programs to teach any level. We hire smart people who can dive deep. We’re more interested in the areas that you do know instead of those you haven’t been exposed to yet.

We are an equal opportunity employer and embrace diversity at Amazon. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

For a medium sized company in Auckland CBD we are looking for a Technical Product Analyst who can be the middleman between the customers, account managers and software engineers. Someone that loves data, is SQL savvy and able to make the role their own by taking ownership of problems passed on to them and can put a workflow in place to solve them with the help of the software engineering team.

The company culture is relaxed but switched on, you are in charge of your own results - work for outcomes and solutions. You'll be free to create processes in this position and bring initiatives to the leadership team to implement.

This is not the general help desk position, neither the general data analyst position. This role actually allows you to go above and beyond and really shape it as how you think it should look like. What would help is an understanding of software engineering and data plus thinking from a clients perspective.

What would set you apart?
Project coordination experience
SQL skills
Customer management
Passion for solving technical puzzles
Workflow management
Data understanding
What are we looking for?

A unicorn really however if you are passionate about solving technical puzzles, love communicating with people, have experience in the software development space and SQL skills it's absolutely worth applying.

This role would suit someone with any technical degree, a good few years working experience within the data support or data helpdesk support or software development support space and exposure in a professional customer focussed environment.

If you would like to further explore this role or talk about other relevant opportunities in the analytics space and big data space, please contact Richard van Ark on 093360347. To be considered for this role immediately, please submit your CV (MS Word format) via the "Apply Now" button.
At Randstad, we are passionate about providing equal employment opportunities and embracing diversity to the benefit of all. We actively encourage applications from any background.
It is required that you are a resident or citizen

Job_title: HRIS Project Manager - Contract - 3-5 days / week / 4 months
Summary:
The Company
Seequent is a world leader in the development of data visualisation software. We have employees in 15 countries across 6 continents and currently have solutions tailored for the Civil Engineering, Environmental, Mining & Minerals, Energy and Government sectors.
Our product suites enable people to create rich stories and uncover valuable insights from geological and geophysical data, and ultimately make better decisions about their earth, environment and energy challenges.

The Role and Opportunity
To support the rapid growth of our business, we are seeking a highly motivated Project Manager with experience managing the implementation of cloud-based HR Information Systems.
You will be responsible for project managing the implementation of cloud-based Cornerstone Ondemand from the client side, working closely with our implementation partner and internal HR team.
This is a brand new implementation; we are not migrating from an existing HRIS. The project starts in mid-March and continues until Jul/Aug, and will be implementing the Core and Recruitment and Onboarding modules of Cornerstone, with further extensions a possibility.
This contract is for between 3-5 days per week depending partly on project timings, but also on your ability to get hands-on with the implementation. The ideal candidate would additionally have some SME or hands-on experience designing, configuring or testing HR Information Systems, but this is not a minimum requirement.
Requirements
In this role, you will have the opportunity to:
Project manage the implementation from scratch of Cornerstone Ondemand from the client side
Build relationships with Seequent staff and our implementation partner to ensure the programme meets the agreed scope, budget, schedule, and quality
Coordinate Seequent's team, delegate and monitor project tasks and report within governance requirements
Assist with design, system administration, and change management where appropriate


In order to be successful in this role, you should have:
Experience project managing the implementation of at least one cloud-based HR Information System
Experience implementing a 'single source of truth' for HR data (either payroll or HRIS)
Experience implementing an HRIS in a multinational environment
A pragmatic approach to cloud-based systems implementation which allows for flexible MVP-style design and rapid deployment
Benefits
Seequent's global team is diverse – we’re geologists, geoscientists, software engineers, salespeople and communication specialists. We’re technical experts who are motivated by the challenges our customers face. We use the experience of our people to solve the highly complex problems of today, and work towards the bigger solutions of tomorrow.
You will enjoy a competitive rate and be part of a fast-paced, innovative and agile organisation working on a complex global implementation of a leading cloud-based HRIS.
How to apply
If this sounds like the role for you, apply today through the link with a CV.
For more information please contact Thomas Liberty on thomas.liberty@seequent.com

We have extensive expertise in operating data centres, providing IT services, software engineering and application management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations. With this comes a long list of significant clients Datacom is committed to hiring, developing and promoting the best talent from a diverse range of backgrounds. We are local at heart, yet world-class in capability.
About the Role
The Capacity Manager ANZ is responsible for the for creation and monitoring of the overall Capacity Management Strategy, practices, thresholds and frameworks in use across the Datacom Cloud Group in ANZ. They will be responsible for setting the strategy and implementation of these practices. They are a member of the Datacom Cloud Operations team and they will work with a team of Cloud Platform engineers, architects and 3rd party vendors to design, own, manage and educate the capacity process for all Datacom Cloud platform services.
What you’ll bring

Knowledge in the following technologies:
VMware VCP (Cloud Management and Automation/Datacentre/Network Virtualisation and/or VCAP certified
OR
VNX, Symmetrix/Vmax, XtremIO or Data Domain
As well as:
Minimum 10 years’ experience working as a Capacity Manager/Lead in an Enterprise environment.
Experience operating a highly available platform with rigorous availability and planned downtime targets.
Experience working in an ITIL aligned environment.
Proven experience in leading change and implementing frameworks
Responsibilities
Developing effective working relationships with other members of the team and 3rd party vendors across Australia and New Zealand to ensure the best outcome for Datacom cloud services
Facilitating the provision of sound consulting advice to the customer as required, and assisting them in the identification of solutions for their identified business requirements.
Overall ownership of the Design, implementation and ownership of capacity processes and solutions across all Datacom cloud platforms in Australia and New Zealand.
End to end ownership and management of internal and third-party suppliers to ensure successful outcomes.
Building and maintaining internal and external contacts network.
Work with Australia and New Zealand teams to create, improve and own structures and processes to ensure capacity process are streamlined, documented and understood.
Why you want to join us

At Datacom we believe that doing good, is good for business. We’ve maintained our local family feel whilst expanding globally, across Australia, ASIA, US and the UK. Our brand and reputation depend on ‘proving the promise’ and we aspire to be the trusted advisor for our customers across Government and the private sector from enterprise scale to regional business. We offer our staff a competitive salary package, fantastic perks and benefits like healthcare, life insurance, discounts at local retailers and a supportive, flexible working environment. If you want to join a company making a difference, apply now!

Job_title: Senior Technical Account Manager - Come Build with Us
Summary:
Experience in a similar role as a Senior Technical Consultant, Solutions Architect, Platform Engineer, Systems Engineer, Cloud Architect, Infrastructure Lead, Operations Manager, Devops Lead etc.
Understand operational parameters and troubleshooting for at least four of the following: Compute, Storage, Networking, CDN, Databases, DevOps, Big Data and Analytics, Security, Applications Development
Internal enterprise or external customer-facing experience with the ability to clearly articulate to small and large audiences

Do you have a technical background and looking for a flexible role where you can help businesses scale in the cloud?

About Us
At Amazon, our vision is to be earth’s most customer-centric company. In 2006, we launched Amazon Web Services, giving customers access to the same cloud technology we built to serve millions of shoppers on Amazon.com. Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a secure cloud services platform, offering computing power, database storage, content delivery, and other functionality to help millions of businesses scale and grow.

The Role

As a trusted advisor you’ll have a direct impact in helping our customers gain the most value from cloud technology. You’ll craft and execute strategies to drive our customers’ adoption and use of AWS services. Our Technical Account Managers (TAMs) partner with some of the most iconic businesses in the country. These range from rising startups building their business from scratch through to large enterprises going through significant transformation.

You’ll provide advice and support on using AWS Services and best practices, architecture, project and launch planning as well as ongoing operational issues.. In this senior role, you will have an opportunity to impact organization wide processes and roadmaps, directly influencing how customers are use AWS in the long term.

Watch these short videos about life as a Technical Account Manager (https://bit.ly/2AivWrM) and hear from our ANZ Head of Enterprise Support - Sarah Farrell (https://bit.ly/2Xzct0W).

Responsibilities include:-

Enable C-suite executives to embrace agility and deliver high impact transformation
Lead and sponsor customer enablement programs that uplift our customer's capabilities
Communicate transformational concepts to executive decision makers
Own and define the technical strategy including establishing metrics, governance forums etc.
Build solutions, provide technical guidance and advocate for the customer
Ensure AWS environments remain operationally healthy whilst reducing cost and complexity
Foster trusting relationships with customers, understanding their business needs and technical challenges
Lead technical discussions with senior leadership regarding incidents, trade-offs, and risk management
Collaborate with AWS Solutions Architects, Business Developers, Professional Services Consultants, and Sales Account Managers
Being part of a wider Enterprise Support team you’ll provide post-sales, consultative expertise
With a bias for action, you'll proactively find opportunities for customers to gain additional value from AWS

Longer term, you will have the chance to further develop your technical, consulting and leadership skills as we continue to grow the team. You’ll develop your knowledge of AWS services, have the opportunity to gain further certifications as well as receive mentorship. In your first 90 days you’ll receive hands on training to set you up for success!
Our TAMs work autonomously with a focus on customer outcomes. You’ll spend time between the office and customer sites as well as have the opportunity to work from home.

Culture

At Amazon Web Services, we don't mind being called "peculiar." We have our own way of doing things. We're obsessed with customers, we see beauty in simplifying the complex, and we're comfortable with being misunderstood. That might sound unorthodox, but our unusual approach and our culture - focused on removing obstacles so builders can build - are part of why our people enjoy working in AWS.

We believe in supporting the needs of our people and their family members. Benefits include Medical Cover, Employee Assistance Programs and Global Mobility opportunities.

What if I’m not an expert in all qualifications? That’s okay here at as we have training programs to teach any level. We hire smart people who can dive deep so we’re more interested in the areas that you do know instead of those you haven’t been exposed to yet.

As an equal opportunity employer we embrace diversity and inclusion at Amazon. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

Job_title: Senior Full Stack Software Engineer | React, Java & AWS
Summary:
Our Purpose
Here at Datacom we connect people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in.

Our Team
The Enterprise Software Engineering team is part of our Professional Services (Software) group. We provide high value custom software solutions and consulting services to leading Australasian businesses. We create web, Java, AWS and opensource stack solutions of every size, but always crucial to the client’s operations.
Our mission is to deliver the best business value, without compromising quality, by engaging closely with our clients and fully understanding their requirements. With specialists in business analysis, architecture, development, testing and project management we are able to design and build leading solutions for any business challenge or opportunity.

The Role
You’ll find a refreshing variety of work here; we do everything from boutique websites, through to large bespoke work. We have teams who specialise in every area of tech, so you can learn from the best. You’ll also find that you are involved in the full SDLC, from presales and RFP stage through to delivery.
Skills and Requirements
A confident technical Java background (e.g. SpringMVC, SpringBoot) and experience with microservices and industry best practices
Experienced in modern JavaScript frameworks such as React, Angular and Node.js
Good understanding of data stores (e.g. relational, NoSQL, static) and good understanding of when to use what
Proven track record of building, deploying and looking after production grade software solutions using modern delivery systems and source control (e.g. Logging, Caching, Security, Monitoring, CI/CD)
Experience in continual business process improvements through incremental changes (DevOps)
Public Cloud exposure (e.g. cloud native architecture on AWS/Azure) and exposure to containerisation and working at the Operating System level (e.g. scripting on Unix/Linux/Windows) is a bonus
We’re a far cry from the daily grind of a typical dev shop, with internal team challenges such as the internal innovation competition (DATACOMP), hosted and judged by our CEO, through to dev camp retreats, regular internal learning events and career boot camps. We attract and retain talented, passionate developers who are creative and love what they do.

What you'll bring
With 7+ years as a Full stack developer, you will be confident developing in Java, HTML, JavaScript and cloud PaaS offerings. You should have knowledge about today’s major platforms (Angular, React, AWS through to the zen of DevOps) and know how to code and deliver effectively as a team using agile methodologies. You have a passion about technology and an unrelenting desire to learn and grow, and that's where we can help.
With our team you’ll thrive in the work hard, play hard environment and you’ll be pushed to challenge yourself producing applications and systems that help some of NZ’s most high-profile businesses stay competitive and ahead of the game.
With our scale you’ll be able to move across teams and work on new and interesting work as we continue to grow. You’ll also work alongside highly capable and experienced seniors who will provide the challenges and mentoring that you need to keep moving forward. With the size of Datacom and the amount of work we do there are plenty of opportunities and support to grow your career with us.

About us
At Datacom you'll be recognised and valued for your contributions. We’re growing year on year and can provide stability, opportunity and a collegial, flat-structured environment that’s rare in a company of our size. Rather than taking direction, you will be part of the team that is evolving and growing a business.

The Nitty Gritty
We have over 6,200 people across our global offices, and generate an annual revenue of over $1.2 billion, this makes us one of Australasia’s largest professional IT services companies. We have extensive expertise in operating data centres, providing IT services, software engineering and application management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations. With this comes a long list of significant clients Datacom is committed to hiring, developing and promoting the best talent from a diverse range of backgrounds. We are local at heart, yet world-class in capability.
